loans.name: Guillermo Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro es un joven que tiene una discapacidad en el lado derecho de su cuerpo, el es soltero y vive con sus padres y se dedica a la ganadería y trabaja en un tractor en trabajos de agricultura, Alejandro comenta que tiene un poco de dificultad  en el  manejo del tractor pero con paciencia y perseverancia si lo logra. Alejandro con el crédito va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para tenerla en un terreno que tiene su padre, Alejandro comenta que es su madre quien le apoya en el ordeño de sus vacas. Alejandro dice que su incapacidad no le impide trabajar, su aspiración es seguir sobrellevando su enfermedad y luchar por su vida.
texts.en: Alejandro is a young man who has a disability on the right side of his body. He is single and lives with his parents and works raising livestock, and drives a tractor for farming jobs. Alejandro comments that driving the tractor is a bit difficult for him, but with patience and perseverance he is able to do it. Alejandro will use the loan to buy a cow to keep on some land his father owns. Alejandro says his mother helps him take care of his cows. Alejandro says that his disability does not prevent him from working, he hopes to continue to overcome his disability and strive for a better life.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Salahudin

texts.en:
Salahudin is a 40-year-old married person. He is living happily with his family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

He owns a medical store in which he sells types of medicines. His medical store is near a medical clinic. Most of the customers are referred by the doctor of that clinic towards his medical store. Most of the medicines are unavailable due to high cost.

Salahudin knows that he could earn maximum profit if he offered these missing medicines. Therefore he has requested a loan for his medical store; he hopes that he would be able to buy more medicines so that he could earn maximum profit. 

Salahudin is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of medicines for his own medical store

loans.name: Majid

texts.en:
Majid is the age of 25 years and living in Lahore, Pakistan. He has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap biscuits, etc. 

He manages his household necessities from his own store as well. Some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an even  tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. 

Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relation with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business is running well. 

Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore he requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc.

He gives thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of buy more stock of wheat, to buy rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc.,  for his own general store

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JUAN DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Carmen se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias y mercados, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "San Juan de Ollantaytambo".  The bank is located in the Ollantaytambo district, in the Urubamba province and department of Cusco.

The member, Carmen, makes a living raising small animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  She fattens and grows them, and later sells them in the different fairs and markets.  Carmen works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m., and has five years of experience with this business.  It is going very well.  

Carmen's dream is to have a business location where she can sell the animals.  She asks for the loan in order to buy guinea pigs and chickens.  She is happy for the loan and promises to complete the repayments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university fees for this semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice, beans, maize flour and cooking oil for use in the business to attract more customers as well as increase his income and support his family.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a developing area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to open other branches within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will meet her family's financial needs. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
She is Michelle. For seven years now, she has been managing her own sari-sari store together with her husband, Perry. Their summed up income helps them to survive every day’s needs and expenses. 

Having faithfully paid back her previous loan amounting to PHP 11,000, she would respectfully like to avail another loan worth PHP 13,000, which she will use to purchase more grocery items like shampoo, biscuits, condiments, and other related products. Surely, this will help her improve her profit in a short time. By now, she sincerely lets you know her thanksgiving for your deep rooted generosity and kindness. 

Someday, Michelle dreams of being successful with the current inventory for her to be able to buy a house for her family and for her mother. Someday, she would also like to have her own food stall and restaurant. By then, she will be able to earn for her children’s education. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries for her store.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 65 años de edad, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales solo uno de ellos vive con ella y es discapacitado, el esposo de Margarita se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. Margarita se dedica a la ganadería y crianza de chanchos desde hace 40 años atrás, Margarita es una señora muy responsable con sus pagos y con su familia, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para incrementar en sus chancheras, lo que Margarita aspira es seguir adelante en su negocio para tener una vida digna y apoyar a su hijo que tiene esta discapacidad.
texts.en: Margarita, 65 years old, is married with six children. One of her children still lives with her, she is disabled. Margarita's husband works in agriculture and raises livestock. Margarita has worked raising livestock and pigs for forty years, she is very responsible about making payments on time and with her family. She will use the loan to buy pigs to raise. Margarita hopes to move ahead with her business, to have a better life and support her disabled daughter.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Justice A Group

texts.fr: Katembo est une commerçante, trésorière du  collectif de crédits «Justice A», âgée de 34 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants tous vont à l’école. Elle est vendeuse  des pagnes au marché  de la  ville depuis 2 ans. Elle commença ses business par de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter  dix pièces de pagnes. Ainsi, elle compte acheter une parcelle, construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien  apporté aux femmes entrepreneuses exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Katembo is a retailer and the treasurer of the "Justice A" credit group. She is 34 years old, married and the mother of 4 children who all attend school. She has been selling pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African cloth) at a market in town for 2 years. She started her business with funds she received from her husband. She is requesting a loan from Hekima so that she can grow her business. She will buy 10 pieces of pagnes. She would like to buy a plot of land, build a house and ensure that her children are fed and educated. She thanks Hekima for the support it gives to female entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy 10 pieces of pagnes.

loans.name: Iqbal

texts.en:
Iqbal  is 50 years old, a married woman. She is a mother of three children. She has been doing a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. 

She needs to expand her business for the betterment of the family members. Now she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. 

She desires to improving her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Gul  Shafa

texts.en:
Gul Shafa is a 29-year-old married woman and the mother of three children.  Her husband (also shown in the photo) deals in a poultry business to bear their household expenditures. He makes a good amount to contribute to the family income.

For the improvement of her husband’s business, Gul Shafa has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to build a shed roof for hens and to purchase a stock of feed for them. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to build a shed roof for hens and to purchase a stock of feed.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a  Kiva borrower. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. 

Esther operates a retail business where she sells detergents. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are hotels and schools. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy materials for making detergents. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy materials for making detergents

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as honest. 

Rachel operates a dairy farm. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are of all kinds. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. She will use the KES 55,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to have more dairy cows within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a good life. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her farming activity by spraying plants with herbicides and insecticides to reduce rates of infection and increase productivity.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia would like you to know her full appreciation and thanksgiving because her previous loan has indeed helped her in buying additional products for her business. She faithfully repaid an amount of PHP 15,000 which she had used in buying additional merchandise products.  

Aside from her buy and sell business, she also runs a PisoNet (computer rental) business. With this, she is humbly requesting for another PHP 35,000 which she will utilize to sustain this business.Preferably, she would like to acquire more computer units for this. Through this, she will be able to gain an increase in her daily profit. 

In some time at the future, she wants to be successful and to be able to earn for her children's education and bring them through college. If they finish studies someday, it will be a great security for better lives ahead. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional computer units needed for her business.

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is 40 years old; she is a strong person, expressive person who has made her dream come true.

She has dreamed of opening her own business since her childhood. When she and her children were suffering poor living conditions, she decided to make her dream come true and opened her own beauty salon with her sister. She named it after her youngest child, who has suffered from a disease since her birth.
 
Ola wants to increase her income to be able to provide treatment for her daughter and educate her kids; therefore she decided to apply for a loan to buy more supplies and to do promotion for her salon to attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy more supplies and to do promotion for her salon to attract more customers

loans.name: Rifat

texts.en:
Rifat is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been in a business of beauty parlor for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Over the time she has attained a list of regular customers and makes enough to contribute in the family income. 

She needs to deal with more customers time after time. That is why she has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. It will allow her to purchase combs, hair straightener, make up kits, and cleansers for treating many customers at a time to earn more revenue for running her household activities efficiently.  

She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase combs, hair straightener, make up kits, and cleansers for treating many customers at a time.

loans.name: Symphonie Group

texts.fr: Ntumba est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise «Symphonie», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 35 ans, mère 6 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari, qui est chauffeur. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés au marché de la ville depuis 15 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 15 ballons de souliers. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish,  elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Ntumba is a retailer, a member of the Symphonie "banque villageoise" and a client of the MFI Hekima. She is married, 35 years old and the mother of 6 children who all attend school. She started her business with funds she received from her husband, who is a driver. She has been selling second-hand shoes at the market in town for 15 years. She is going to buy 15 bales of shoes. She would like to increase her working capital and to ensure that her children are fed and educated. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for the support it gives to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 15 bales of shoes.

loans.name: Panorama Group

texts.fr: Talyamwanya est commerçante, membre du groupe solidaire «Panorama», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un commerçant, âgée de 45 ans, mère de 7 enfants dont 6 scolarisés et 1 est encore gosse. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des divers produits manufacturés dans une boutique du  centre commercial depuis 3 ans. Elle va acheter du jus, bonbons, sucre, cartons biscuits, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Talyamwanya is a retailer, a member of the Panorama solidarity group and a client of the MFI Hekima. She is married to a retailer, 45 years old and the mother of 7 children, 6 of whom go to school and one of whom is still too young. She started her business with funds she received from her husband. She has been selling various manufactured products in a shop in the commercial centre for 3 years. She is going to buy items like juice, sweets, sugar and biscuits. She would like to build a house and to ensure that her children are fed and educated. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for the support it gives to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy juice, sweets, sugar, cartons of biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Virgen Inmaculada De Maranniyoc Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA DE MARANNIYOC”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Vilcabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Anastacia ella es conviviente y tiene 58 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva plátanos, café, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de cultivo de frutas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The members belong to the community bank "Virgen Inmaculada de Maranniyoc." This bank is located in the Vilcabamba district, province of La Convencion in the department of Cusco. Mrs. Anastasia is a common law wife , she is 58 years old and has 2 children. She works growing fruits. She owns a field where she grows bananas, coffee, tangerines and oranges. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. She has several years in this business and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand her cultivated field, thus she is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. The picture of the members showing on the bottom right  was added after the meeting because they asked for permission due to work commitments. The other members work selling animals, growing fruits, managing grocery stores and selling food. The member is grateful to those making this dream come true and is committed to pay her installment payments within the agreed period.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josphat is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a retail business where he sells tomatoes. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a market area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes.

loans.name: Anacorita

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Anacorita has engaged in a variety store business within her community for almost 6 years now. She is 57 years of age and is working hard to provide for her family's needs.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Due to financial insufficiency, Anacorita wants to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, she would like to obtain a loan amounting to 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional grocery items that are needed. Being a kind and friendly mother, she is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Anacorita  aspires to save enough money so she can improve her business and be able to help her children and grandchildren as well. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items that are needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in his farm to hopefully enable him to get more farm produce to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance costs of her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is 52 years old; she is a married woman.  

She deals in a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Kasagati Tukurakurane Group

texts.en:
Katusabe is a 42-year-old female Ugandan. She is married and has 8 children and they do attend school. Katusabe is a farmer and she also deals in cereals on a small scale. She is a resident of Kasagate Muhororo in Kibaale district.

She has applied for a loan of UGX 400,000 from UGAFODE through her group of local farmers. She will use the loan to buy cereals since the season is on now and she expects to get a profit.

Her dream is to educate all her children to university level, but she faces the challenge of limited sources of income.

She is a hardworking and honest person.

loans.use: to buy corn and millet grain to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as determined and trustworthy. 

She operates a retail business where she sells potatoes. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are of all kinds. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. She will use the KES 95,000 loan to buy more stock of potatoes. Her business goal is to be able to supply potatoes to other regions within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business, satisfy customer needs and educate her children. 

This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Thanks to you, lenders! Recently, Lydia was granted a PHP 50,000 loan for her inventory. Having this amount, she ably bought more quantities of merchandise products associated with her business. Having been able to induce greater sales, Lydia found a better source of income for the family. Thus, she was able to support the household's basic needs. 

However, she still needs a certain amount this time that will help her maintain the business operations. She is requesting to take a loan worth PHP 10,000 that she will use to obtain additional products for selling like grocery items and other similar products. Your help today can be a great start for a better business and life that awaits Lydia. This is why she is very hopeful that you will allow her request. 

She dreams for her family to grow in progress and her business to develop and expand.

She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from her religion, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to obtain additional products for selling.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
This is Norma. She is 58 years old and currently resides with her husband, Ronnie, in Pasay City, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than seven years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for their one and only child. She and her partner had to work hard, determined to have a better income, to provide their child with a better education.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5-PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To improve sales, Norma would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of 10,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos), she could already purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Norma hopes to maintain an increasing profit from her business and eventually expand her sari-sari store. She also dreams for her child to complete his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ameer

texts.en:
Ameer is 43 years old; she is a married woman.  

She deals in a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en: Shameem, 44, is a married woman. She deals in a business of selling animals with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. Currently, she has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase more animals such as baby goats.

loans.use: to purchase more animals such as baby goats.

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es: Jose tiene 57 años de edad, vive con su esposa y tiene 2 hijos que ya son independientes, Jose se dedica 4 años a la fabricación de ladrillo y bloque, también se dedica a trabajo de albañilería y a la agricultura, Jose comenta que para quedar bien en sus pagos este señor le hace cualquier tipo de trabajo y asi se considera un señor muy luchador en la vida, Jose va a invertir el crédito en la compra de cemento y otros materiales para la fabricación de sus productos, Jose sueña con poder ayudar a sus nietos en la educación, casa y alimento. Jose también espera junto a su esposa tener una vejez algo tranquila  y por eso trabaja duro ahora que tiene muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y aun le quedan fuerzas.
texts.en:
Jose is 57 years old.  He lives with his wife and has two adult children.  Jose has worked for four years manufacturing bricks and cement blocks.  He also works in construction and agriculture.  Jose says that, in order to stay up-to-date with his bills, he’ll do whatever type of work.  Because of this, he is thought to be a real fighter in life.  

Jose is going to invest his loan in the purchase of cement and other materials for manufacturing his products.  Jose dreams of being able to help his grandchildren with their education, housing, and food.  Jose also hopes to have a fairly quiet old age with his wife.  Because of this, he works hard now and really wants to keep working while he still has the ability to do so.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement

loans.name: Sérgio

texts.pt:
O senhor Sérgio tem 33 anos de idade, casado, pai de 3 filhos, dos quais 2 no ensino primário, e 1 ainda menor, vive na casa própria e sustenta também sua avó.
Com o valor do crédito pretende comprar chapas de zinco, cimento, areia, pedra, varrões, para ampliar a sua casa com mais um quarto, cozinha, casa de banho e varanda .
Tem como sonho, concluir  a sua casa, fazer um murro de vedacão para o seu quintal.
O seu maior desafio é a insuficiência de fundos mas diz que irá solicitar mais empréstimos para tal vai pagar pontualmente diz ainda que com os emprestimos anteriores conseguiu fazer a casa onde actualmente reside .
texts.en:
Sergio is 33 years old, and is married with three children. Two of his children are in elementary school and one is not yet of school age. Sergio lives in his own home and also helps care for his grandmother.

With this loan, Sergio plans to buy zinc plates, cement, sand, stone, and bars in order to expand his home by adding another room, a kitchen, a bathroom, and a porch. His goal once this construction project is finished is to build a wall around his property for privacy. His biggest challenge has been a lack of funds but since he would like to take out more loans in the future he will be sure to pay back this one on time. He tells us that with earlier loans, he was able to build the house that he now lives in.

loans.use: buy zinc plates, cement, sand, stone, and bars.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer De Putucusi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DE PUTUCUSI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quellouno, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Andrea ella es casada y tiene 50 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva plátanos, café, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Nuevo Amanecer De Putcusi communal bank.  This bank is located in the Quellouno district, La Convención province, Cusco department.

The member is Andrea, age 50.  She is married and has four children.  She works in her business of growing fruit.  She has a piece of land where she grows bananas, coffee, tangerines, and oranges.  She works from 6:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She has had this business for several years, and it is going very well for her. 

 Her dream is to expand the land she cultivates.  She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

The other members devote themselves to the businesses of selling animals, agriculture,  a grocery store, and food sales.

The member is grateful to those who make up part of this dream through these means.  She pledges to make her payments according to the established timeline.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 24 years old, married and blessed with two children. 

He has had a motorcycle transport services business for the past one year.
 
He will use the loan from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase motorcycle spare parts for repair and maintenance of his motorcycle so as to offer better transportation services. He hopes this will enable him to serve more customers.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. His future hope is to expand his business by buying another motorcycle and to be financially stable and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts for repair and maintenance of his motorcycle so as to offer better transportation services.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Thanks for your unwavering support to Maricel. Because of the loan that you granted her recently, she was able to buy additional stocks of ingredients for her recipes. She was also able to improve her food stall. This has indeed aided in covering the household's basic expenses and helped in attracting more customers as well. 

She doesn't earn from her food stall alone. She also manages a small sari-sari store simultaneously. This time, she would like to avail another 40,000 that she would use to pay for more grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell for her business. Your small act of generosity now can be a good head start for Maricel's dream of expanding her business and giving a better life to her family. 

She meets every week with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from her religion, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for four years. 

Ruth's business is located in a developing area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to be a major supplier of charcoal within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will sustain her family. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is 31 years old and a married woman. She is a mother of four children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has been doing a business of animal purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 41-year-old married woman. She is shown in the photo with her husband.  For about 10 years, she has been working doing hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to her household's expenses. 

To help continue business operations, Shazia has taken out a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishing her embroidery. This will enable her to cater to more customers consistently. Shazia is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishing her embroidery.

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira was born in 1985. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Jabal Al Hussain with her husband who is working with low income. She worked at a beauty salon for many years and she got very good experience. Then she decided to be a partner with her sister and open their own beauty salon. 

Now she wants to expand her work and develop it, thus earning more profit. However, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for a loan to buy supplies and a new hair dryer to improve the quality of her work.

loans.use: To buy supplies and a new hair dryer to improve the quality of her work.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: A sus 64 años de edad Carlos comenta que nunca se caso pero tiene 2 hijos que ya son mayores de edad y ya trabajan al jornal. Carlos vive solo pero él siempre ha apoyado a sus hijos sobre todo en la alimentación y les ha  ensenado a trabajar. Carlos obtiene sus ingresos económicos del trabajo al jornal, de la crianza de animales menores, la ganadería y los cultivos. Con el dinero del crédito Carlos va a comprar chanchos ya que comenta que tiene un espacio donde criar estos animalitos.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 64, says that he never married, but he has two grown children, who are day workers.  Carlos lives alone, but he has always supported his children, especially by feeding them.  He has taught them how to work.  Carlos gets his income by being a day worker, by raising small animals, and by working with livestock and the crops.

Carlos will use the loan to buy pigs.  He says that he has a place where he can raise these animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Maria Angelita

texts.es: María esta en los 46 años de edad, es divorciada, María se dedica desde que era muy joven  a la crianza de animales menores y a la ganadería. María tiene 3 hijos y están estudiando. María solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos.  María tiene la aspiración de seguir trabajando y continuar con la mantención de sus hijos para salir adelante y los que están estudiando terminen por lo menos la secundaria.
texts.en:
Maria is 46 years old and is divorced. She has worked raising small animals and livestock since she was very young. She has 3 children and they are studying. 

Maria is asking for the money from the loan to invest in the purchase of pigs.  She has the aspiration of continuing to work and continuing to support her children so they can get ahead and are able to at least finish high school.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university fees for this semester

loans.name: La Vie Group

texts.fr: Ombeni est commerçante, présidente de la banque villageoise «La Vie», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 36 ans, mère 5 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari, qui est aussi commerçant. Elle est vendeuse des  fretins au marché de la ville depuis 3 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 5 sacs de poissons fretins. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Ombeni is a retailer, the president of the "La Vie" "banque villageoise" and a customer of the MFI Hekima. She is 36 years old and the mother of 5 children who all attend school. She started her business with funds she received from her husband who is also a retailer. She has been selling young fish (fry) at the market in town for 3 years. She will buy 5 bags of young fish. She would like to increase her working capital and to ensure that her children are fed and educated. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support it gives to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of (young) fish.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and makeup.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and farm tools for her farming activity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm

loans.name: Edison Libardo

texts.es: Edison tiene 35 años de edad, Edison vive con sus padres y tiene un hijo de 2 años. Edison se dedica a trabajar en la siembras de pequeñas huertas de alverja, papas, habas y demás productos propios del lugar en donde reside. Edison a veces se dedica a trabajar de chofer. Edison solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de abono, fungicidas, pago de mano de obra, pago de riego y demás gastos que se tiene en los cultivos para tenerlos sanos y al final obtener buenas cosechas. Edison tiene la aspiración de que le siga yendo bien en su negocio para que sus ingresos sean menores y ya seguirse preparado para la educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Edison is 35 years old, lives with his parents and has a two year old son. Edison makes a living planting small plots of potatoes, beans and peas and other produce from where he lives. Occasionally Edison also works as a driver. 

Edison is seeking a loan to invest in buying fertilizer, fungicides, to pay for field hands, irrigation and other costs associated with keeping the crops cared for and producing a good harvest. 

Edison's aspiration is to continue going well in his business and to increase his earnings in preparation for his son's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicides

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es: Cristóbal tiene 73 años de edad, vive solo, Cristóbal reside en una comunidad donde casi todas las personas se dedican  a la crianza de  animales y a la agricultura. Cristobal para obtener sus recursos económicos y cubrir sus necesidades se dedica al jornal  y la crianza de animales menores. Critobal solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos. Cristobal tiene su aspiración que es la de seguir trabajando y asi seguir solo pero contento.
texts.en:
Cristóbal is 73 years old and lives by himself. Cristóbal lives in a community where almost everyone makes a living raising animals and working in agriculture.

Cristóbal, to obtain financial resources and to cover his expenses, works as a day laborer and raising small animals.  Cristóbal requests the loan to invest in the purchase of pigs. Cristóbal has his ambition, which is to continue to work and to continue alone but happy.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela is a 22-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband. Some time ago, she decided to support her family by starting to stitch clothes at her home, as her husband has an income that is barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. 

She is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she faces difficulty in covering daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has taken a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase a new stitching machine, along with threads, buttons and laces, to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine, along with threads, buttons and laces, to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her farming activity through application of modern farming technologies like the use of fortified fertilizer and certified maize seedlings

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 35-year-old married lady from a village near Jenin city. She lives with her husband and four kids in a simple house. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income.

Hala is a student in the university where she studies Arabic literature.

Hala took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university fees for this semester. This will help her to pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

Hala appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for this semester.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is 29 years old, married and blessed with three children. She is a farmer and has been growing cash crops for sale for the past five years. She will be using the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm, and she hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell and be able to support her family. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. Her future hopes are to grow more cash crops and make more income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a dairy farm. She has been involved in this business for eight years. 

Jane's business is located in a developing area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy materials to renovate her cow shed. Her business goal is to be able to supply milk to various markets within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will meet her family needs. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy materials to renovate her cow shed

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 30-year-old, married woman. She has five children. Along with her husband (also shown in the picture), she has been running a business of purchasing and selling animals. She looks after the livestock and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them at different markets in the city. Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. 

However, Shakeela needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, healthcare, and clothing. In order to expand her earnings, she has accessed a Murabaha loan of PKR 35,000 to buy more baby goats to sell so as to expand the business, and that will help in improving her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy more baby goats to sell so as to expand the business

loans.name: Dieu Est Bon Group

texts.fr: Katsuva est commerçante, membre  du groupe de crédits «Dieu est Bon», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un commerçant, âgée de 50 ans, mère de 10 enfants dont 4 scolarisés et 6 n’étudient plus. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu d’un crédit. Elle est vendeuse des éléments d’ustensile de cuisine dans un magasin de la ville depuis 3 ans. Elle va acheter des assiettes, basins, fourchettes, cuillères, couteaux, casseroles, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Katsuva is a retailer, a member of the "Dieu est Bon" credit group and a customer of the MFI Hekima. She is married to a retailer, 50 years old and the mother of 10 children, four of whom attend school and 6 of whom do not study anymore. She started her business with a loan. She has been selling kitchen utensils in a shop in town for 3 years. She will buy items like plates, basins, forks, spoons, knives, and pans. She would like to build a house and to ensure that her children are fed and educated. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support it gives to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy plates, basins, forks, spoons, knives, pans, etc.

loans.name: Judite

texts.pt:
A senhora Judite tem 46 anos de idade, casada, mãe de 1 filho a estudar e 2 enteadas  das quais apenas uma vive com ela a outra apenas envia-lhe dinheiro, vive na casa propria e sustenta tambem a sua mâe. 
Com o valor do crédito pretende comprar oleo, frango, batata, cremora, refresco, cebola, para reforçar a sua banca na sua casa e  entregas por encomendas, além desta actividade ela vende roupa usada.
Os Planos futuros consistem em compra de uma viatura para usar no seu negócio ter um estabelecimento próprio e em condições.
O seu maior desafio e a insuficiência de fundos mas diz que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para tal vai pagar pontualmente para concretizar seus sonhos.
texts.en:
Judite is 46 years old and is married. She has one son who is in school and two stepdaughters, one who lives with her and one to whom she sends money. She lives in her own home and helps to care for her mother.

With this loan, Judite plans to buy cooking oil, chicken, yams, coffee creamer, soft drinks, and onions in order to stock the food stand that she runs from her home and her food delivery service. She also works selling used clothing.

Judite's future plans include buying a vehicle that she can use for her business and having an independent location for her business that is in good condition. Her main challenge has been a lack of funds, and she says that she will pay off this loan on time in order to take out more loans in the future that will help her make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: buy cooking oil, chicken, yams, coffee creamer, soft drinks, and onions.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Limatambo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA ROSA DE LIMATAMBO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Limatambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria ella es soltera y tiene 56 años y tiene 7 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant mas grande. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “SANTA ROSA DE LIMATAMBO” community bank. This bank is located in the Limatambo district of the Anta province and the Cusco department.

The member is Maria, she is single, 56 years old and has 7 children. The member works in her restaurant business. She prepares different plates such as baked chicken, soups and beef stir-fry. She works from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm. The member has been in this business for various years and it is going well. The member’s dream is to have a bigger restaurant. The member requests the loan to buy cooking ingredients, such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

The member in the photo added next to the group picture, took the picture after the meeting, she had requested permission for work reasons.

The other members make a living working in agriculture, selling clothes, selling groceries and selling animals.

The member is grateful for those who form part of this dream through this loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Akther

texts.en:
Akther, a 51-year-old married woman, is involved in the business of cloth sales and purchase to provide for her family. The man shown in the picture is her husband. 

Akhter purchases cloth from the market at low prices and then sells it to the people of her locality. She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

For the improvement of her business, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth in various colors and designs to fulfill the demand of her customers on time.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in various colors and designs to fulfill the demand of her customers on time

loans.name: Aqsa

texts.en:
Aqsa is a 24-year-old working woman. The man shown in the picture is her husband. After her marriage she felt that she should work to improve their financial condition, so she started a business selling cloth in her locality. She is famous among her neighbors for her collection and has a good client list. 

Aqsa has taken out a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase good-quality cloth in different colors to increase sales and earn substantial profits. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth in different colors to increase sales and earn substantial profits.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Elena es una señora divorciada, Elena vive con sus 4 hijos, una de sus hijos es discapacitada que sufre de un retardo mental y comenta Elena que su hija discapacitada tiene un hijo y que es Elena quien le da cuidando, manteniendo y educando, Elena se dedica a la crianza de ganado, vende verduras en el mercado de frutas y verduras, y también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para tener un ingreso que le permita seguir manteniendo a sus hijos que están estudiando y a su nieta.
texts.en: Elena is divorced.  She lives with her four children, one of whom is disabled and suffers from mental retardation.  Elena says that her disabled daughter has one child, and it is Elena who takes care her grandchild by providing support and an education. Elena makes her living raising livestock and selling vegetables in the fruit and vegetable market.  She also raises small animals.  She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of a cow so she can earn an income that will allow her to keep supporting her children, who go to school, and her grandchild.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Anderson is 42 years old, married, and supports nine family members. 

He has been operating his food stall for the last 12 years and earns 8,000 KES per month. 

Anderson has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to buy additional stock of tomatoes, onions, cabbages, and green leafy vegetables for resale.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to expand his business to other parts of the region. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of tomatoes, onions, cabbages, and green leafy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
O senhor Armando  tem 41 anos de idade, casado é pai de 5 filhos, dos quais 3 a estudar  e 2 ainda menores, vive na casa própria  e sustenta também a sua mãe .
Com o valor do crédito pretende comprar roupas usadas para vender e comprar produtos de 1ª necessidade para a sua loja que sita na sua casa.
Planos para o futuro crescer no seu negócio, ampliando o seu local  de negócio e satistazer as necessidaeds dos seus clientes  fornecendo diversos produtos.
O seu maior desafio é a insuficiência de fundos mas diz que irá solicitar mais empréstimos para tal vai pagar pontualmente e que com os anteriores emprestimos casaou se e fez uma barraca na sua casa.
texts.en:
Armando is 41 years old and is married with five children, three of whom are in school and two of whom are not yet of school age. He lives in his own home and also cares for his mother.

With this loan Armando plans to buy used clothing to sell and also to buy basic home products for a store that he runs out of his home. His plans for the future are to grow his business, expand his store, and satisfy his customers' needs by providing a wide variety of goods for sale. His biggest challenge has been a lack of funds and he will pay this loan off as indicated in order to take out more loans in the future. With previous loans he was able to get married and to build a sales counter at his home.

loans.use: to buy used clothes and basic home products to sell.

loans.name: Gadeer

texts.en:
Gadeer is a 36-year-old married woman from a village near Nablus city. She lives with her husband in a simple house. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Gadeer is a masters student at the university where she studies elementary education. 

Gadeer has taken a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Gadeer will be able to do her homework and write reports easily.

Gadeer appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 25 years old form Baniswef. He is single and has a small fattening project. He previously requested a 5,000 EGP loan form TADE and successfully repaid it. Ali wishes to expand his project so he requested another 5,000 EGP loan to purchase a head of cattle to make cheese and butter to sell. Ali's sister and mother will help him by selling the products in the local market.

loans.use: To purchase a head of cattle.

loans.name: Rosa Alba

texts.es: A sus 34 años de edad Rosa es casada y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 3 estan estudiando y también con ella vive un nieto de 4 meses. Rosa se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y a veces se va al jornal, su esposo se dedica a trabajos de albañilería en lugares muy lejanos por lo que tiene que ausentarse por algun tiempo para terminar las obras que le pongan, mientras que el esposo de Rosa se ausenta ella se hace cargo de los gastos de sus hijos y para eso va a invertir el credito en la compra de chanchos para ampliar su negocio y poder darles a sus hijos y a su nieto lo mas necesario.
texts.en: At 34 years of age, Rosa is married and has 6 children, of whom 3 are studying, and her grandson of 4 months lives with her. Rosa raises small animals and sometimes she gets daily-wage work. Her husband works in masonry and goes off to work in far places so he is absent for periods of time to finish the jobs he's been given. While he's gone, Rosa is in charge of her children's expenses and so for that reason she will invest the loan in buying pigs to expand her business and be able to give her children and grandson what they need.

loans.use: buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as nails and cement to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: connect his home to drinking water and build a latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in his farm

loans.name: Altagracia Genoveva

texts.es:
La señora Altagracia es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio propio que es venta de abarrotería en general, actividad que realiza desde hace 21 años, sus clientes principales son vecinos y amigos de su comunidad, tiene su negocio ubicado en un punto estratégico lo cual le permite vender bastante.
Doña Altagracia vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta básica y esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de  pollo, manteca, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, sardinas, tomates, margarina, salsa, huevos etc. para poder de esta manera surtir más su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia con los ingresos que obtenga.
Uno de sus sueños es que su negocio sea uno de los más grandes de la zona y poder seguir apoyando a su familia.


 Danli, Honduras  - Mayo del 2015
texts.en:
Altagracia is an entrepreneur and a woman dedicated to her own business. She sells groceries in general and has been doing this since she was 21 years old. Her main customers are neighbors and friends from the community. She has her business located in a strategic place which allows her to sell quite a lot. 

Altagracia sells everything related to staple goods and is requesting the loan to purchase chicken, lard, rice, sugar, beans, sardines, tomatoes, margarine, sauce, eggs, etc., to stock her business. This way she can improve the quality of life for her and her family with the income she will get.

One of her dreams is that her business is one of the biggest ones in the area and to be able to continue to support her family.

Danli, Honduras, May 2015.

loans.use: to buy chicken, lard, rice, sugar, beans, sardines, tomatoes, margarine, sauce, eggs, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in his farm

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
Juana Rosa vive con 2 hijos menores, en casa propia, cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Su familia es muy unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderÍa ubicada en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Juana Rosa se dedica al servicio de peluquería en local propio (parte de su casa) en el distrito de Lagunas Nuevo - Mocupe, desde hace más de 10 años aproximadamente. El destino del préstamo es para la compra de herramientas para la peluquería (maquina laseadora, rizadora, tenasa, entre otros), lo que le permitirá darle un valor agregado a su servicio permitiendole de esta forma captar mayores clientes, mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana Rosa lives with her 2 dependent children in her own house. She has good personal and professional references. Her family is very united. She lives in a community decimated to commerce, agriculture and animal husbandry in the district of Lagunas, in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru.

For the last 10 years, Juana Rosa has run a hair salon out of her own locale (part of her house) in the district of Lagunas Nuevo in Mocupe. The loan is to buy tools for her hair salon (flat iron, curling iron, and pincers, among others), which will allow her to to give extra value to her services and that way find more clients and more income, which will improve her quality of life and her family's.

loans.use: buy tools for her hair salon (flat iron, curling iron, and pincers, among others).

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is 34 years old and married. 

She is involved in cattle selling with the support of her husband. Both are working together to run their household activities. They look after the cattle and, after raising them for a year or two, sell them in their neighborhood. 

She requested a Murabaha loan for 25,000 PKR to purchase stock of good quality grass and feed for the cattle she already has. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase stock of good quality grass and feed for the cattle she already has.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 21-year-old single man from a village near Nablus city. He lives with his family in a simple house. His father works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income.

Ahmad is a student in the university, where he studies law. He wants to complete his studies and find a job to support his family.

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university fees for this semester. This will help him to pay part of the urgent expenses he has.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for this semester.

loans.name: Flor Elisa Delfina

texts.es: Elisa a sus 67 años de edad todavía tienen el ánimo suficiente para seguir trabajando en su actividad que es la crianza de animales, ella es casada y tien 5 hijos pero ya ninguno vive con ella, Elisa vive con su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura, con el credito Elisa va a comprar chanchos y seguir adelante en este y poder ayudar a sus 2 nietas que viven con Elisa y que estan asistiendo al colegio.
texts.en: At this age, Elisa, 67, still has the motivation to keep working with her business, which is animal husbandry. She is married and has 5 children but none live with her anymore. She lives with her husband who is a farmer. With this loan, she will buy pigs and continue moving forward so she can help her two granddaughters who live with her and who go to school.

loans.use: buy pigs.

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es:
María Emilia tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

María Emilia se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como leche, aceite, arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, art. de aseo, etc. Ella tiene su tienda desde hace más de 5 años, negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para incrementar el stock de su negocio, dicha inversión le servirá para incrementar sus ventas, con gran influencia en el negocio; María Emilia piensa tener mayor stock de productos para poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los clientes de la zona, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Emilia is 27 years old, is in a common-law relationship, and has 2 children. She lives with her family in a rural area of the Oyotún district, province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, in the northern coast of Peru. Their community basically works in agriculture, animal husbandry, and trade.

María Emilia makes a living selling groceries such as milk, oil, rice, sugar, soda, cleaning products, etc. She has had her shop for over 5 years. The business is located in her own home. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to increase her business stock. The investment will serve to increase her sales, with great influence on the business. María Emilia plans on having a greater stock of products to be able to meet the diverse needs, requirements, and tastes of the customers in the area, which will allow her in a short term to improve her income, increase her profits, and thus improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to increase her business stock.

loans.name: Akylai

texts.ru: Акылай, 33 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее высшее образование, 10 лет работает преподавателем в Педагогическом Институте, ежемесячная заработная плата составляет в среднем 11,700 сом (KGS). Акылай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку пескоблока, цемента и прочих материалов для постройки забора. Доходы позволят Акылай и дальше улучшать условия проживания ее семьи.
texts.en:
Akylai is 33 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has a higher education. For ten years, she has worked as a teacher at the Pedagogical Institute. Her monthly wages amount to on average 11,700 som (KGS). Akylai applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase cinder blocks, cement and other materials for building a fence.

Profits will allow Akylai also to further improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy cinder blocks, cement, and the like, to build a fence around her house.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда, 60 лет, замужем, 5 детей, все они взрослые и самостоятельные. У Мавлуды высшее образование, она на пенсии, всю жизнь проработала учителем математики. В 2014 году она стала заниматься животноводством, накопив на старт сумму в 2,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Мавлуды на сегодняшний день у нее уже есть 2 коровы, 4 овец. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 14,500 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мавлуда обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от ведения бизнеса позволят улучшить благосостояние семьи и развить бизнес Мавлуды.
texts.en:
Mavluda is 60 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom are grown and living on their own. Mavluda has a higher education. She is retired and all her life worked as a teacher of mathematics. In 2014, she began to raise livestock, starting with a sum of 2,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Mavluda currently has two cows and four sheep. Monthly aggregate income amounts to around 14,500 som (KGS) per month. With the aim of further developing her business, Mavluda applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock.

Income from running the business allows her to improve the family's well-being and to develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Sarvarbi

texts.ru: Этой счастливой женщине 38 лет. Ее зовут Сарварби. Она из городка Куляб. У нее заботливый муж и прекрасные дети. Муж очень любить свою жену и детей. Он всегда старается вперед, чтобы улучшить условия жизни семьи. Муж занимается мастером ремонта домов. Детям 8 и 6 лет. Сарварби тоже старательная и заботливая женщина. Она дома предоставляет услуги портнихи. По ее словам ей удобна, заниматься дома, потому что дома удобно, и она присматривает за детьми. Ее доходы  только от этой деятельностью.  Сарварби просит кредит, для купли ткани. Она хочет сшить разные одежды и привлечь больше клиентов. Это кредит поможет ей расширить деятельность.
texts.en:
This happy woman is 38 years old. Her name is Sarvarbi. She is from the town of Kulyab. She has a loving husband and lovely children. Her husband very much loves his wife and children. He always strives forward, in order to improve living conditions for the family. Her husband is a master home repairman. The children are aged eight and six. Sarvarbi is also a diligent and caring woman. She offers services as a dressmaker from her home. In her words, she is comfortable working from home because her home is comfortable and she is able to look after the children. Her only income is from these activities.

Sarvarbi is requesting a loan to purchase fabric. She wants to sew different clothes and to attract more customers. This loan will help her to expand activities.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and to expand her business.

loans.name: Gulbarchin

texts.ru: Гулбарчин, 38 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей. У нее средне образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2000 года занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес с 15,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Гулбарчин есть 2 коровы, 8 овец, лошадь. На участке мерою 2,0 Га собственной земли она выращивает кукурузу и люцерну. Вся экологически чистая продукция Гулбарчин пользуется большим спросом и приносит хорошую прибыль в размере около 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого, вкусного молока. Доходы от кредита Гулбарчин планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность достойно воспитывать своих детей.
texts.en:
Gulbarchin is 38 years old, married, and has two children. She has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she has been engaged in agriculture since 2000, having begun this business with 15,000 som (KGS). On her homestead, Gulbarchin has two cows, eight sheep, and a horse. On a plot of her own land measuring 2.0 hectares, she grows corn and alfalfa. All of Gulbarchin's organic products are in great demand and bring a good profit of about 13,000 som (KGS). With the aim of further developing her business, she applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase a dairy cow to increase sales volume of ecologically clean, delicious milk.

Gulbarchin plans to invest income from the loan in further expanding her business, in order to have the opportunity to raise her children with dignity.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow in order to sell the eco-friendly milk.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.es:
Marisa es una mujer de 33 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de juguetes artesanales.
Ella es buena madre, alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizado por encontrarse al borde del curso del agua, paseo tradicional del fin de semana, construcciones rústicas con materiales regionales en donde se puede degustar la comida típica y realizar algunas actividades deportivas. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 22-32 grados centígrados. 
Marisa es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba. Su negocio es la venta de juguetes artesanales, en un puesto de venta al aire libre durante la semana en horas del día. Los juguetes son fabricados de madera con colores vivos. Los más comunes son; automóvil, rompecabezas, cubos, muñecos y otros. “los juguetes son hechos a mano y su característica principal es que desarrollan la inteligencia del niño al momento de armar o desarmar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son contantes, la desventaja es la competencia de los juguetes electrónicos. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de juguetes, ella desea realizar la compra de juguetes artesanales por mayor para cubrir sus pedidos y ofertar mayor variedad a sus clientes. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Marisa solicita un préstamo para la compra de juguetes artesanales por mayor para cubrir sus pedidos y abrir una tienda de juguetes.
texts.en:
Marisa is a 33 year-old woman who lives with her partner and has two children ages 15 and 8. Her business is the sale of handcrafted toys. She is a good mother, is cheerful, optimistic, happy, responsible, has a good attitude, and she works very hard.

She does business in the southern part of the city, which is characterized for being on the water's edge and is a traditional weekend walking area with rustic buildings made of regional materials where you can enjoy typical food and do sporting activities. The weather is warm and subtropical with daytime temperatures ranging from 22 to 32 degrees Celsius. 

Marisa has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair that she wears tied back, and is short and of medium build. Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks at home, and she also speaks Spanish in the community and for business. 

She shares her life with her partner, who works in commerce, and her two children who go to school. They live in their own home made of brick and cement with a tin roof and a brick floor. They have electricity and well water that is extracted by a pump.

She works selling handcrafted toys in an outdoor stall during the week in daytime hours. The toys are crafted of wood in bright colors. The most common ones are cars, puzzles, cubes, dolls, and more. Marisa says that "the toys are handmade and their main characteristic is that they develop the child's intelligence by assembling and disassembling them." The advantage of her business is that sales are steady, and the disadvantage is the competition from electronic toys.

Her dream is to open a toy store. She wants to purchase wholesale handmade toys in order to fulfill her orders and offer greater variety to her customers. This is her second loan with the institution in two years that she's been doing this work. For these reasons, Marisa is requesting a loan to purchase wholesale handcrafted toys in order to fulfill her orders and open a toy store.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale handcrafted toys in order to fulfill her orders and open a toy store.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a farm where she grows maize, beans, vegetables and also keeps livestock. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a promising place and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy goats for milk production. Her business goal is to have a large scale production of goat milk within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy goats for milk production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for increased soil fertility for a better produce and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Femmes Sages Group

texts.fr: Mwiza est une commerçante, présidente d’un groupe de crédits «Femmes sages», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 31 ans, marié à un business man, mère de 4 enfants dont 3 scolarisés et 1 est gosse.  Elle est vendeuse divers habillement  dans un magasin  de la ville depuis 5 ans. Elle va acheter des tricots, souliers, pantalons,jupes, bijoux, chemises etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien  apporté aux entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
