Mwiza is a merchant and the president of the loan group “Femmes sages”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 31 years old, married to a businessman, and the mother of four children, of whom three are in school, and one is still very young. 

Mwiza has been a vendor of a variety of clothing in a store in town for five years. She is going to purchase knitwear, shoes, pants, skirts, jewelry, shirts, etc. Thus, she would like to provide education and food for her children. 

She thanks Hekima for supporting entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase knitwear, shoes, pants, skirts, jewelry, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Les Amis Fideles A Group

texts.fr: Edith est commerçante, membre d’une plate forme de crédit «Les Amis Fideles A», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 38 ans, divorcée, mère de 7 enfants  tous vont à l’école. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de sa mère. Elle est propriétaire d’une alimentation dans la ville. Elle va acheter des liqueurs, riz, sucres, huiles végétales, laits. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Edith is a merchant and a member of the loan platform “Les Amis Fideles A”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 38 years old, divorced, and the mother of seven children, all going to school. 

Edith began her business with funds from her mother. She is the owner of a grocery store in town. She is going to purchase some liquor, rice, sugar, vegetable oil, and milk. She would like to obtain more loans and provide schooling and food for her children. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase liquor, rice, sugar, vegetable oil, and milk.

loans.name: Davlatali

texts.ru: Давлатали рожденный человек для бизнеса. Он на районе Гафуров занимается один видом бизнесом. Давлатали имеет  грузовую автомашину марки «Газель». Он занимается перевозом товар. У нее имеется свои клиенты, которые постоянно перевозит их товар. 8 лет Давлатали занят этим бизнесом. Он хорошо житель этого района, и хорошо знает любое место района. Давлатали женатый мужчина. Он живет вместе отцом, матерью, женой и детьми. Ему 33 года. Давлатали хочет отремонтировать и восстановить двигатель свою автомашину. Его грузовая автомашина является основной для него, потому что с помощью автомашины он зарабатывает и обеспечивает семью. И у него единственный вариант, получить кредит. Вы можете поддержать Давлатали!
texts.en:
Davlatali is a natural born businessman. In the Gafurov region, he is involved in one kind of business. Davlatali has a Gazelle brand truck and he transports goods. He is available to his customers who regularly transport goods. For eight years, Davlatali has been involved in this work. He is a good resident of this region and knows well every place in the region.

Davlatali is a married man. He lives with his father, mother, wife, and children. He is 33 years old. Davlatali wants to repair and restore his motor vehicle. This freight vehicle is important to him because he makes his living with it and supports the family. And his only option is to receive a loan.

loans.use: to repair and restore his freight vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds and farm input for use in the farm for more income gain and to meet clients' demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to supply milk for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stocks of bananas to sell and also supply to other grocery vendors and use the profits to educate his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and maize seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Nurdana

texts.ru: Нурдана, 29 лет, замужем, 2 детей. Она спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. Нурдана получает ежемесячную прибыль в размере до 17,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В хозяйстве есть 6 коров, 20 овец. Нурдана обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS). На полученные средства она приобретет 23 овцы для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита накопит на постройку дома для ее семьи.
texts.en:
Nurdana is 29 years old, married, and has two children. She is calm, even-tempered and hard-working. Nurdana receives monthly income of about 17,000 som (KGS). On her homestead, she has six cows and 20 sheep. Nurdana applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS). With the loan received, she will acquire 23 sheep for fattening and resale.

Income from the loan will be saved for building a home for her family.

loans.use: to buy 23 sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Les Amis Fideles B Group

texts.fr: Ephrasie est commerçante, présidente du groupe de crédit «Les Amis Fideles B», client de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 38 ans, divorcée, mère 6 enfants tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de sa famille. Elle est vendeuse de souliers usagés au marché du centre ville depuis 10 ans. Pour accroitre son activité, elle va acheter 5 ballons de souliers. Elle souhaite, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Ephrasie is a merchant and the president of the loan group “Les Amis Fideles B”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 38 years old, divorced, and the mother of six children, all students. 

Ephrasie began her business with funds from her family. She has been a vendor of secondhand shoes at the downtown market for ten years. To grow her business, she is going to purchase 5 bales of shoes. She would like to provide schooling and food for her children. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase 5 bales of shoes

loans.name: Sinai Group

texts.fr: Kaligana est commerçante, membre  de la banque communautaire «Sinai», client de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 36 ans, mariée à un chauffeur, mère 9 enfants dont 7 étudient et 2 sont gosses. Elle commença son business avec de fonds  reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse de souliers usagés hommes au marché du centre ville depuis 12 ans. Pour accroitre son activité, elle va acheter 15 paires de souliers. Elle souhaite, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Kaligana is a merchant and a member of the community bank “Sinai”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 36 years old, married to a driver, and the mother of nine children, of whom seven are students, and two are very young. 

Kaligana began her business with funds from her husband. She has been a vendor of secondhand men’ shoes at the downtown market for twelve years. To grow her business, she is going to purchase 15 pairs of shoes. She would like to provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase 15 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells handbags, basins and other items. She also does farming. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of handbags, basins and other items. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of handbags, basins and other items.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia   es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada al negocio propio que es la venta de abarrotería en general desde hace 3 años  este negocio lo atiende todos los días desde y lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, sus clientes son amigos y vecinos que a diario la visitan para adquirir los productos que vende.
Doña Antonia necesita el préstamo para la compra de  pollo, manteca, harina, margarina, refrescos, huevos, café, pan, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, etc.  y poder surtir su negocio para poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
Doña Antonia había solicitado un crédito el cual le fue de mucha ayuda porque logro surtir su negocio y así mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia  y espera que este nuevo préstamo también le genere ganancias que le permitan seguir saliendo adelante, uno de sus sueños es poder lograr que sus hijos se gradúen en el colegio y que puedan ser personas que triunfen en la vida.

Danli, Honduras – Mayo del  2015
texts.en:
Antonia is an entrepreneurial woman who has made a living from her own business, which is a general grocery store, for 3 years. She attends to her business every day. Her business is located in her home. Her customers are friends and neighbors who visit her daily to acquire the products that she sells.

Antonia needs the loan to purchase chicken, butter, flour, margarine, soft drinks, eggs, coffee, bread, rice, sugar, beans, etc., and to be able to supply her business to be able to satisfy her customers’ demand.

Antonia took out a loan that helped her a lot because she was able to supply her business and so improve her and her family’s standard of living. She hopes that this new loan will also generate profits that allow her to continue succeeding. One of her dreams is to be able to assure that her children graduate from school and that they are able to be people who triumph in life.

Danli, Honduras – May, 2015

loans.use: to purchase chicken, butter, flour, margarine, soft drinks, eggs, coffee, bread, rice, sugar, beans, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his farming activity through adoption of modern farming technologies like greenhouse planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her farming activity through application of modern farming technologies especially use of greenhouse planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her farming activity through having a greenhouse.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is a Kiva borrower. She has 3 children. She describes herself as generous. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 17 years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more tea leaves for resale. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more tea leaves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase animal feeds and seek necessary veterinary services to boost production.

loans.name: Janefer

texts.en: Janefer is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a farm where she grows maize, beans, and vegetables, and also keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a productive area, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to be able to do large-scale farming within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have an improved livelihood. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Riziki Mpya Group

texts.fr: Rachel est commerçante, membre de la  banque communautaire «Riziki Mpya», client de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 50 ans, mariée à un quincailler, mère 16 enfants dont 10 étudient, 4 sont mariés et 2 n'étudient plus. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires à son domicile dans le centre commercial de la ville depuis 34 ans. Pour accroitre son activité, elle va acheter les haricots, arachides, maïs, tomates, sucres. Elle  souhaite, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Rachel is a merchant and a member of the community bank “Riziki Mpya”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 50 years old, married to a hardware seller, and the mother of 16 children, of whom 10 are students, 4 are married, and 2 are no longer students. 

Rachel began her business with funds from her husband. She has been a vendor of grocery items in her house downtown for 34 years. To grow her business, she is going to purchase beans, peanuts, corn, tomatoes, and sugar. Her wish is to provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase beans, peanuts, corn, tomatoes, and sugar.

loans.name: Shaiyrgul

texts.ru: Шайыргул, 30 лет, замужем. В качестве дохода для своей семьи Шайыргул занимается животноводством и садоводством, стартовав с покупки скота на 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Шайыргул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 7 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,700 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Шайыргул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Шайыргул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на постройку дома.
texts.en:
Shaiyrgul is 30 years old and married. As a source of income for her family, Shaiyrgul is involved in livestock raising and horticulture, having begun with a livestock purchase of 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Shaiyrgul currently has on her homestead: three cows and seven sheep. Monthly income amounts to 6,700 som (KGS). With the aim of further developing her homestead, Shaiyrgul applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 15,000 som (KGS) to purchase sheep in order to increase her livestock count.

Shaiyrgul plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating the quantity of livestock and plans to save money to build a home.

loans.use: to purchase some sheep in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Nsugasugi Tweyombeke Group

texts.en:
Samuel is a 45 year old Ugandan who is married and has eight children ages one to 18  with six of them attending school.
Samuel has applied for a loan of UGX 2,200,000 from Ugafode through his group to invest more agro inputs in the sugar cane plantation to boost his business of sugarcane growing in order to earn more profits.
His dream for the future is to buy a vehicle which will assist him to transport his merchandise to the city.
He however faces challenges of bad weather and price fluctuations. He urges fellow group members to be hard working and innovative. The group appreciates Kiva's support.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Orestedes David

texts.es:
Orestedes tiene 35 años de edad, vive en casa propia, su familia es unida, vive en una comunidad tranquila, donde la gente se dedica al comercio, ganadería y agricultura, ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como gallinas, pollos, patos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo lo va a utilizar para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales para incrementar el stock de su negocio así como alimento para la crianza de estos, con esto el espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Orestedes is 35 years old. He lives in his own home and his family is close. He lives in a tranquil community, where the people make a living from commerce, livestock, and agriculture. It is located in the Cayaltí District, Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region, on the northern coast of Peru.

He makes a living from raising and selling animals such as hens, chickens, and ducks, among others. Her business is located in her home. He has experience in this business and good personal and work references in his district. He is going to use the loan to purchase a greater quantity of animals to increase his business’s stock as well as feed to raise them. With this, he hopes to offer a greater variety of animals to his customers, which will allow him to make a greater income, which will improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of animals to increase his business's stock, as well as feed to raise them.

loans.name: Arche De Noé Group

texts.fr: Mwavita est commerçante, membre  de la banque villageoise «Arche de Noé», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 54 ans, veuve, mère 6 enfants tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari, lors de son vivant. Elle est vendeuse de friperies a son domicile dans une avenue animée de la ville depuis 10 ans. Pour accroitre son activité, elle va acheter 2 ballons de friperies. Elle souhaite, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mwavita is a merchant and a member of the 'banc villageois' named “Arche de Noé”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 54 years old, a widow, and the mother of six children, all provided with education. 

Mwavita began her business with funds from her husband. She has been a vendor of secondhand clothing in her house on a busy street in town for ten years. To grow her business, she is going to purchase 2 bales of used clothing. Her wish is to provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bales of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Uaminifu Rénové Group

texts.fr: Syauswa est une commerçante, secrétaire d’un collectif de crédits «Uaminifu Rénové», âgée de 50 ans, divorcée, mère de 11 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse  des boissons à son domicile dans un quartier animé de la ville depuis 20 ans. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle  va s’approvisionner en 10 caisses de Primus et 10 de sucrées. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Syauswa is a merchant and the secretary of a loan collective called “Uaminifu Rénové”. She is 50 years old, divorced and the mother of eleven children, all provided with education. 

Syauswa has been a vendor of beverages in a business district in town for twenty years. She is requesting a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima to grow her business. She is going to stock up with 10 cases of Primus and 10 of soft drinks. Thus, her wish is to provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to stock up with 10 cases of Primus and 10 of soft drinks.

loans.name: Samara

texts.ru: Самара, 24 года, замужем, есть дочь. Занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и терпеливому характеру Самары, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее хозяйство: корову и 5 овец. На 0,96 Га земли выращивает арбузы. Ежемесячная прибыль Самары составляет 19,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян, удобрений и клеенки для парника и выращивания органических арбузов. Доходы от кредита Самара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение ее бизнеса, что позволит ей закончить строительство дома.
texts.en:
Samara is 24 years old, married, and has a daughter. She raises crops and livestock. Thanks to her hard work and patient nature, Samara currently has a good homestead: a cow and five sheep. On 0.96 hectares of land, she grows watermelons. Samara's monthly income amounts to 19,500 som (KGS). With the aim of further developing her business, she applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase seeds, fertilizer and oilcloth for a greenhouse and growing organic watermelons.

Samara plans to invest income from the loan in further expanding her business, to allow her to complete building a home.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and plastic for her greenhouse in order to grow organic watermelons.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase shirts, jackets, pants, etc.

loans.name: Bessy Yolibeth

texts.es:
La  Joven Bessy 21 años de edad  es soltera  y vive en su casa de habitación ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo Valle, al sur de Honduras,  cuenta con un negocio el cual es la elaboración y venta de alfarería, donde elabora lo que son  jarros, joyeros, gallos de barro, plato, picheles, y una gran variedad en adornos, es conocida  por ser una Joven luchadora con el deseo de seguir adelante.
Bessy cuida su hermanito ya que su madre salió del país hacia Estados Unidos desde hace 06 años y desde ahí  recibe remesas que le envía su madre,  está muy contenta con el apoyo que se le ha brindado y  con las ganancias ha mejorado su pequeño taller de alfarería. 
Bessy el préstamo para la compra de barro, pintura, pinceles, leña, etc. para seguir elaborando su producto  y poder así mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida para seguir apoyando a su hermano.
Su sueño es  seguir mejorando la casa que sus padres les dejaron.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2015
texts.en:
Young Bessy, 21 years old, is single and lives in her home, located in a community of San Lorenzo Valley, in the south of Honduras. She has a business, which is the production and sale of pottery. She produces jars, jewelry boxes, clay roosters, plates, mugs, and a great variety of decorations. She is known as a determined young woman with the desire to succeed.

Bessy has taken care of her little brother since her mother left the country for the United States 6 years ago, and they receive shipments from there that their mother sends to them. She is very pleased with the support that has been provided to her and with the profits that have improved her small pottery workshop.

Bessy will use the loan to purchase clay, paint, paint brushes, firewood, etc., to continue producing her product and so be able to improve her income and her quality of life to continue supporting her brother.

Her dream is to continue improving the home what her parents left to them.
San Lorenzo, Honduras – May, 2015

loans.use: to purchase clay, paint, paint brushes, firewood, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Shoirahon

texts.ru: Шоирахон профессионал мастер швеи. Она занимается шитьем национальной женской одежды на заказ. Шоирахон продвигает эту деятельность более 2о лет. Она целый день занимается шитьем, чтобы зарабатывать на жизнь. Ее муж тоже как Шоирахон двигается. Он занимается мастером ремонта домов.  Дети еще маленькие. Шоирахон хочет купить современную электронную швейную машинку, чтобы улучшить процесс своей работы. Ей не хватает денег купить желаемую машинку, и она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Shoirahon is a professional master seamstress. She sews national women's clothing on order. Shoirahon has been pursuing this activity for more than 20 years. All day she sews in order to earn a living. Her husband, like Shoirahon, is on the move. He is a master home repairman. The children are still small.

Shoirahon wants to buy a modern electronic sewing machine in order to improve the process of her work. Because she has insufficient money to purchase the desired machine, she applied for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase a modern sewing machine and to improve her work process.

loans.name: Blanca Ruby

texts.es:
La Joven Blanca Ruby de 24  años de edad, es soltera,  no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, vive con su papa, en casa propia casa, en la comunidad  de San Lorenzo,  valle al sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 01 año al negocio de venta de abarrotería.
Blanca Ruby está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de abarrotería como arroz, azúcar, café, huevos, pan, frijoles, harina, etc.para surtir  un poco su negocio y poder así obtener las ganancias necesarias para salir adelante con su familia. 
Solicita su primer  préstamo para capital de trabajo ya que quiere surtir bien su negocio. Su sueño es tener una mejor casa y un mejor negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2015.
texts.en:
Young Blanca Ruby, 24 years old, is single. She does not have children who depend on her. She lives with her father in her own home, in the community of San Lorenzo, in a valley in the south of Honduras, and she has made a living for 1 year from a grocery store business.

Blanca Ruby is requesting the loan to purchase groceries, such as rice, sugar, coffee, eggs, bread, beans, flour, etc., to supply her business a little and so be able to make the profits necessary to come out ahead with her family.

She is requesting her first loan for work capital since she wants to supply her business well. Her dream is to have a better home and a better business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – May, 2015

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, coffee, eggs, bread, beans, flour, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her farming through use of greenhouse planting as a modern farming technology

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients.

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is a married man. He describes himself as trustworthy. He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Cyrus will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. He hopes that in the future, he will have a large business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, de 52 años de edad, trabaja como agricultor desde muy joven, actualmente no posee ningún nivel académico, sabe un poco escribir y leer gracias a sus hijos que le enseñaron, tiene dos hijos pero ninguno vive junto a él y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Manuel, desde muy joven trabaja en la agricultura, esta actividad fue enseñada por su padre quien toda su vida fue agricultor, actualmente trabaja dos hectáreas de maíz y frijol, las cuales son herencia que su padre le dejo antes de morir, tambien tiene vacas para engordarlas y luego venderlas.

El dinero del crédito es para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizante, semilla y otros productos, porque se acerca la época ideal para realizar el cultivo de maíz.

Su principal objetivo es poder trabajar sus cultivos y tener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Manuel, age 52, has worked as a farmer since he was very young. He currently has no academic training but knows how to read and write a bit thanks to his children, who taught him. He has two children but neither live with him and his partner takes care of the household business.

Manuel has worked in agriculture since he was very young. He was taught this trade by his father, who was a farmer all his life. He currently works two hectares of corn and beans, the inheritance left to him by his father before he died. He also has cows which he fattens and then sells.

The money from this loan is to buy agricultural supplies like manure, fertilizer, seeds and other products, as the ideal time for corn cultivation is approaching.

His main objective is to be able to work on his crops and to have a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like manure, fertilizer, seeds and other products, as the ideal time for corn cultivation is approaching.

loans.name: Yesica Marilu

texts.es: Yesica, tiene 30 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos, reside en el Municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara junto a sus hijos y esposo. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio y hace varios años que inicio su pulpería en su casa donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como arroz, azúcar, huevos, frijoles, harina, manteca, condimentos y productos de aseo. Ha mantenido el negocio mediante la inversión de prestamos, actualmente solicita el tercer ciclo a la institución que es por 10,000 lempiras para comprar mas productos y surtir el negocio, comprara productos de aseo, granos básicos, leche, condimentos, manteca, huevos, harina y otros. Su propósito es que el negocio crezca aumentando las ventas y poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Yesica is 30 years old, married, has two children, and lives in the Macuelizo Municipality in Santa Bárbara with her children and husband. She has always been working in trade and several years ago she started her small grocery store in her house where she sells basic needs products such as rice, sugar, eggs, beans, flour, butter, seasoning, and cleaning supplies. 

She has kept the business by investing in loans. She is currently requesting the third cycle to the institution which is for 10,000 lempiras to buy more products and supply the business. She will buy cleaning supplies, staple grains, milk, seasoning, butter, eggs, flour, and others. Her purpose is to grow the business by increasing sales and be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products, staple grains, milk, seasoning, butter, eggs, flour, and others to supply and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself as reliable. He operates a farm where he grows maize, beans, vegetables. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a productive area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

He will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy farm inputs. His business goal is to be a large scale farmer within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have well educated children. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Sofia Yrene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de chompas, la socia sigue vendiendo su mercadería  a sus clientes que le solictan, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas entre otros.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the COMUZONE I communal bank and continues to work selling sweaters. She continues to sell her merchandise to clients who request it. 

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to following through with the payments of her installments. She is a responsible and earnest person, and because of this she is able to get her family ahead. 

She is requesting the loan in order to purchase jackets, among other things.

loans.use: to purchase jackets, among other things.

loans.name: Guzman

texts.es:
Guzman tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge en una comunidad rural dedicada a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en el distrito de San Felipe, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con terreno agrícola en el cual posee cultivos de maíz, cuenta con bastante experiencia en el rubro y muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en el distrito. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz, con esto el espera mejorar la calidad del maíz que vende a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Guzman is 42 and lives with his partner in a rural community devoted to agriculture, small business and livestock raising. It is located in the district of San Felipe, Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in Peru's northern highlands. 

He farms and has a piece of farmland where he grows corn. He has quite a lot of experience in this line and very good personal and work references in the district. 

He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and manure for maintaining his corn crop. In this way he hopes to improve the quality of the corn he sells to his customers, which will have a positive impact on his level of income, and therefore improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and manure in order to  maintain his corn crop.

loans.name: Mapatano Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kibehera est commerçante qui s’entraide avec son mari, trésorier  de la banque villageoise Mapatano, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 40 ans, mère de 3 enfants  scolarisés. Elle reçois son premier capital après récolte dans son champs. Elle est vendeuse des divers produits manufacturés sur la rue dans une avenue de la ville depuis 15 ans. Elle va acheter des biscuits, piles, savon Omo, huiles, sucre, etc. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
This client, Kibehera, is a merchant in a mutually supportive marriage. She is the treasurer of the 'banc villageois' called “Mapatano” and a client of the microfinance institution Hekima. She is married, 40 years old, and the mother of three children, who are in school. 

Kibehera received her initial capital after harvesting her fields. She has been a vendor of a variety of shop goods on an avenue in town for fifteen years. She is going to purchase cookies, batteries, Omo soap, oil, sugar, etc. Her wish is to increase her credit and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase cookies, batteries, Omo soap, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials and build her house.

loans.name: Dina Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal BUENOS AMIGOS, la socia continua ejerciendo su carrera de contadora, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo  de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de útiles de escritorio entre otros.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Buenos Amigos" (Good Friends) communal bank.  She is still working in her career as an accountant.  She is grateful for the loan she has been granted and promises to comply with her established repayment plan.  She is a responsible and diligent person, which is how she is able to get her family ahead. 
This member is requesting the loan to purchase office supplies, among other items.

loans.use: to purchase office supplies.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal BUENOS AMIGOS, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Yaneth sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta laboratorio fotográfico, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cámaras entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con todas sus cuotas
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Buenos Amigos" (Good Friends) communal bank located in Cusco District and Cusco Department.

This member, Yaneth, still works in sales at the photo lab. She has had the business for quite some time, and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into it each day. She wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family.

Yaneth is requesting the loan to purchase cameras and other items.

She is grateful for the loan she has been granted and promises to comply with all her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase cameras and other items.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal BUENOS AMIGOS, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Rosa Maria sigue con su  negocio de venta de ropa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas entre otros.

 La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con todas sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank “Buenos Amigos” (Good Friends), located in the Cusco district of the Cusco department.
Rosa Maria continues to sell clothes. She has been in this business for a while and does well thanks to the effort she puts in each day. She is a responsible and hardworking person who wants to continue working to support her family.  The member is requesting a loan to buy jackets, among other things.  She is grateful for the loan and commits to make the repayments.

loans.use: to buy jackets for sale, among other things

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en: Zachary is 31 years old, married and blessed with three children. He has a retail shop and the business has been profitable. He will be using the loan to buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil and milk to sell and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and get more income to support his family. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to expand his business and open another retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil and milk to sell and he hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and get more income to support his family.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 44 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico, vive con su cónyugue y sus dos menores hijos en la provincia de Cutervo, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería y se encuentra ubicada en la región Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café de variedad catimore, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para deshierbo de su cultivo, esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 44 years old and lives in his own home which is made of rustic materials.  He lives with his spouse and their two young children in the province of Cutervo, a community dedicated to agriculture and livestock and is located in the Cajamarca region, Northern Sierra of Peru.

He works in agriculture, specifically the cultivation of coffee Catimore variety.  He has 10 years of experience. 

The loan being requested will be used in agriculture, application and incorporation of plant protection products, fertilizers and labor for weeding crops  This will help both the physiological, morphological production of his crops as well as being able to produce a timely harvest and in turn have higher production,  and better product quality.  As such, he will have no trouble selling his product which will generate higher revenues that will enhance his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to use in agriculture, application and incorporation of plant protection products, fertilizers and labor for weeding crops.

loans.name: Deysi Arely

texts.es:
Deysi, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad que estudia primer grado y en su casa vive su mamá.

Deysi, se dedica a la venta de antojitos como enchiladas, tamales y pasteles; todo lo aprendió de su mamá que también se dedica a eso, ella se desplaza casa por casa ofreciendo y vendiendo el producto y su horario de venta es desde las 3:00 p.m. hasta las 6:00 p.m. 
  
Deysi, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos para elaborar la comida y la otra parte para pagar una pequeña operación de la vista para su mamá.  

Los sueños de Deysi, son poder comprar una plancha nueva para hacer pupusas y que su mamá se recupere para que se involucre nuevamente en el negocio.
texts.en:
Deysi is 28 years old and studied until the ninth grade. She has a 6 year-old son who is in first grade and her mother lives in their house. 

Deysi sells snacks such as enchiladas, tamales and pastries. She learned it all from her mother, who works doing the same thing. She goes from house to house offering and selling the products and her sales schedule is from 3:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m.

Deysi needs the loan in order to purchase ingredients to make the food and another portion to pay for a small eye operation for her mother. 

Deysi's dreams are to purchase a new griddle to make pupusas [stuffed tortillas], and that her mother recuperates so that she can once again be involved in the business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make food and pay for a small eye operation for her mother.

loans.name: Atyrkan

texts.ru: Атыркан, 55 лет, замужем, младшему сыну 14 лет. У Атыркан- среднее образование. Вместе с супругом на заслуженной пенсии. Атыркан оптимистично идет по жизни, знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами. В качестве дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Атыркан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 10 овец. Также имеет небольшой земельный надел мерою 0,54 ГА, на котором ежегодно сажает арбузы для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 16,650 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Атыркан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян, удобрений, клеенки для парника для выращивания органических арбузов. Доходы от кредита Атыркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса и планирует накопить средства на строительство дома.
texts.en: Atyrkan is 55 years old, married and her youngest son is 14 years old. She has a high school degree and both her and her husband are now retired. Atyrkan has an optimistic outlook on life, knows what she wants to achieve and pursues these goals on her own. In order to support her family, Atyrkan raises livestock and farms. Her farm started 20 years ago, with the purchase 10,000 som worth of animals. Atyrkan's hard work and determination over the years have expanded the herd, which now consists of two cows and ten sheep. She also has a small plot of farm land (0.5 hectares), where she grows watermelons for sale. The monthly profits from the farm are 16,650 som. In order to further develop her business, Atyrkan has turned to Bai Tushum for a loan of 70,000 som. She will use the loan to buy seed, fertilizer and plastic for her greenhouse, where she plans to grow organic watermelons. She will invest the profits from the loan back into her farm and plans to save money for building a new house.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and plastic for her greenhouse in order to grow organic watermelons

loans.name: Dúo Orfa Group

texts.es:
Dúo Orfa
Esta integrado este grupo por Maria Dali de 25 años de edad, ella desde pequeña ha sido una mujer trabajadora y se esfuerza por lograr su sueño que es llegar a independizarse de sus padres construir su propia casa pero para lograrlo necesita de la ayuda de fape que es obteniendo un crédito para invertir en su tienda que tiene desde hace 7 años, además de su tienda ella vende ropa típica los días jueves y sábado, ella quiere comprar artículos que le hacen falta en su tienda, como maíz, frijol, aceite, golosinas y algunas frutas y verduras poder vender embutidos también. Espera que fape le pueda brindar el apoyo que necesita.
texts.en:
Maria Dali is a member of the Dúo Orfa communal bank.  She is 25-years old.  She since was young, she has been a hard worker.  Now she is working toward her dream, which is becoming independent from her parents and building her own house.  To accomplish this, she needs some help from FAPE.  She needs a loan to invest in her store, which she has had for seven years.  In addition to running her store, Maria Dali sells traditional clothing on Thursdays and Saturdays.  
She wants to buy some items that her store needs, such as corn, beans, cooking oil, sweets and some fruits and vegetables.  She could sell cold cuts as well.  Maria Dali hopes that FAPE can provide her with the help she needs.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is a married woman. She has two children. She operates a farm where she grows maize, beans and other crops. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the KES 110,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and pay for labor costs. She hopes that in the future, she will provide quality education for her children. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Marcos Rafael

texts.es: Impulsado por un programa de gobierno que proponía crear microempresas, Marcos de 60 años de edad, desde la comodidad de su hogar inauguró su alquiler de lavadoras, el cual atiende todos los días a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. Esta labor consiste en llevar hasta las viviendas de  sus vecinos que no poseen este electrodoméstico una solución para que en sus hogares puedan lavar su ropa más confortablemente, tomando rentada una lavadora secadora por horas cualquier día de la semana.  Marcos lleva ejerciendo esta actividad 10 años en la que ha logrado obtener el sustento para su familia, reside en un barrio de la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias en compañía de su cónyuge y es padre de tres hijos mayores de edad a quienes educó y ofreció bienestar.  Cada vez son más los servicios solicitados por sus clientes y para poder cubrir esta demanda aplicó a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar tres lavadoras. Marcos considera que esta inversión ampliará su capacidad y con ello obtendrá mejores beneficios económicos.  Su meta a futuro en su negocio es tener 20 lavadoras.
texts.en:
Boosted by a government program that aimed at creating micro-businesses, Marcos, who is 60 years old, started his own washing machine renting business from the comfort of his home. He works every day from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m.. The work consists of taking washing machines to the houses of neighbors who don't own this home appliance. Renting a washer-dryer for a couple hours any day of the week is a convenient solution so that they can comfortably wash their clothes in their own home.

Marcos has been doing this for the past 10 years, and has managed to make a living for his family. He lives in a neighborhood of the city of Cartagena de Indias [Cartagena of the Indies], accompanied by his spouse, and is the father of 3 adult children, to whom he provided education and well-being.

His services are increasingly requested by his clients, and so that he's able to meet the demand, he has applied for a loan that he will use for the purchase of 3 washing machines. This is the first financing he does with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

Marcos considers that this investment will expand his capacity, and that with it he will obtain better economic benefits. His business goal is to have 20 washing machines.

loans.use: to buy 3 washing machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies like manure, pesticides and fertilizers to prepare the earth where she will being sowing.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos en una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio, ubicada en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como gallinas, pollos, patos, entre otros, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo lo va a utilizar para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como alimento balanceado para la crianza de estos, con esto ella espera incrementar el stock de su negocio lo que le va a permitir mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 35 years old, a single mother, lives in her own home with her two children in a community dedicated to agriculture and trade, located in the district of Lagunas province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast Peru.

She devotes herself to the breeding and sale of animals such as hens, chickens, ducks, among others.
She has experience in this business and comes with good personal and work references in her district. 

The loan will be used to purchase a greater number of animals and balanced feed for the breeding of these.  She hopes to increase the stock of her business which will allow her to improve her income and thus her quality life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater number of animals and balanced feed for raising these.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and maize seedlings for more income so as to improve family living standards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and farm tools for farming activities so as to get a batter harvest for client and family needs.

loans.name: Adalet Bariş

texts.en:
Adalet has worked in a private company for years. After retirement she did not want to sit home doing nothing. Since her homemade tarhana was very popular she started to make and sell tarhana. With the help of her second loan from Maya she purchased products in bulk to make tarhana. (Tarhana is dough made from yoghurt, tomatoes and spices and then dried and crumbled. When cooked in water it makes delicious soup).

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Adalet Hanım yıllarca özek sektörde çalışmış bir bayan. Emekli olduktan sonra zamanını boşa geçirmek istememiş. Ev yapımı tarhananın rabet görmesi ve kendisinin de bu işte usta olmasından dolayı tarhana yapıp satmaya başlamış. Maya’dan 2. kredisini kullanan Barış Hanım bu kredilerle toptan tarhana malzemesi aldı.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Anagil

texts.es:
Anagil, de 39 años de edad, solo estudio tercer grado, ya que por falta de apoyo de sus padres no siguió estudiando, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, todos sus hijos viven con ellos y están estudiando. 

Anagil, trabaja como empleada domésitca desde hace más de 10 años y le pagan $100 dolares mensuales, por su humildad y honestidad se ha mantenido en el trabajo todo este tiempo, la distancia que recorre para llegar a su trabajo es de 5 kilometros.

Anagil, necesita el crédito para comprar abono para los cultivos que está sembrando su esposo y así tener una buena cosecha.

Anagil, sueña con darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Anagil is 39 years old, and only studied up to third grade.  Due to the lack of support from her parents she did not continue with her studies.  He life long partner works in agriculture/  All their children live with them and are studying.

Anagil has worked as a housekeeper for over 10 years and she gets paid $100 per month.  Due to her humility and honesty she has been able to kept this job all this time. The distance traveled to get to work is 5 km.

Anagil needs this loan to purchase fertilizer for the crops being planted by her husband and and as such to have a good harvest.

Anagil, dreams with being able to give her family a better quality of life, and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the crops being planted by her husband and so as to have a good harvest.

loans.name: Akdana

texts.ru: Акдана, 27 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование. В качестве дохода для своей семьи, с 2008 года занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес с 2,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Акданы есть 3 коровы, лошадь, продает молоко. На участке мерою 0,23 Га собственной и 1,0 Га арендованной земли она выращивает ячмень для реализации. Вся экологически чистая продукция Акданы пользуется большим спросом и приносит хорошую прибыль в размере около 31,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Акдана планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Akdana is 27 years old, married and has three children. She has a professional degree. Akdana started a farming business in 2008 with an investment of 2,000 som, as an additional source of income for her family. Now Akdana owns three cows and a horse and sells milk. She also farms a 0.23 hectare plot as well as rents another hectare of farm land, where she grows oats for sale. Akdana's organic milk and oats are popular on the market and give her a profit of 31,000 som. In order to expand her business, Akdana turned to "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 150,000 som. She will purchase three milk cows with the loan. She plans to invest the profits from the expansion back into her farm

loans.use: to purchase three cows in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is forty-six years old. She is married and has four children, who are between the ages of twelve and twenty-two. Esther sells sachet water and crates of eggs in a store at Bubiashie. She also prepares noodles and popcorn as well. Her shop is adjacent to a senior high school in Accra so the students usually buy from her. Esther has been selling sachet water for twenty-two years. 

She would like to expand her business by buying more sachet water. She believes this will help her to increase her profit and enable her to cater for the needs of her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of drinking water to resell

loans.name: Vanensio

texts.en:
Vanensio deals in the hiring of cocoa gardens and growing and selling cocoa, which he has practiced for many years. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He earns additional income from timber cutting, selling mainly to construction firms. He works hard to meet his family's basic needs and dreams of educating all his six children. 

Vanensio is requesting a loan to use in hiring more cocoa gardens.

loans.use: to hire cocoa gardens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and maize seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and farm inputs so as to improve her farming activities for better produce for sale in the market, meeting client and family needs.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as competent. She operates a farm where she grows maize and also keeps livestock. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a productive area, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be bad weather. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. Her business goal is to have a stable income within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is forty-one years old. She is single and has a fifteen-year-old daughter who is in senior high school. Abena sells sachet water for a living and has done this business for five years.  According to Abena, the demand for her water is very high since her shop is near a school. However, her income is not enough to enable her to expand the business. 

With this loan, Abena will be able to buy more sachets and bottled drinking water to sell and earn enough income to cater for her needs and her fifteen-year-old daughter's.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sachet water and boxes of bottled drinking water to resell

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es:
Ana, de 36 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su hogar, tiene 3 hijos, los cuales tienen las edades de 17, 12 y 9 años de edad, todos viven juntos y son quienes dependen directamente de ella.

Ana, tiene 3 años de ejercer la venta de tortillas en su casa, estes negocio le permite generar ingresos sostenibles para sus hijos y ella.

Ana, necesita el crédito para comprar más maíz y leña, todo para un mejor servicio y mejorar sus ganancias.

Ana, sueña con que sus hijos se preparen academicamente y formen su propio hogar.
texts.en:
Ana is 36 years old, and is dedicated to the domestic chores of her home.  She has 3 children, who are 17, 12 and 9 years old.  They all live together and are directly dependent on her.  

Ana has been selling tortillas from her home for three years now.  Her business generates enough sustainable income for her children and herself.

Ana needs this loan to purchase more corn and firewood, all to provide better services and thus improve her profits.

Ana dreams of her children being able to prepare academically and be able to form their own homes.

loans.use: to purchase more corn and firewood.

loans.name: Valerio

texts.en: Valerio is a widower. He has a 17-year-old daughter, and the family has their own house. Valerio is a driver and needs a loan to pay for the maintenance of his minibus. He hopes you can help him because he is the only one that earns money in his household. He hopes you can trust him. Valerio is healthy, and he works hard because he wants to give his daughter a good education.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his minibus

loans.name: Sixto

texts.en:
Sixto has a girlfriend and the couple have two kids. The family lives in an adobe house. Sixto and his girlfriend are farmers. They have experience with cows, and they sell milk. He is healthy and his girlfriend is always helping him.

Sixto needs a loan to buy a dairy cow. It so happens that he needs to replace one of his cows because of the age of the animal. Sixto hopes you can help him because the milking business is the only way of making a living that he knows.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Cristo Moreno Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CRISTO MORENO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Doris Felicitas ella es casada y tiene 66 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ferreteria,la socia vende clavos, pinturas y alambres, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de ferreteria.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar clavos, pinturas y alambres.
La socia que estan pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieo permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de cosmeticos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Cristo Moreno" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco in the Cusco Province of the Cusco Region. 

Doris Felicitas is the member. She is married, she is 66 years old and has five children. She works at her business of home hardware, she sells nails, paint, wires and works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m., she has several years in the business and does well.  Her dream is to expand her business.  She requests a loan to buy nails, paint and wires.

The other members whose photos are attached to the group photo had their pictures taken after the meeting for work-related reasons. The other members of the group have businesses selling clothing, cosmetics, and groceries, as well as a restaurant. The member is grateful for those who are part of making her dream come true through this loan and is committed to complying with the loan repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy nails, paint and wires

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing, such as gentlemen's shirts, ladies' blouses, and undergarments for both sexes.

loans.name: Tulgonoi

texts.ru: Тулгоной, 35 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. Образование-средне-специальное, на протяжении 15 лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Ежемесячный доход на сегодняшний день составляет около 19,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Тулгоной, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее хозяйство в виде 12 овец. На участке мерою 1,80 Га она выращивает органические арбузы и хлопок, есть парник. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тулгоной обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, рассады. Доходы от кредита Тулгоной планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение ее бизнеса и постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Tulgonoi is 35 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. She has a specialist high school education, and has been practicing field and animal husbandry for 15 years. Her monthly income now amounts to around 19,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Tulgonoi's hard work, she has a good farm with 12 sheep. She raises organic watermelons and cotton on a plot of land measuring 1.8 hectares, and she has a greenhouse.

In order to further expand her business, Tulgonoi has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizer and seedlings. Tulgonoi plans to use the proceeds from her loan to further expand her business and build a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers in order to grow organic watermelons and cotton.

loans.name: Palmira

texts.en:
Palmira is 53 years old. She is working as a secretary now. She is also a seamstress, and she makes scarves. She needs a loan to buy a machine that will help her to make more scarves in less time. 

Palmira hopes you can help her. She is having troubles at her secretarial job, so she would like to quit and to dedicate all her time to her scarf business. Palmira is divorced so she doesn't have any support.

loans.use: to buy a machine that will help her to make more scarves in less time

loans.name: Heyser Navidel

texts.es:
La joven Heyser es una joven emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio la cual es la compra y venta de cerdos para crianza, esta actividad la realiza hace más de dos años y cuenta una pequeña porqueriza en el patio de su casa de habitación.
Heyser sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos de su comunidad, ella compra los cerdos aun buen precio y luego los engorda para después revenderlos a un mejor precio, también compra cerdos de 40 días de nacidos y los cría por cuatro o seis meses y posteriormente los vende a un mejor precio, solicita el apoyo del credito para la compra  de seis cerdos grandes para revenderlos en la comunidad ya que en esta temporada hay escases de los mismos.
Heyser sueña con poder ampliar la porqueriza y así poder comprar más cerdos y a su vez incrementar su venta para seguir con sus estudios universitarios.  



 Danli, Honduras – Mayo del  2015
texts.en:
Young Heyser is an enterprising and dedicated to her business woman.  She dedicates herself to the buying and selling of pigs for breeding.  She has been carrying out this activity for over two years.  She has a small pigsty in the courtyard of the house where she resides.

Heyser's customers are friends and neighbors in her community.  She buys pigs at a good price and then fattens them up and then resells them at a better price.  She buys pigs from 40 days old and breeds them for four to six months and then they are sold at a better price.  

She is requesting the support of a loan to purchase six large pigs so as to resell them within the community since in this season there is a shortage of them.

Heyser dreams to expand the pigsty so she can buy more pigs and in turn increase their sales and as such be able to continue her university studies.

loans.use: with the purchase of pigs for her business.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
Jacqueline tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como leche, aceite, arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, art. de aseo, entre otros, cuenta con clientela fija que en la mayoría son sus vecinos y moradores de su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una cantidad mayor de productos y así surtir su negocio y poder atender a todos los pedidos de sus clientes; de esta manera generará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia mejorará.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 37 years old. She and her children live together in the district of Oyotún, a community of farmers, merchants and ranchers located in the the Chiclayo Province, part of the Lambayeque Region on the north coast of Peru.

She sells groceries for a living, such as milk, oil, rice, sugar, sodas and hygiene products, among other things. She counts on a regular clientele, most of whom are her neighbours and people living in her district. She has requested a loan for the purchase of a larger quantity of products to stock her business and to be able to attend to all of her clients’ requests. This way, she will generate more income and better profits, and as a result her quality of life and that of her family will improve.

loans.use: purchase a larger quantity of products to stock her business.

loans.name: Nesrin

texts.en:
Nesrin has a child and she makes her living by selling cleaning products from a catalog. She started this on the advice of one of her friends. She goes to her friends' meetings and gatherings, gets orders and makes sales over there. She has a lot of customers. With the help of her third loan from Maya she purchased materials in bulk and increased her profit. She wants to be a leader in this sales through network business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nesrin Hanım bir çocuk annesi ve katalogdan temizlik ürünleri satarak oğlunun ve kendisinin geçimini sağlıyor. Bir arkadaşının tavsiyesi ile bu işe başlamış. Satışlarını altın günlerinde ve ev toplantılarında yapıyor ve sürekli bir müşteri çevresi var. Maya’dan 3. kredisini kullanan Nesrin Hanım toptan ürün alarak kar oranını artırdı. Gelecekte yaptığı network işinde lider olmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products

loans.name: Cahide

texts.en:
Cahide is a mother of two. In order to pay for her children's education needs she sells cleaning products from her network system. At first she had trouble making sales, but as time passed and she gained experience she increased her sales and the number of customers. This is her third loan. With this loan she will buy products.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Cahide Hanım iki çocuk annesi. Çocuklarını eğitim masraflarını karşılamak için network (temizlik ürünleri) işi yapıyor. Bu işe başladığında satış yapmakta zorlanmış, tecrübeleri arttıkça satışlarını ve üye sayısını da artırmış. Cahide Hanım Maya’dan 3. kredisini kullanıyor. Aldığı kredi ile ürün alacak.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Yüksel

texts.en:
Yüksel is 56 years old and has three children. In order to support her children she started a business selling cleaning products via network. She started this business to get herself the cleaning products for a good price. Later on she started selling the products to her neighbours. With the help of the loan from Maya she purchased materials in bulk, thus increasing both her profit and the number of her customers.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Yüksel Hanım 56 yaşında ve 3 çocuk annesi. Yüksel hanım çocuklarına destek olmak amacıyla network işine başlamış. Önce bu işe kendi temizlik ürünlerini daha ucuza almak için girmiş daha sonra çevresine satış yapmaya başlamış. Maya’dan aldığı krediler ile toptan ürün aldı böylece hem müşteri çevresini hem de karını artırdı.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products

loans.name: Wendlayembré Group

texts.fr: Karidiata, responsable du groupe est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle exerce dans le domaine de la restauration depuis 7 ans et sa spécialité c'est le haricot au maïs. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter du haricot et du maïs pour préparer et vendre. Après ses ventes, elle pourra avoir un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire ses propres dépenses et aussi aider son époux dans la gestion de la famille.
texts.en: Karidiata, the group’s official, is a married mother of five. She has been working in the restaurant domain for seven years and specializes in beans with corn. She has need of this loan to purchase some beans and corn to cook and resell. After her sales, she will have a profit enabling her to cover her own expenses and also to help out her husband in managing the family.

loans.use: to purchase beans and corn to cook and sell

loans.name: Siraj

texts.en:
Siraj is a married man, aged 40 years, living in a rural area with his family of seven children. He operates a retail shop. He has additional income from agriculture/ farming where he grows crops such as bananas, maize, and beans and also from his transport business. He started this business in 2002.

He works 12 hours per day and he acquired this loan for school fees and to buy more stock for his business.   

Siraj has hopes of expanding into a large business which can supply all the people around. His clients are traders from his village, and the surrounding places. The challenges he faces are bad debts from customers.  He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man. He appreciates lenders for the services rendered to him.

loans.use: To pay tuition and buy stock for his store

loans.name: Rashidatu

texts.en:
Rashidatu is a twenty-six-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two children. She is a trader who sells sachet and bottled water as well as soft drinks. Rashidatu is a very hardworking young woman. Her husband is a commercial driver. He supports her and her children. 

Rashidatu is requesting a loan to buy more sachet and bottled water to sell. This loan will help her increase her income as well as expand her business.

loans.use: To buy sachet and bottled water and resell it to her customers

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.en: Emiliana is 46 years old and she is living at her parents' house. She is still making shoes. She is helped with the sales by her parents. Emiliana needs another loan to buy leather, buckles, rubber heels, and other supplies for making women's shoes. Emiliana is working hard and she is the only one that makes money in her house. She hopes you can help her again.

loans.use: to buy leather, buckles, rubber heels, and other supplies for making women's shoes.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva is 53 years old. She is a widow who lost her husband a couple of years ago and she has a son. At least Genoveva has her own house.

Genoveva is a farmer and she needs a loan to buy a dairy cow. She learned about the business when she was a child. She hopes you can help her. She is the only one at her home who supports her family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon is 71 years old and is a widower with no children. He is a farmer who sells milk to a commercial dairy. He learned about the business when he was a kid. He needs a loan to buy a milking cow.

Ramon is a senior citizen so he needs help. Because of his age, many people think he is not strong enough to do the job, but he is ready to work harder. He really needs to sell more milk. He hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Tuungane A Group

texts.fr: Aline est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise «Tuungane A», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 39 ans, divorcée, mère 2 enfants tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari, quand ils étaient encore ensemble. Elle est vendeuse de friperies au marché de la ville depuis 13 ans. Pour accroitre son activité, elle va acheter 2 ballons de friperies. Elle souhaite, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Aline is a merchant and a member of the 'banc villageois' called “Tuungane A”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 39 years old, divorced, and the mother of two children, both in school. 

Aline began her business with funds from her husband when they were still together. She has been a vendor of secondhand clothing at the market in town for 13 years. To grow her business, she is going to buy 2 bales of used clothing. Her wish is to provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bales of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Tuungane B Group

texts.fr: Syalandira est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire «Tuungane B», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, divorcée, âgée de 36 ans, mère 4 enfants scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son petit ami. Elle est vendeuse des poissons frais dans le marché secondaire de la ville depuis 8 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 100 poissons. Elle souhaite construire une maison, augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Syalandira is a merchant and a member of the community bank called “Tuungane B”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 36 years old, divorced, and the mother of four children in school. 

Syalandira began her business with funds from her friend. She has been a vendor of fresh fish at the town’s secondary market for eight years. She is going to supply herself with 100 fish. Her wish is to build a house, increase her capital, and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up with 100 fish

loans.name: Iragi Group

texts.fr: Kambale est commerçante du collectif d’affaires «Iragi», entrepreneur, âgée de 22 ans, mariée à un chauffeur, mère de 4 enfants, dont 1 étudie et 3 sont encore gosses. La cliente est vendeuse des produits cosmétiques dans un salon de beauté non loin du marché de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu d’un crédit. Plus tard, il bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 5 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter des produits cosmétiques, de maquillages, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, construire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs exclus non bancables. Nous tenons à signaler, qu'une cliente porte son bébé
texts.en:
Kambale is a small-scale merchant from the business group called «Iragi», an entrepreneur, aged 22, married to a driver and the mother of four children, one of whom attends school while the other three are still very young. This client sells cosmetics in a beauty shop not far from the town market. She began her business with the first capital she received from a loan. Later, she received a loan from MFI Hekima. 

She has been in this business for five years. This new loan will be used to buy cosmetics, make-up, etc. In this way, she hopes to buy a plot of land, build on it, send her children to school, and feed them. To conclude, she thanks Hekima most kindly for supporting small entrepreneurs who are excluded from regular banking services. 

Note that one of the clients is holding her baby.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, make-up, etc.

loans.name: Tupatane Group

texts.fr: Furaha est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Tupatane», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée a un technicien maçon, âgée de 27 ans, mère 7 enfants dont 4 étudient et 3 sont gosses. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des huiles de palmes au marché de la ville depuis 5 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 40 litres d’huiles de palme. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses  enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Furaha is a merchant and a member of the loan group called “Tupatane”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is married to a mason, and she is 27 years old and the mother of seven children, of whom four are students, and three are very young. 

Furaha began her business with funds from her husband. She has been a vendor of palm oil at the town market for five years. She is going to supply herself with 40 liters of palm oil. Her wish is to increase her capital and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up with 40 liters of palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more beans to sell.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en: Delfina is an artisan from Mexico who specializes in Zapotec wool rugs. She would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including firewood, dyes and wool, as well as to hire additional weavers for her workshop. Delfina has been selling through Novica since 2011. This is her story: Delfina from Mexico grew up with parents who were Zapotec rug artisans. "When I was 18, I created my first piece. This is the art my parents dedicated their lives to, and it's what I know best." "My family and I are quite grateful for this microcredit. It is thanks to you all that we are able to enjoy our work and channel our passion through our craft." Use the link below to view Delfina's Zapotec wool rugs on the Novica site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/7876
