loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including firewood, dyes and wool, as well as to hire additional weavers for her workshop

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
Nicanor es un hombre de 38 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos varones de 15 y 17 años, y 3 hijas mujeres de 3, 12 y 13 años, y su negocio es la producción de estuco.
Él es emprendedor, buen padre, optimista, generoso, paciente, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Vichaya’ caracterizado por sus grandes campos, antiguamente este lugar era un área formada por frondosos vichayos que alimentaban al ganado que aquí se criaba, situada al oeste de la ciudad, a una altura de 4000 metros sobre el nivel del mar, de clima frío y seco durante todo el año, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre -1/16 grados centígrados.
Nicanor es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica al mismo negocio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela excepto el menor que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante una bomba eléctrica. Su negocio es la producción de estuco; este es un grano fino compuesto de cal apagada, mármol pulverizado, yeso, pigmentos naturales, etc. Y se endurece al ser mesclada con agua. Se utiliza para revestir paredes y techos, “toda la familia nos dedicamos a este trabajo, los niños van a la escuela y después ayudan…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que sus clientes demandan el producto, la desventaja es la falta de agua y combustible para trabajar.  Su sueño es comprar un camión donde transportar las piedras, él desea abastecer su negocio mediante la compra de carbón y combustible para la explotación de estuco. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 16 años que desarrolla esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Nicanor solicita un préstamo para la compra de carbón y combustible para la explotación de estuco y con los beneficios comprar un camión.
texts.en:
Nicanor, 38, has two sons, 17- and 15-years old, and three daughters, 13-, 12- and 3-years old.  He is enterprising, optimistic and hard-working.  He started his building materials business in Vichaya, a rural area named for a leafy plant that people here used for feeding their cattle.  The area is west of El Alto and some 4,000 meters above sea level.  It is cold and dry here, with temperatures that can vary up to 16 degrees Centigrade during the day.
Nicanor is dark-skinned with brown eyes and short, black hair.  He speaks both Aymara, his native language and the language he speaks at home, and Spanish.  His wife helps with his business and all of his children but the youngest are in school.  The family lives in a modest adobe house with electricity and water.  (The water is drawn by electric pump from a well.)  
Nicanor manufactures stucco, a fine-grained material made with quicklime, crushed marble, natural pigments that becomes very durable when mixed with water.  The finished material is used to plaster walls and ceilings.  "My whole family works at the business . . . Even the children help when after they finish their school work", says Nicanor.  The best thing about the business, he says, is that there is a lot of demand for stucco.  The biggest worry he faces is a shortage of fuel and water.  For the future, he wants to buy a truck for transporting supplies, e.g., stone, for the business.  
Nicanor is applying for a loan that he will use to stock fuel for making stucco.  He has operated the business for 16 years and this is his first loan from our bank.  The investment will allow him to carry on his business and earn the money he needs to buy a truck.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his building materials business.

loans.name: Magnifique Group

texts.fr: Aziza est une commerçante qui s’entraide avec son mari, conseillère d’un groupe de crédits «Magnifique», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 46 ans et mère de 7 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse  divers habillements dans un magasin de la ville depuis 15 ans. Elle va acheter des pantalons, des robes, des chemises, vestes, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Aziza is a merchant in a mutually supportive marriage. She is the advisor of the loan group called “Magnifique”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 46 years old and the mother of seven children, all in school. She has been a vendor of a variety of clothing in a store in town, for fifteen years. She is going to purchase some pants, dresses, shirts, jackets, etc. Thus, her wish is to increase her capital and provide schooling and food for her children. She thanks Hekima for supporting entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase pants, dresses, shirts, jackets, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Rosas Del Sargento Group

texts.es:
Dúo Rosas Del Sargento
Este dúo está formado por María Ángela es originaria del caserío el sargento, se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral como lo son: Pavos, Gallinas, Patos y Conejos, tiene la gran ventaja de vivir en un área que se presta para criar esta clase de animales. Este es el tercer crédito que solicita en los anteriores pago puntualmente. Con el crédito ha podido comprar más pollos para crecerlos y luego venderlos ya más grandes, esto le está ayudando a cumplir su sueño de tener un mejor ingreso para así ayudar a su esposo en darle lo mejor a sus pequeños hijos. Solicita el crédito para comprar concentrado para aves, vitaminas y desparasitantés.
texts.en:
Dúo Rosas Del Sargento: This group was formed by Maria Angela who is originally from the village Sargento. Maria Angela makes a living raising poultry such as: turkey, chickens, ducks and also rabbits. She has the advantage of living in an area which is perfect for raising these types of animals. 

This is the third loan being sought, the other two were repaid on time. With these loans Maria Angela was able to buy more chickens to raise and later to sell when they were bigger. This work is helping her to fulfil her dream of making more money to be able to support her husband in giving the best to their small children. 

This loan will be used to buy poultry feed, vitamins and 'de-parasites'.

loans.use: to buy feed for poultry (chickens, etc)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various items for resale

loans.name: Solidario Guadalupe De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Solidario Guadalupe de San Pedro La encargada de este grupo es la señora Blanca quien se dedica a la venta de ropa de paca variada como blusas, pantalones para damas, caballeros y niños. También cubrecamas, sabanas y ropa de bebe. Su sueño es dejar de vender en las calles y tener un local propio. En estas fechas de verano hay muy buena venta de ropa y ya tiene varios pedidos de blusas, short, licras y por tal razón necesita otro crédito para no quedarle mal a sus clientes.
texts.en: “Solidario Guadalupe from San Pedro La Encargada”, this is the name of the group that Blanca is a member of.  She works selling various types of clothing like blouses, pants for women, men and children.  She also sells quilts, sheets and baby clothing.  Her dream is to stop selling in the streets and have her own store.  During this summer season there are good sales of clothing and she now has several orders of blouses, shorts, sport tights and this is why she needs another loan to meet her client’s demands.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 3 fishing nets.

loans.name: Gilmar Abimelec

texts.es:
Gilmar, de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado.

Gilmar, tiene 4 años de trabajar en una panadería, donde el propietario es su padre, es ahí de donde provienen los ingresos que día a día necesita.

Gilmar, decidió solicitar un crédito para comprar una motocicleta; este medio de transporte lo necesita para movilizarse a su trabajo.

A futuro Gilmar, desea ver su vida realizada con su propio negocio y una familia muy grande.
texts.en:
Gilmar, 20, left school after the third grade.  He has worked as a baker at his father's bakery business for 4 years.  His earnings there cover his everyday needs.  

Gilmar is applying for a loan that he will use to buy a motorcycle, transportation that he needs to get to and from work.

For the future, Gilmar wants to have a business of his own and a large family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, de 30 años de edad, actualmente acompañada, es madre de 4 hijos, es empleada en un comedor en las cercanías de su comunidad y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura.

Blanca, está solicitando un crédito para mejorar su vivienda, especficicamente comprará lámina, teja y clavos, porque cuando vengan los días de lluvia, ella y su familia estarán seguras.

Su sueño a futuro es tener una vivienda segura y en optimas condiciones para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Blanca, 30 years old and currently in a relationship, is a mother of 4 children. She is an employee at a cafeteria in the vicinity of her community and her partner is in farming.

Blanca is requesting a loan to improve her home. She will specifically buy metal sheets, tiles, and nails, because when rainy days come, she and her family will be safe.

Her dream for the future is to have a home that is safe and in optimal conditions for her children.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, tiles, and nails.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
.El socio pertenece al banco comunal MILENIUM III.
El socio Porfirio tiene 58 años de edad  y es casado, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  a su negocio de venta de helados, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos como azucar,frutas entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas
texts.en:
Porfirio belongs to the communal bank "Millennium III". 

He is 58 years old and married, dividing his time between his daily activities and his business selling ice cream. He has been in this business for quite a while, and it is going well thanks to the effort he puts into it every day.

Porfirio wants to keep working hard to continue supporting his family. He is requesting the loan to buy ingredients such as sugar and fruit, among others. He is grateful for the loan given to him and is committed to making his payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar and fruit, among others.

loans.name: Farides

texts.es: Farides de 51 años es  residente en un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Barranquilla.  Su idea de negocio nació gracias a la experiencia que adquirió en la venta de quesos en la que una amiga la empleó, quien le propuso que desde su vivienda comercializara este producto lácteo.  Con el pasar del tiempo Farides logró ahorrar e independizarse, continuó desde su casa vendiendo queso e inclusive ofreciendo más productos; buñuelos de queso, hielo, bolis de frutas (jugos congelados y empacados en pequeñas bolsas) y minutos a celular.  Hoy en día cuenta con cinco años de experiencia y una clientela fidelizada, quienes pueden realizar sus compras a partir de las 2 p.m. hasta las 8 p.m.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar queso al por mayor e incrementar su ganancia.  Su principal desafío es lograr más utilidades y con ellas poder estar más cerca de cumplir su meta de tener un local comercial.
texts.en:
Farides, 51 years old, is a resident of a neighbourhood located in the municipality of Barranquilla. Her business idea was born thanks to the experience she gained in the cheese shop where a friend hired her and suggested she sell the milk product out of her home.

With time, Farides managed to save up and become independent, continuing to sell cheese out of her home and even offering more products: cheese fritters, ice, fruit “bolis” (frozen juice packaged in little bags) and cell phone minutes. Today, she relies on five years of experience and a loyal clientele, who can make their purchases from 2 p.m. until 8 p.m.

She is currently requesting a Kiva loan, her first funding from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase cheese wholesale and increase her earnings. Her main challenge is to attain more profits with which she will be closer to achieving her goal of having a commercial location.

loans.use: to purchase cheese wholesale and increase her earnings.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en: Suleiman is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Rimi Village. He joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Suleiman suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to move his family into a better home. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Suleiman has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria, which will enable him to earn an income of up to 2,000 USD/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 120 bags of maize this year, Suleiman can now ensure that his children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Nueva Vision Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA VISION” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lourdes es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de lácteos, venta de crema chantillí, venta de mantas, venta de chuño, venta de ropa para bebé, servicio de duchas y servicio de reaparacion de movilidades livianas y venta de alimentos enlatados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lourdes es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer desde hace cuatro años, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de alimentos enlatados; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió desde hace veinte años por iniciativa propia.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra alimentos enlatados por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The eight members of the "NUEVA VISION" community bank are starting their fifth round of funding with Pro Mujer.  Sra. Lourdes is the president of the group.  The members operate various businesses--clothing sales; food sales; and vehicle repair services, for example--and your loan will help them to carry on the businesses.

Lourdes first joined with Pro Mujer four years ago, after a friend recommended that she consider it.  She has operated a business buying and selling canned goods for 20 years and will use her share of the loan to stock her business.  She will buy wholesale supplies of canned goods from wholesalers in El Alto and resell them to her customers.  Lourdes is a single mother and the investment will allow her to carry on her business and provide for her son.

When we asked Lourdes what she likes about Pro Mujer, she told us that she likes the training and health-related benefits that the organization provides.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies of canned goods for her retail business.

loans.name: Faustino Americo

texts.es:
Faustino tiene 48 años edad, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge y su menor hijo en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén ,región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales principalmente.

El se dedica a la venta de aves de corral, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 5 años, adicionalmente se dedica a brindar servicios como peón agrícola. El crédito que solicita será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto el espera aumentar su nivel de ingresos lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Faustino, 48, lives in Pucara with his wife and young son.  Some of the people of Pucara, in Peru's northern mountains, make their living farming and raising animals.  Others operate small commercial businesses.

Faustino has operated a poultry sales business for 5 years.  He also works as a farm laborer.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy more birds for his business.  He expects the investment to increase his income and allow him to better provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy animals for his animal sales business.

loans.name: Wilmer Noel

texts.es:
Noel, de 23 años de edad, es un joven muy apasionado  por su  familia y su trabajo, se dedica a la venta de lotería, está acompañado y tiene un hijo de 6 meses de nacido.

Noel, se dedica a la venta de lotería desde hace 3 años consecutivos, por lo que ya lleva varios años en este negocio y tiene bastante experiencia en eso, fue su cuñado quien le enseño el trabajo y al marcharse para el extranjero le dejo su clientela.

Noel, necesita el dinero para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, específicamente está construyendo su casa de bloque, para mayor seguridad de su familia y su pequeño hijo.

Noel, en un futuro planea seguir mejorando su vivienda y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Noel is a 33-year-old young man who is very passionate about his family and his work. He sells lottery tickets, is married, and has a 6-month-old son.

Noel has sold lottery tickets for three consecutive years, which means that he now has lots of time and sufficient experience in this business. It was his brother-in-law who taught him the job and who then went abroad and Noel inherited his clientele.

Noel needs the money to make improvements on his house. Specifically, he is constructing a block house to give his family and his little son greater security.

In the future, Noel plans to continue improving his house and his quality of life.

loans.use: Make significant improvements on his house.

loans.name: Sofad

texts.en:
SOFAD is a women’s organization working for several years to strengthen the agricultural sector in Acul-du-Nord, especially in the area of Déricou. Its main activities are shopkeeping, animal husbandry, and cultivation of cocoa, groundnuts, rice, and bananas.

In 2012, following the difficulties encountered by local women for the purchase of seeds, SOFAD opened a farm shop to relieve the people, especially the women, living in Déricou. The following year the demands have doubled, yet lack of economics means they could meet only a small part.

Over the years, SOFAD understood the need for strengthening the shop storage capacity to serve a larger portion of the population. Thus, they are looking for funding in order to achieve this goal.

loans.use: to purchase 200 pots of peanut seeds, 100 pots of black bean seeds, 350 pots of rice seeds, fertilizer, and weed killer.

loans.name: La Paix Virunga Group

texts.fr: Biregeyi est artiste, commerçante, membre  de la banque communautaire «La Paix Virunga», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 33 ans, célibataire responsable, mère de 3 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de ses parents. Elle est vendeuse des braserons et paniers au marché de la ville depuis  20 ans. Pour accroitre son activité, elle va s’approvisionner en paniers, braserons, etc. Elle souhaite, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Biregeyi is an artist, businesswoman, and member of the loan group "La Paix Virunga" (Virunga Peace), a client of the microfinance institution, Hekima. She is a 33 year-old single mother, caring for three children who are all in school. She started her business with some funds her parents gave her. She has been selling braziers and baskets at the market for 20 years. To increase her activity, she will supply herself with baskets, braziers, etc. She wishes to educate and feed her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support they bring to uncredited entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy baskets, braziers, etc.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, es muy trabajador que a pesar de su edad es muy activo y lucha por su familia, el vive con su esposa, una hija y un hijo, los demás emigraron a Estados Unidos para poder buscar un mejor futuro.

José, se dedica a la agricultura, el siembra granos básicos como maiz y frijol, el asegura que le gusta mucho su trabajo.

José, solicita el crédito para poder comprar los insumos agricolas para hacer su milpa.

José, desea ver a su familia feliz y con una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is a hard worker who, despite his age, is very active and continues to battle on behalf of his family. He lives with his wife, a daughter and a son. The other family members have emigrated to the United States to be able to seek out a better future.

Jose is dedicated to agriculture. He sows basic grains such as corn and beans, and he assures us that he loves his work.

Jose is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural inputs so that he can plant his new crops.

In the future, Jose wants to see his family happy and living a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase the agricultural inputs needed to plant his crops of basic grains.

loans.name: José Ándres

texts.es:
Andrés, es un hombre felizmente casado, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, dice sentirse muy feliz por su familia y es por quienes lucha día a día.

Andrés, se dedica a la agricultura desde siempre, trabaja con granos básicos como maíz, frijol y maicillo.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar abono y pesticidas, que necesita para hacer su milpa.

Andrés, desea que sus hijos sean personas de bien y que estudien y logren llegar a tener un buen trabajo y una familia para que sean felices y sigan el ejemplo de sus padres.
texts.en:
Andres is a happily married man, he lives with his wife and children. He feels happy for his family for whom he fights every day.

Andres has always worked in agriculture, growing basic grains like corn and beans.

He needs the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his corn field.

Andres wishes that his children become good people and study and are able to get a good job and a family so they can be happy and follow the example of their parents.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his corn field.

loans.name: Laura Celia

texts.en:
Laura is 45 years old. She is divorced and has a 15-year-old son. She also supports her mother.

She owns a stationery and office supplies store. The store was opened by her parents, but two years ago they stopped working and she took charge of the business and the family expenses. She buys her inventory in downtown Mexico from some recurring suppliers. The store is located in her house, so she doesn't pay rent.

Laura is asking for a loan to buy supplies and inventory for her store. She says that the store has a great location because it is near four different schools. By having more inventory, she hopes to increase sales and grow the business.

loans.use: to buy stationery and office supplies for her store.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 47-year-old married woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two sons and three daughters. Her husband is an auto repair mechanic by profession. He has been running an auto repair workshop in the market, where he performs his services. He also has spare parts in the workshop for exchange into autos during repair. He needs to purchase some tools and spare parts for his workshop. This will help him to continue his work and to work more efficiently and professionally. He does not have enough funds to purchase the needed things. Therefore his wife, Parveen, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts for her husband's auto repair workshop.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is a fisherman who catches and sells a variety of fresh fish to the locals in his location.  He is a 57 year old married man with seven children.  He has been engaged in fishing for more than 10 years. His youngest child is 17 year old.

He has requested a loan to buy fishing nets. Thus, he will be able to augment his on going catch.  Romeo could now be able to sell a higher quantity of fish.  Thus, slowly his income  will improve and he will be able to provide his children with nutritious diets. He could now be able to finance the college education of his children.

In the future, he dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets to be able to catch and sell more fish so as to feed his children

loans.name: Leelen

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Leelen works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and general store. Leelen is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Leelen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Providing jobs, increasing available crop output, buying a home, paying for his children’s education – these are just some of the things going around Patrick’s mind. Patrick is a 47-year-old, smallholder farmer based in Nkubu, which is a small agricultural center. He owns a small piece of land together with his lovely wife, and they have been blessed with a lovely family. On the land, they have kept poultry, cows and grown vegetables for 20 years. Their main income sources are eggs, milk and crops. They recently ventured into a small personal business. 

From Kiva lenders, Patrick is seeking a loan worth KES 20,000 to buy seeds and grow his horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. 

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to afford Patrick access to a loan that will aid him to grow his horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Patrick’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: To buy seeds and start horticulture farming to diversify his income and reduce vulnerability

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like peanuts, milk, sugar, etc for her food vending business.

Lorna has been in this business for 3 years. Lorna earns more income from pig fattening.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like peanuts, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: José Ernesto

texts.es:
José, está acompañado, tiene dos hijos, vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos, su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios del hogar.

José, trabaja como vigilante en una empresa y también se dedica a la agricultura, aunque trabaje como empleado y gane un salario, para él no es suficiente para mantener a su familia, es por eso que también cultiva maíz para el consumo del hogar.

José, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos para cultivar maíz y así poder tener los granos básicos para su familia.

José, desea para el futuro seguir trabajando en su empleo y también en la agricultura, para sacar adelante a su familia y vivir mejor.
texts.en:
José has a life partner and two children. He lives with his partner and two children. His life partner takes care of the domestic tasks.

José works as a guard for a business. He also makes his living in agriculture. Although he works as an employee and makes a wage, it is not enough for him to support his family. That is why he also grows corn for household consumption.

José needs a loan to buy supplies to grow corn so that he can have basic staples for his family. José wants a secure future working at his job and also in agriculture to get his family ahead and live better.

loans.use: to buy supplies to grow corn.

loans.name: Diseree

texts.en:
Diseree is a businesswoman who earns through her snack-vending business. Her husband is a farmer focusing on rice farming, and he also works on construction as a carpenter.

Diseree is a full-fledged member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Diseree wants to start building her own house to live comfortably with her family. Recently, she applied for a loan. This loan is intended to pay for the coconut tree cutting and lumbering. She is on her way to preparing and gathering the needed light construction materials for the building of her house.

She is thankful because, if it were not for Paglaum MPC, she would not be able to build her own house.

loans.use: to pay for the coconut tree cutting and lumbering.

loans.name: Janemar

texts.en:
Janemar is 30 years old and married. She lives with her husband and three children in Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur. For the past five years, Janemar and her husband have been farmers. She earns 15,000 PHP each cropping, focusing on her rice farm.

Janemar became an active member of PMPC in 2013. She is now requesting a 14,900 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer and herbicides in order to have a heavier and higher crop yield on her rice farm.

In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business to improve the general living conditions of her family and provide her children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides in order to have a heavier and higher crop yield on her rice farm.

location.town: Pagadian - Bagalupa, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia has a food vending business in Sindangan, Philippines. This has been doing well in supporting the needs of the family. Natalia has local customers and also accepts orders for additional income. 

Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her business. She wants to expand her business and would be happy to be able to open a small eatery.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her business.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo lives in Tabasco and has done so all his life. He works as an employee for a local farmer. Alfredo, his children and their mother live together in what they call their home. Their house needs a lot of work done. Most important is replacing some of the perishable and dangerous materials it is built with. 

Alfredo and his family have been saving but they still need a loan to finish paying for the materials. Since Alfredo has no proof of income and no savings account, no other financial institution will give him credit. This loan will not only help him with materials but also with the opportunity to start a credit history, supervision on the construction of his house and, most importantly, an opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for materials to replace perishable materials in his current home.

loans.name: Nancy Veronica

texts.es:
Nancy  es una joven ecuatoriana de 20 años de edad , esta casada   gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la primaria  y luego  la falta de recursos económicos lo llevó a trabajar desde muy chica para poder sustentar sus necesidades y poder ayudar en las necesidades de su familia, Nancy  es oriunda de la ciudad de Latacunga, viven en un barrio rural de  la ciudad junto a su  esposo casa propia, por ende no pagan arriendo.
El mayor obstáculo que han tenido ha sido la falta de financiamiento para poder hacer que su negocio crezca, actualmente tiene un  sueño que consiste en emprender su negocio el  mismo que se trata de la siembra de cebolla y a su vez la venta de esta,  aprendio de esta actividad ya que toda su familia trabaja en la agricultura.
Requiere el crédito para invertir en  su negocio,  esto también ayudará a  que Nancy  pueda mejorar sus estilo de vida y la de su familia, y la  oportunidad de salir adelante. Además a  Nancy  le gustaria en un futuro que que su negocio crezca cada día más y a la vez agradece a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Nancy is a 20 year old married Ecuadorian woman. Thanks to her parents she was able to finish elementary school and then due to the lack of economic resources she began to work at a young age in order to be able to support her needs and be able to help the needs of her family. Nancy is originally from Latacunga city. She lives in a rural neighborhood of the city with her husband in their own home, so they don't pay rent. The greatest obstacle that they have had has been the lack of financing to be able to make their business grow.

Today she has a dream of starting a business that consists of growing and selling onions. She learned this work as everyone in her family works in agriculture. She needs a loan to invest in her business, which will help Nancy be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family, providing the opportunity to get ahead. In addition, Nancy would like a future where her business grows every day and she is thankful from Kiva for what it does to foster business and personal growth.

loans.use: to start her business growing onions and with the income improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Dunda Mu Yesu Group

texts.fr: Tatine est une commerçante qui s’entraide avec son mari, membre d’un collectif de crédits «Dunda mu Yesu», âgée de 30 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants, dont deux scolarisés et 1 est gosse. Elle est vendeuse des braises dans un dépôt de la ville depuis 6 ans. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va s’approvisionner en trois sacs de braises. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique. Nous tenons à signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Tatine is a 30 year old, married businesswoman with three children, two of which are in school and one is a baby. She and her husband help each other out. They are members of a loan collective "Dunda mu Yesu." Tatine has been selling charcoal at a space in town for six years. She is requesting a loan with Hekima to increase her business activity. She is going to buy thee sacks of charcoal. Through this loan, she wishes to be able to educate and feed her children. She thanks Hekima for the support they bring to entrepreneurs who are excluded from the regular banking system. 

(We would like to note that some clients are holding their babies in the photo).

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is juggling a business and supervising the completion of their home. Mercy hopes to live comfortably with a house of good roofing and flooring, supported by her loan of PHP 10,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. Mercy was given priority as a microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs in her retailing business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to pay for completion of her house.

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
Apolinar tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y dos hijos en casa propia de material rústico en la zona urbana del distrito de Pimpingos, provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica al cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 2 hectareas de café variedad catimore resistente a enfermedades y plagas, realiza esta actividad desde hace 5 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en el rubro y con buenas referencias en su distrito. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y animales menores como gallinas, cuyes, cerdos, entre otros. El destino del crédito será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, lo que se verá reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Apolinar is 37 years old and lives with his partner and 2 children in their own house made from rustic material in the urban area of the Pimpingos district, province of Cutervo, in the Cajamarca region the northern mountains of Peru. The residents of this district make their living in agriculture, trade and breeding of animals as their principal occupations. 

He makes his living in coffee cultivation, and as of now he has 2 hectareas of the Catimore variety of coffee which is resistant to pests and diseases. He has been working in coffee for the past 5 years and therefore has experience in this field as well as good references in his district. Additionally he breeds beef cattle and smaller animals like chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, among others. 

The destination of the loan will be for the purchase of compost and fertilizers to provide maintenance for his coffee crop, which will be seen reflected in a larger volume of sales. Therefore he will obtain better income to be able to improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizers to provide maintenance to his coffee crop

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Maria has been in this business for 4 years. Maria earns more income from general store and farming sugarcane.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mary Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell ready to wear.  Mary Grace is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her business for her fishing business.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Richie

texts.en:
Richie is 30 years old, married with five children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a retail of gasoline in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallon of gasoline to sell.

Richie has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the retail of gasoline for 2 years and also earns an income from general store.

Richie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Peter, an aspiring 56-year-old farmer from Kipsaina village. At a tender age, Peter has embraced the spirit of entrepreneurship and is in farming to feed the rapidly growing population of Kenya. Peter's main income source is milk and poultry. 

This year, he is exploring other opportunities in the agricultural sector. Peter is seeking a KES 20,000 loan from Kiva lenders to venture into poultry farming. Poultry farming has so many products and byproducts to offer. Poultry industry growth is also driven by the expanding hotel and tourism industry. Peter believes there is so much to expect from this business move. Profits from this investment will be rolled back into the business to fuel growth.

loans.use: To buy poultry to diversify his business for family support

loans.name: Shauri Group

texts.fr: Jose est commerçante, vice présidente de la  banque villageoise «Shauri», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 42 ans, mariée à un agent de l’ordre, mère 8 enfants  tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés dans un marché du centre ville depuis 10 ans. Pour accroitre son activité, elle va acheter 20 paires des souliers. Elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Jose is a businesswoman, vice-president of the loan group "Shauri", which is a client of the microfinance institution Hekima. Jose is 42 years old, mother of eight children, who are all in school, and she is married to a law enforcement agent. She started her business with some funding she received from her husband. She has been selling second-hand shoes in a market downtown for 10 years. In order to increase her business activity, she is going to buy 20 pairs of shoes. She willes to educate and to feed her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support they bring to uncredited entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 20 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Areli

texts.en:
Areli lives and works in Comalcalco, Tabasco with her parents. Areli works hard buying and selling different crops at the market. 

Areli has been saving for the last couple of years to build a place of her own. She wishes to soon start a new life with her boyfriend in a place of their own that they can call home. They wish to start their own life in their own space. 

Since Areli has no formal job, no other financial institution will give her credit. She needs this loan to finish paying for the materials needed to complete her home construction. She knows that hard work and commitment can take her to new opportunities. Areli will receive supervision from certified technicians to make sure construction complies with all safety and quality standards.

loans.use: to pay for materials to finish her house.

loans.name: Jose Silvio

texts.es:
Silvio, vive con su pareja y tiene 5 hijos, tres de ellos están estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad; mientras su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar.

Silvio, se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva maíz y frijoles, gracias a eso ha podido darles lo necesario a su familia y poder salir adelante siempre.

Silvio, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agricolas para cultivar maíz y así pode obtener una buena cosecha y tener ganancias, ya que él vende parte de los granos básicos.

Sus sueños son ver a sus hijos realizados y con un futuro prometedor y que logren cosas grandes en la vida.
texts.en:
Silvio lives with his partner and has five children, three of whom are in school in his community, and his partner manages the household chores. 

Silvio works in agriculture, cultivating corn and beans. Thanks to this, he has been able to give his family what they need and always get ahead. 

Silvio needs the loan to purchase agricultural inputs in order to grow corn and thus be able to have a good harvest and make earnings since he sells a portion of the basic grains.

His dreams are to see his children fulfilled, with a promising future, and that they do great things in life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs in order to grow corn.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina es una mujer de 49 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo de 22 años, y su negocio es la venta de medicinas naturales para la salud.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, constante, activa, organizada, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un lugar caracterizado por el creciente desarrollo del comercio y la manufactura en todas las áreas. Formado por colonias de tribus guarayos, campesinos del occidente y mineros relocalizados. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 22-32 grados centígrados. 
Justina es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello largo negro lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como chofer asalariado y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, energía eléctrica y no cuenta con alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de medicinas naturales chinas, estas se caracterizan por aliviar males relacionados con; el colon, la hipertensión, la osteoporosis, y otros, “inicié mi negocio con sólo una mínima inversión, y los clientes que conseguí me recomendaron a otros clientes…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con una amplia cartera de clientes, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para abastecer la demanda. Su sueño es abrir un tienda, ella desea realizar la compra de  medicinas naturales para la salud por mayor, para abastecer la demanda de sus clientes. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Justina solicita un préstamo para la compra de medicinas naturales para la salud por mayor para abastecer la demanda de sus clientes y abrir una tienda.
texts.en:
Justina is a 49-year-old woman. She lives with her partner and  has 1 son aged 22. Her business is the sale of natural medicines for health. She is a good mother, enterprising, persevering, active, organized, responsible, and very hardworking. She runs her business in the “Plan 3000” zone,  a place characterized by increasing development of trade and manufacturing in all areas. This zone is inhabited by neighborhoods of Guarayo tribes, farmers from the west of the country, and relocated miners. The climate is warm and tropical with a temperature during the day that varies between 22 and 32 degrees centigrade.
Justina has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair that she wears tied in the back. She is short in stature and has a thin physique. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which is spoken in this area, and she speaks Spanish as part of her general knowledge and for her business. She shares her life with her partner, who works as a salaried driver, and her son, who goes to school. They live in a room built of brick and cement with tin roof and cement floor; it has electricity and well water extracted by pump, but no sewage system. 
Her business is the sale of Chinese herbal medicines, which alleviate ailments related to the colon, hypertension, osteoporosis, and others. "I started my business with only a minimal investment, and my customers recommended me to other customers ..." she says. The advantage of her business is that she has a large customer base; the disadvantage is the lack of investment capital to meet demand. Her dream is to open a store. She wants to purchase wholesale natural medicines for health in order to meet the demand of her customers. This is the 3rd sequence of loans with the institution in the 7 years that she has had this business.
It is for these reasons that Justina is requesting a loan for the wholesale purchase of natural medicines for health in order to meet the demand of her customers and open a store.

loans.use: to purchase natural medicines for health in order to meet the demand of her customers and open a store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy women's undergarments at wholesale in order to open a store and hire employees.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana operates a tricycle (motorcycle with side car) transportation service. She is a 39-year-old married woman with four dependents. Her oldest child is 15 and the youngest is 10. Aside from that, she also engages in selling crabs. She buys and at the same time sells to the locals in her area. Together with her family, she lives Talibon, Bohol.

Susana has requested a loan to buy a tire, hub (the central part of a wheel) and paint for her tricycle. These materials would really improve her transportation services so she is able to transport safely. Thus, her income will increase and she will be able to expand her business.

She is very grateful for the funds she avail. She is determined to properly handle it to become productive and Susana hopes that she could send all her children to school for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy a tire, hub (the central part of a wheel) and paint for her tricycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his farming through application of modern farming technology like use of certified seedlings(maize and beans) and fortified fertilizer

loans.name: Uhuru Group

texts.fr: Beatrice est commerçante, présidente de la  banque communautaire «Uhuru», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 60 ans, mariée à un agent de migration, mère 10 enfants  dont 4 écoliers, 3 ont fini leurs études et 3 sont mariés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés dans un marché du centre ville depuis 25 ans. Pour accroitre son activité, elle va acheter 2 sacs de souliers. Elle  souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Beatrice is a businesswoman and president of the loan group "Uhuru", a client of the microfinance institution Hekima. Beatrice is 60 years old, married to a migration officer, and is a mother of 10 children, 4 of which are in school, 3 have finished their schooling, and 3 are married. She started her business with some funding she received from her husband. She has been selling second-hand shoes for 25 years in a market downtown. To increase her business activity, she is going to buy 2 bags of shoes. She wishes to continue educating her children and providing for them. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support they bring to uncredited entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy two bags of shoes.

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.fr: Justine est une commerçante, présidente  d’un collectif de crédits «Shalom», âgée de 37 ans, marée à un photographe, mère de 3 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des boissons à son domicile dans un quartier animé de la ville depuis 12 ans. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va s’approvisionner en bière Primus et sucrées. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique. Nous tenons à signaler qu’une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Justine is a businesswoman and the president of the loan group "Shalom." She is 37 years old, is married to a photographer, and is a mother of three children, all in school. She has been selling beverages in her home in a lively part of the city for 12 years. She is requesting a loan with Hekima to increase her business activity. She is going to supply herself with Primus beer and sweets. Through her business, she wishes to continue educating and providing for her children. She thanks Hekima for the support they bring to entrepreneurs, who are excluded from the regular banking system. 

[We would like to note that one client is carrying a baby]

loans.use: To purchase Primus beer and sweets.

loans.name: Tusonge Mbele Group

texts.fr: Busanga est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Tusonge Mbele», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un agent de l’Etat, âgée de 57 ans, mère 8 enfants dont 2 étudient et six sont mariés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires et épices dans un marché de la ville depuis son jeune âge. Elle va s’approvisionner en huiles de palme, tomates, braises, oignons, etc. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Busanga is a small-scale merchant and a member of the loan group called «Tusonge Mbele». She is a client of MFI Hekima and is married to a government agent. Aged 57,  she is the mother of eight children of whom two are in school and six are married. 

Busanga began her business with funds she received from her husband. She has been selling foodstuffs and spices in a market in the town since she was young. She is going to stock up on palm oil, tomatoes, charcoal, onions, etc. She wants to grow her working capital, keep her children in school, and feed them. In closing, she thanks Hekima for the support it brings to entrepreneurs who are not served by conventional banks.

loans.use: to stock up on palm oil, tomatoes, charcoal, onions, etc.

loans.name: Sophon's Group

texts.en:
A 34-year-old mother of two children and only one of them is in school, living in Pursat province, Sophon is a rice farmer for more than five years. Her daily income from this business is about 100,000KHR. 

Due to lack of fund she is now leading a group of four to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy seeds and fertilizer. she hopes this loan will help her to earn more income and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer, so she may earn more income and expand business

loans.name: Manuel Asencio

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 56 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad dedicada a la crianza de animales y comercio que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su mototaxi, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 05 años por lo que es conocido en su distrito por la labor que realiza. Solicita préstamo para realizar arreglos y mantenimiento a su moto ya que se encuentra en mal estado, con esto el espera poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is 56 years old, in a civil union, and lives in his own home in a rural area of Oyotún district. In this area people work in livestock and business, and it is located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

He provides transportation service on his motortaxi. He has had this business for 5 years and he is known in the area for his work. He seeks a loan to make repairs and maintain his motorcycle which is in poor condition. With this he hopes to be able to provide better service for his customers which will increase his income, thus permitting him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to make repairs and maintain his motorcycle which is in poor condition.

loans.name: Lucio Alfredo

texts.es:
Lucio, es un señor con ideas de superarse y luchar por sus hijos, es viudo ya que su esposa falleció hace algunos años; desde entonces le toco que jugar el rol de padre y madre para sus hijos.

Lucio, se dedica a la agricultura, es el medio por el cual ha logrado sacar a sus hijos adelante y superar todas sus dificultades; sus hijos ya son adultos y le ayudan a sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados de milpa y así lograr sacar la cosecha para pagar los gastos y para el consumo de su familia.

Lucio, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agricolas para seguir trabajando en su milpa y así poder obtener sus ingresos, ya que su economía depende mucho de esa actividad.

Lucio, lo que desea es ver a sus hijos felices y con una vida plena para sus familias.
texts.en:
Lucio is a man with ideas about excelling and struggling for his children. He is a widower, as his wife died several years ago, and since then he has had to play the role of mother and father for his children. 

Lucio works in agriculture, through which he has been able to help his children get ahead and overcome all of their difficulties. His children are now adults and help plant 14,000 square meters of cornfield and thereby are able to obtain a harvest for the family's consumption and to pay for expenses.

Lucio needs the loan to purchase agricultural inputs in order to continue working in his cornfield and thus be able to obtain income since his financial situation depends on this business.

What Lucio wants is to see his children happy and with a full life for their families.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs in order to continue working in his cornfield.

loans.name: Penouel Group

texts.fr: Fany est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Penouel», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, divorcée, âgée de 33 ans, mère de 5 enfants tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de ses amies. Elle est vendeuse des braises dans un  marché de la ville depuis 5 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner 13 sacs de braises. Elle  souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Fany is a small-scale merchant and a member of the loan group called  «Penouel». A client of MFI Hekima, she is divorced, aged 33, and the mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She began her business with money she received from women friends. 

Fany has been selling charcoal in a market in town for five years. She is going to stock up by buying 13 sacks of charcoal. She hopes to buy a plot of land, keep her children in school, and feed them. In closing, she thanks Hekima for the support it brings to entrepreneurs who are not included in the conventional banking system.

loans.use: to buy 13 sacks of charcoal to stock and sell

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe, es una señora trabajadora, vive con sus 6 hijos, 3 de ellos trabajan y los otros tres estudian; ella se dedica a trabajar como empleada en una alcaldia, su labor es de reparacion de calles y tambien se dedica a la agricultura, su trabajo es pesado, pero que le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a sus hijos y asi ha podido darles el estudio.

Lupita, necesita el crédito para cultivar 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y asi poder sacar un poco de ganancias.

Guadalupe, desea que sus hijos se conviertan en personas de bien y que en el futuro le ayuden a arreglar su casita y vivir mejor junto a ellos.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a hardworking woman. She lives with her six children, three of whom are working while the other three are studying. She makes a living working as an employee for a municipality. She works repairing streets as well as making a living in agriculture. Her work is hard, but it has helped her get her children ahead and it's how she has been able to give them an education.

Lupita needs a loan to cultivate 21,000 square meters of corn so that she can make a small income. Guadalupe wants her children to become good people and, in the future, help her to fix her home and live better with them.

loans.use: to cultivate 21,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Anita tiene 20 años de edad es  ecuatoriana , soltera nació en la ciudad de Latacunga ,  gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la secundaria  y por falta de recursos no logró seguir estudiando la universidad, lo cual la llevó a trabajar desde muy  joven para poder sustentar sus necesidades y la de su familia. A pesar de tener una corta edad  Ana tiene muchos sueños e ilusiones y es por eso que hoy en día sueña con tener su propio negocio e mismo que se trata de un taller de costura.  Anita y su familia viven en casa propia en la ciudad de Latacunga, perteneciente a la provincia de Cotopaxi, en cuanto a la  economía de esta zona la mayoría de su gente de este sector  se dedican a la elaboración de bloques
Anita  heredó de su madre la habilidad para confeccionar ropa y ha tenido experiencia en esta actividad ya que actualmente trabaja en un taller de costura. Con la experiencia que ha adquirido a través de los años, se siente preparada para dar un paso de crecimiento para lo cual solicita un crédito que lo utilizará en la realización de su negocio  y esto hará que Anita pueda mejorar sus estilo de vida y el de su familia. Anita agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Anita is 20 years old and Ecuadorian, single, and was born in the city of Latacunga. Thanks to the effort of her parents she was able to finish secondary school, but due to the lack of resources was not able to continue studying at university, which lead her to work from a young age to be able to support her needs and those of her family. 

Despite being young, Ana has many hopes and dreams, and today dreams of having her own business and specifically a dressmaking workshop. Anita and her family live in their own house in the city of Latacunga, which belongs to the Cotopaxi province. The economy of this area and the majority of the people in the area make their living in the production of bricks. 

Anita inherited the ability to tailor clothing from her mother and has experience in this occupation. Currently she works in a dressmaking shop. With the experience she has acquired over the years, she feels prepared to take a step forward and for this she is asking a loan that she will use in the implementation of her business. This will make Anita able to improve her lifestyle and that of her family. Anita appreciates the Fundacion Alternativa in Ecuador and Kiva for making her personal and professional growth possible.

loans.use: to begin her business in sewing and tailoring clothing and in this way make growth in her work and personal life possible.

loans.name: Tuimizane B Group

texts.fr: Mungusa est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire «Tuimizane B», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 51 ans, mariée à un manutentionnaire, mère 7 enfants tous vont à l’école. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de sa famille. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés dans un marché du centre ville depuis son jeune âge. Pour accroitre son activité, elle va acheter 7 paires de souliers de meilleure qualité. Elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mungusa is a small-scale merchant and a member of the community bank called «Tuimizane B». She is a client of MFI Hekima, aged 51, married to a warehouseman, and mother of seven children who are all in school. She began her business with funds she got from her family. 

Mungusa has been selling used shoes in a market in the middle of town since she was a youngster. In order to grow her business, she is going to buy seven pairs of higher-quality shoes. She would like to keep her kids in school and feed them. In closing, she thanks Hekima for the support it gives entrepreneurs who are not served by the conventional banking system.

loans.use: to buy seven pairs of higher-quality shoes.

loans.name: Alima's Group

texts.fr: Alima qui se trouve sur la photo au centre, asseyant avec un collier, est membre d’un groupe de 17 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Sola au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Alima, âgée de 47 ans, est la mère de 7 enfants âgés de 1 à 22 ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l’autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Alima à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 13 ans. Alima cultive l'arachide, le riz, le maraîchage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Alima entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des engrais de qualité. Cette année Alima effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 13 ans que Alima cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation. Alima planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage et d'acheter du matériel agricole. Enfin Alima espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille
texts.en: Alima is seated at the center of the photo, wearing a necklace. She is a member of a group of 17 farmers, who are registered with myAgro, living and working in the town of Sola, Southeast of Bamako in Mali. Alima, 47 years old, is the mother of 7 children, ages 1 to 22 years old, two of which are currently in school. Farming is the main source of food and income for this household and allows Alima to ensure the self-sufficiency of her family. The deep traditions of agriculture in her family incited Alima to practice this activity for 13 years now. Alima grows peanuts, rice, and greens on her plot of land, but, as a farmer, she must also cope with difficulties such as lack of rain, lack of farming materials and quality fertilizer. This year, Alima is making payments to buy a package of myAgro fertilizer for growing peanuts in order to increase her yields on her .0625 hectare plot. Alima has been growing peanuts for 13 years now because of their food-producing qualities, explaining that peanuts can be eaten directly by her family and used a the base for a sauce in cooking. Alima plans to raise livestock and to buy farming materials with the increase of her yields and her revenue. Finally, Alima hopes to be able to cover the tuition costs for her children as well as ensure the self-sufficiency of the family.

loans.use: to buy a package of fertilizer for growing peanuts.

loans.name: Sacarias

texts.es:
Sacarias es un hombre de 44 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos varones de 1 y 8 años y una hija mujer de 6 años, y su negocio es la agricultura.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, independiente, paciente, solidario, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Jatun pampa’ ubicada a orillas del río, muy cerca a la carretera, es una población pequeña rodeada de increíbles paisajes, provistos de una exuberante vegetación y una hidrografía abundante en ríos, arroyos, caídas de agua y pozas naturales. Posee un clima tropical húmedo y cálido.
Sacarias es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a la venta de comida y con sus hijos; los 2 mayores estudian en la escuela y el menor aun no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa construida de adobe, ladrillo y cemento que se encuentra sin finalizar y cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba. Su trabajo es la agricultura. La zona donde vive es un área rural cercana a la ciudad, los pobladores del lugar extraían agua de pozos o la recogían del río, actualmente las aguas del río ya no sirven para consumo, “mis hijos se enferman al beber agua de pozo, necesitamos agua potable cuanto antes…” comenta. La ventaja de su vivienda es que se encuentra cercana a las recientes conexiones de agua, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para concluir su conexión de agua potable. Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa. Él desea realizar la conexión de agua potable para su baño, cocina y lavandería; y dejar de usar el agua de su pozo, para brindarle a su familia una buena salud. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que está construyendo su casa.
Es por esos motivos que Sacarias solicita un préstamo para la conexión de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para que su familia tome agua saludable.
texts.en:
Sacarias is 44 years old and married. He has two sons ages 1 and 8 and one daughter age 6. He works in agriculture.

He is a good father, enterprising, independent, patient, supportive, responsible and hardworking. His business is located in the town of Jatun Pampa located close to the road along the river. It is a small town surrounded by breathtaking scenery, equipped with lush vegetation and abundant hydrography in the form of rivers, streams, waterfalls and natural pools. It has a warm and humid tropical climate.

Sacarias is of dark complexion, brown eyes, short black hair, short stature and thin physique. His mother tongue is Quechua, which he speaks at home. He generally speaks Spanish in public and for the work he does. He shares his life with his wife, who sells food, and their children. The two oldest children go to school but the youngest is not old enough to attend school yet.

They live in a house built of adobe, brick and cement that is unfinished and has electricity and well water extracted by pump. He works in agriculture. The area where he lives is a rural area near the city. The locals extract water from wells or collect water from the river, which is actually no longer good for consumption. "My children are sick from drinking well water; we need drinking water as soon as possible, " he says.

The advantage of his home is that it is located close to recently created water connections. The disadvantage is that he lacks money to complete his water connection. His dream is to finish building his house. He wants to connect drinking water for his bathroom, kitchen and laundry and to stop using water from his well, to make sure his family stays healthy. This is his first loan with the institution in the 7 years he has been building his house.

Sacarias is requesting a loan to establish a connection to drinking water in his kitchen, bathroom and laundry for his family to have access to healthy water.

loans.use: establish a connection to drinking water in his kitchen, bathroom and laundry for his family to have access to healthy water.

loans.name: Sebada

texts.en:
Being a responsible mother, Sebada helps her husband to earn income through buying and selling fruit and vegetables. She is 50 years old, married, and has nine children. Two of them are still studying and they want them to earn a degree so that they will become professionals someday. In view of the high cost of school fees, Sebada aims to further improve the business in order to earn a higher income. 

Due to capital insufficiency, she would like to access a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more stock of cucumbers, tomatoes, cabbages, ginger, beans, squash, bananas and other vegetables to resell. She is hoping that someday, she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cucumbers, tomatoes, cabbages, ginger, beans, squash, bananas and other vegetables to resell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, 53, is married and lives in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. In order to help the family, she engaged in fish vending. PMPC supported her to start her chosen business. It has operated for six years already.

Jocelyn thought of expanding her resources, so she decided to engage in a hog raising business for added income. Now, she is planning to borrow PHP 10,000 from Paglaum MP Cooperative, of which she became a member in 2010, to buy additional stock of fish to sell and pay for two piglets to start her pig raising business. She wants to have a stall in the public market to display her fish and be able to sell meat, too.

Someday she will be happy seeing her family with a comfortable life and will live bountifully with them.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fish to sell and pay for two piglets to start her pig raising business.

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and has nine children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Josephine has been farming sugarcane for 26 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Cesar Rey

texts.en:
Cesar Rey is a 23-year-old vocational graduate and lives in Lacarlota City. He belongs to a family of five. His father works as a laborer in a cemetery, and  his mother is a housewife.  

Cesar Rey is the youngest in the family, and he has two siblings. The eldest sister has a learning disability and his brother has been working in a local restaurant in Bacolod City for five years now. Their total monthly family income of Php 8,000 ($180) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. This motivates Cesar Rey to find better ways help the family have more income and that’s why he underwent the selection process for Bagosphere to qualify for the 2-month training program that could lead to a call center job. 

Cesar Rey wants to have a stable job by becoming a call center agent. Your help in funding Cesar's loan will help him have a better life in the coming months.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells goods like biscuits, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, beverages, soap and condiments. She is 47 years old, a married woman with eight children. Five of her children are still attending school.  She has been engaged in operating a store for ten years now. Her husband earns a living by being a construction worker.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional beverages, soft drinks and other groceries. These are essential in order to maintain the stocks of her store and be able to cater to customers needs, thus enabling her to augment her earnings and handle her finances and provide her family with good food and better shelter to live in.

Santa would like to expand her business so that it is sustainable and she is able to support the needs of her children, especially so they can finish their studies as well.

loans.use: to buy additional beverages, soft drinks and other groceries

loans.name: Shohida

texts.en:
Shohida is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1966. She is living in a village where doing business in agriculture is the best choice. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a taxi-driver. 

Shohida's business is planting sunflowers and each year she rents a plot of land for doing that business. She also keeps livestock and fattens them for further selling. She knows her activity well and tries to look after her land and livestock attentively. 

Shohida appealed to IMON for financial support to buy fertilizer, nitrates, natural chemicals, etc. and pay the rental worker. She awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, nitrates, natural chemicals, etc. and pay the rental worker

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Retailing helps Jesusa's family survive. She retails bananas, fruits and vegetables. Jesusa also makes copra and buys coconut for this. Doing this type of activity brings her a meager income of PHP 5,000 per month, in addition to the income of her husband for their family.

Jesusa plans to expand her retailing business. She applied for a loan from PMPC for the needed capital. She wants to purchase inventory of bananas, fruits, and vegetables for retail, and pay for whole coconuts to make copra.

Jesusa smiles at the fact of seeing all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of bananas, fruits, and vegetables for retail, and pay for whole coconuts to make copra.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia works in direct sales through a catalog. She is a hard-working mother, living in Tabasco. 

Dalia and her family have been living in their house for some time and have been saving for some time to make some arrangements that will make this a better home for everyone. To Dalia, giving every opportunity to her children is very important. She only had the opportunity to study until elementary school and is convinced that giving more education and better opportunities to her children will definitely give them better lives. 

Dalia and her husband have an informal job and, thus, accessing credit from other financial institutions is almost impossible. Dalia is asking for this loan to complete the payment of the materials needed for the house construction. With this loan she will also receive technical assistance and supervision to make sure that the construction will comply with all the safety and quality standards.

loans.use: to pay for materials to build her house.

loans.name: Morelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
