Morelia, es una mujer muy emprendedora y madre de 2 hijos, está casada y su esposo trabaja junto a ella para poder sacar a sus hijos adelante.

Morelia, de dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, pero tiene la idea de poner su propio negocio en su casa y así poder obtener mejores ingresos para ella y su familia.

Morelia, necesita el crédito para colocar su propia tienda en casa y es así como recurrió a la ayude de CREDICAMPO para que su sueño se cumpla.

Morelia, espera ver a sus hijos graduados, con un buen empleo y que sean felices y prósperos en sus vida.
texts.en:
Morelia is a very enterprising woman with two children. She is married and her husband works with her to be able to give their children a good education. 

Morelia manages the household chores, but she has a plan to open her own store in her home and thus be able to obtain better income for herself and her family.

Morelia needs the loan in order to set up her own store in her home and this is why she enlisted the help of CREDICAMPO to fulfill her dreams. 

Morelia hopes to see her children graduated, with good jobs, and that they are happy and prosperous in their lives.

loans.use: to set up her own store in her home.

loans.name: Tuimizane A Group

texts.fr: Burukwa est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire «Tuimizane A», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée a un maçon, âgée de 37 ans, mère 7 enfants  dont 5 scolarisés et deux sont gosses. Elle est vendeuse des poissons fretins dans la rue animee de la ville depuis son jeune âge. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son père. Elle va s’approvisionner en 60 kg des poissons. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Burukwa is a businesswoman and member of the loan group "Tuimizane A", a client of the microfinance institution Hekima, She is 37 years old, married to a mason, and has seven children, five of which are in school and the other two are infants. She has been selling fry fish in the main street of the city since she was young. She started her business with some funding she received from her father. She is going to resupply with 60kg of fish. She hopes to increase her capital, educate and provide for her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support they bring to uncredited entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 60kg of fish.

loans.name: Kadia's Group

texts.fr: Kadia qui se trouve sur la photo asseyant sur la chaise devant tenant sa pochette couvert de foulard noir, est membre d’un groupe de 8 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Bassian au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Kadia, âgée de 55 ans, est la mère de 8 enfants, dont 8 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l’autosuffisance pour sa famille, mais aussi l'amour de l'agriculture, ont incité Kadia à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Kadia cultive l'arachide, le riz, le maraîchage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque d'engrais de qualité, de terre cultivables et d'herbicides. Kadia entame sa troisième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrite en raison des semences de qualité et des formations et techniques agricoles, ainsi que de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Kadia effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 20 ans que Kadia cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Kadia planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de pouvoir faire du commerce et d'acheter du matériel agricole. Enfin Kadia espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que construire une maison pour la famille
texts.en:
Kadia is found in the photo seated on a chair in front, holding a packet, covered by a black scarf. She is a member of a group of 8 farmers registered with myAgro, living and working in the town of Bassian, to the Southeast of Bamako in Mali. Kadia is 55 years old and is the mother of 8 children, all of whom are currently in school. Agriculture allows her to ensure the self-sufficiency of her family. But also, her love of farming incited Kadia to practice this activity for 30 years now. Kadia grows peanuts, rice, and greens on her plot of land, but, as a farmer, must also cope with difficulties such as a lack of quality fertilizer, arable land and herbicides. 

Kadia is going on her third year with myAgro and reregistered for the quality seeds, the agricultural instruction and techniques, as well as the perspective of being able to increase her yields through the services offered by myAgro. This year, Kadia is making payments to buy a myAgro package of fertilizer for growing peanuts in order to increase her yields on her .125 hectare plot of land. Kadia has been growing peanuts for 20 years now for their commercial value. Peanuts are a food that she grows to sell at the market as well as for their productive and commercial profitability. Kadia plans on being able to do business and to by farming materials with the increase of her yields and her revenue. Finally, Kadia hopes to be able to cover the tuition cost for her children as well as to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to acquire a package of fertilizer for growing peanuts to increase the productivity of her land.

loans.name: Fermin German

texts.es: Fermin es un hombre de 45 años que vive en Cocachacra a lado de su hermosa familia, su menor hija y su pareja. Fermin se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar semilla mejorada y orgánica de arroz, también usara una parte del crédito para pagar a personas que le ayuden a cosechar su cultivo de ajo orgánico. Fermin gusta de tratar a sus cultivos con abonos naturales y sin necesidad de echar insecticidas. En el futuro espera poder ver a su hija convertida en una gran profesional y que este llena de muchos valores.
texts.en: Fermin, aged 45, lives in Cocachacra with his beautiful family: his young daughter and his partner. Fermin works in agriculture and livestock. He is asking for a loan to buy improved, organic rice seeds, and to pay for labor to help him harvest his organic garlic crop. Fermin likes to feed his crops natural fertilizers and prefers not to use insecticides. In the future, he would like to see his daughter become a great professional with good values.

loans.use: to plant organic rice, and harvest organic garlic

loans.name: Ariane Joy

texts.en:
Ariane Joy is a 20-year old vocational graduate and lives in Bago City. She belongs to a family of five. Her father works as a truck driver, and her mother is a teacher. Ariane Joy is the youngest in the family, and she has two siblings. Her brother is in high school and her sister is in college. 

Their total monthly family income of PHP 15,000 ($337) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. This motivates Ariane Joy to find means to help the family have more income. That’s why she braved the selection process of BagoSphere and successfully passed to qualify for the two-month training program that could lead to a call center job. 

Apart from helping her family, Ariane Joy also dreams to become a successful call center agent and to uplift her family from poverty. Your generosity in funding her loan will help Ariane Joy have a better income in the coming months.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call center training program

loans.name: Jaykee

texts.en:
Jaykee is an 18-year-old high school graduate and lives in Bago City. He belongs to a family of four. His father has been working as a security guard in Bacolod City for nine years, and his mother is a vendor of frozen foods. Jaykee is the youngest in the family. His elder brother is employed. Their total monthly family income is Php 16,000 (about $359). 

Jaykee needs to find a means to help the family have more income, and that’s why he braved the selection process of BagoSphere and successfully passed it to qualify for the 2-month training program that could lead to a call center job. 

Apart from helping his family, Jaykee also wants to become a professional software developer. Your generosity in funding his loan will help Jaykee achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the remaining installments of her son's rickshaw.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin and his girlfriend are excited about starting life as a married couple. They have been living together for some time and are currently planning on getting married and starting a family. They have been living with Edwin's parents and saving for the last couple of years to build their own house.

Through their hard work and sacrifices, they have saved a pretty good sum. They just need a loan now to finish paying for the materials needed. Since they both have informal jobs and proof of income is not something available to them, they have no other access to credit. With this loan, they will be ready to start building and will receive visits from certified technicians who will make sure all the work complies with all the quality and safety standards.

Edwin is excited to start a new family in their own home.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish building his house

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell. 

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream:  to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Matlyuba

texts.en: Matlyuba is a gentle woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1987. She is living in a village and does business at the central market. She is divorced and has one child. She is a barber and has a wedding beauty salon. She takes orders from customers and exports wedding dresses. She has permanent clients every day. She likes her business and knows her duty well. She is planning to enlarge her business and buy a new assortment of wedding dresses. She is asking financial support from Kiva lenders and IMON to buy wedding dresses. She is hoping to be supported by KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to buy wedding dresses

loans.name: Vensie

texts.en: Vensie is a 30-year-old college graduate and lives in Bago City. She belongs to a family of five. Her father is a farmer and her mother is a housewife. Vensie is the eldest in the family and she has an identical twin. Her twin is a single mom and unemployed, while her younger brother is a laborer and is already married. Vensie has a sari-sari store in their house that earns her PHP 4,800 ($108) a month, but this income is only enough for her personal needs. Vensie would like to earn more for herself and for her family, and she believes that the training at Bagosphere might make her realize this. Apart from helping her family, Vensie wants to improve her communication and social skills. Her dreams in life are to have a stable job and to help her family. Your generosity in funding her loan will help Vensie have a better income in the coming months.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Mary Dee

texts.en: Mary Dee is a 31-year old college undergraduate and lives in Bago City. She is married to Carlo who works as a factory worker in Manila. Mary Dee was a cashier in a local department store, and currently she has a small-time business selling food in the community school during school days. She’s living with her parents. Mary Dee and Carlo have one toddler. Their total monthly family income is only PHP 11,000 ($247). Mary Dee knows she needs to help her husband, but she didn’t have the means until she learned about the two-month training program of Bagosphere that could lead to a call center job. Now that she has passed Bagosphere’s selection process, she needs your help to finance her tuition. Getting a job after training can help provide for her family’s basic needs and let her save for her child's education.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en:
Erlita is a hardworking mother who aims to uplift their status of living and give her family a better life. She is 54 years old and has three adult-aged children. 

To earn additional income, Erlita operates a motorcycle transport within her community. To continuously operate the motorcycle, she needs to avail a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy the needed gasoline, motorcycle parts and accessories for the maintenance of her motorcycle. 

Erlita hopes that she will avail her loan request to be able to give safe transportation to her passengers and earn sufficient income.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, motorcycle parts and accessories

location.town: Brgy. Ineangan, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal fruits for her husband's fruit-selling business.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel, who is 49, is married and they're blessed with one child. He has owned and managed a welding shop in their village for almost 17 years and earns a net income of PHP 10,000 a month. 

Manuel's net income from his business is usually spent on the maintenance of his welding shop. Due to insufficient capital, he would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase additional tools and equipment that are needed in his welding shop. 

Manuel is hoping that his welding shop will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase additional tools and equipment that are needed in his welding shop.

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano is a patient woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1955. She is living in a small town with her family. She is married and has two children. 

About 30 years ago she began a business in the domestic market. In the winter season she sells women's coats and in other seasons she sells women's and men's shirts. Her goods are different because she sells a high quality shirt at cheaper prices, that is what brings her more customers. 

She is planning to expand her business and buy a new assortment of shirts for next season. She is requesting a loan from IMON and Kiva lenders to buy a new assortment of shirts. 

She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of shirts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, soaps, beverages, seasonings, breads and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en:
Ponciana is a resident of Moalboal, Cebu. She is 50 years old.   She owns a barn where she raise hogs for a living. Ponciana would like to help earn more because her husband who is a farmer does not earn much for them.  

She is asking a loan to buy piglets and sacks of feed to fatten her hogs. It will be a relief for her, since she only buys feed on a per kilo basis, which is more expensive. 

Ponciana is motivated to work hard for her family. Her income will be utilized for healthy meals, savings and reinvestment in the same business. 

In the future she plans to make her barn bigger.

loans.use: to buy piglets and sacks of feed to fatten her hogs

loans.name: Leonilina

texts.en:
Leonilina is 41 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. Leonilina works very hard to provide for them.

Leonilina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Leonilina has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries. 

In the future, Leonilina would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mirian Maria

texts.es:
Mirian en una persona muy trabajadora, actualmente trabaja cociendo en una empresa de lunes a viernes, ella vive en una casa arrendada junto a su esposo y sus hijos desde hace 2 años, ella desea iniciar un negocio para poder tener ingresos suficientes y en el futuro dejar de trabajar en la empresa ya que su trabajo le quita mucho tiempo y poder dedicarles más tiempo a sus hijos.
Mirian, quiere emprender su negocio de venta de comida rápida  es un idea que comparte con el esposo esta actividad lo van a realizar para mejorar la calidad de vida y también para no depender de un jefe y ser la dueña de su propio negocio y así poder estar más cerca de los hijos cuidarles y poderles ayudar en todo lo que necesiten tanto en el estudio  para que sean personas de bien  en el futuro, ella quiere que este negocio sea familiar que todos los que integran la familia sea responsables y que encarguen de ayudar en todo lo que necesite para surgir con esta actividad y hasta mientras el esposo le va ayudar con el ingreso que tiene como albañil a seguir incrementando lo que falta en el negocio.
Agradece a fundación Alternativa por el apoyo para este proyecto que va cambiar la vida de ella y también de sus familiares.
texts.en:
Mirian is a very hard-working person, who currently works in a business from Monday to Friday. She has lived in a rented home with her spouse and children for the last two years. She would like to start her own business to have sufficient earnings, and in the future leave her job, which means spending time away from her children, so that she can spend more time with them.

Mirian wants to start a fast-food business, an idea which she shares with her husband. She wants to improve their quality of life, not to be dependent on a boss, and to be the owner of her own business so that she can be closer to her children. She would like to care for them, and help them with everything they need, including their studies, so that they will be successful in the future. She wants to create a family business, in which all the members of the family participate to ensure its success. While she is building her business, her husband will help with his earnings as a bricklayer.

She is grateful to the Alternativa Foundation for supporting this project, which will change her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to establish her food business, and enable her to care for her children, help them study, and give them attention

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Osiyahon

texts.en:
Osiyahon is a talented woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1971. She is living in a district and does business in the domestic market. She is married and has two children. 

She is a businesswoman. She plants vegetables in her yard. Basically she is a tailor and teaches women of her village how to sew traditional women's dresses. Her activities help her to feed her family and have a better standard of living. She plants and gains harvest almost many years and likes her duty. She wants to process her land and have a good harvest next season. 

She is asking a loan from Kiva and IMON to buy fertilizer and minerals. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and minerals.

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae works hard to support her family. Mae is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Mae requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Mae has been in this business for seven years now.

Mae would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Delia is 47 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Delia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy other ingredients for her food vending business.

She has been in this business for one year. In the future, Delia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy other ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Tuongozane B Group

texts.fr: Simisi est commerçante, vice présidente du groupe de crédits «Tuongozane B», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 47 ans, mère 6 enfants tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires dans un marché de la ville depuis 33 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en huile de palmes et végétale. Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish,  elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Simisi is a retailer and the vice-president of the "Tuongozane B" credit group. She is a client of the MFI Hekima, married, 47 years old and the mother of 6 children who all go to school. She started her business with funds she received from her husband. She has been selling foodstuffs at a market in town for 33 years. She will buy palm and vegetable oil. She wishes to increase her working capital and to ensure that her children are fed and educated. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support it gives to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy palm and vegetable oil.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, a resident of Kyenjojo Uganda, is aged 55 and is married with four children. His main business is cattle sales supplemented by milk sales. 

His hopes are exploring in the cattle markets that are offering attractive prices and by educating his children to university level. His hardships are prolonged drought and high license fees in the cattle market. 

He is requesting a loan to buy cattle for selling.

loans.use: to buy cattle for selling.

loans.name: Procedes Group

texts.es:
Francisca es una mujer de 50 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 20 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, emprendedora, paciente, generosa, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por recibir a la población migrante del campo a la ciudad, que agrupa una intensa actividad económica conformada por el comercio minorista e informal, de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Francisca es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza (ubicada en primera fila, viste mandil blanco). La necesidad de mejorar su negocio la llevo a liderar a microempresarios y formar una banca de personas con negocios como; servicio de moto taxi, limpieza de ropa, venta de verduras, venta de comida, librería, servicio de llamadas y venta de ropa de segunda mano, para solicitar un préstamo y generar mejores ingresos. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional de forma ambulante, recorriendo y visitando ferias y comercios. Los platos más comunes son; majadito de charque (carne deshidratada, arroz, huevo frito y plátano frito, Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno puede ser de papa y platano),  sopa de maní (sopa a base de maní), locotos rellenos (locotos, carne picada, cebollas), arroz con queso (arroz, leche y queso), y otros, “aprendí a cocinar por la necesidad de ayudar a mi familia, cuento con clientes continuos y deseo ampliar mi negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que ya tiene rutas establecidas y clientes constantes, la desventaja es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar mesas, sillas e utensilios de cocina. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante que pueda pagar los gastos familiares, ella desea realizar la compra de mesas, sillas e utensilios de cocina para vender comida a más clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Francisca solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas, sillas e utensilios de cocina para vender comida y abrir un restaurante.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 50 year old, woman, single, has 2 children 12 and 20 years old, and her business is selling traditional food.

She is a good mother, independent, entrepreneurial, patient, generous, responsible and hardworking. Her business is in the southern part of the city, characterized by taking in part of the population who migrates from the countryside to the city, which gathers intense economic activity consisting of the retail and informal trade.  Weather is Sub tropical warm with temperatures ranging during the day between 21-35 degrees Celsius.

Francisca is of dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair tied behind her, short stature, robust physique.  Her native language is spoken Guarani  which she speaks, but she generally speaks Spanish due to the culture and the nature of her work (she is found in the front row wearing white apron). 

The need to improve her business led her to organize an entrepreneurs group and form a banking group with people in business such as:  motorcycle taxi service, clothes washers, vegetables sellers, food sellers, bookstore, service calls and second-hand clothes sellers to request a loan and generate better income.

Her business is selling traditional food , traveling and visiting fairs and shops. The most common dishes are; majadito jerky (dried meat, rice, fried egg and fried plantain filling), Cogote (creole chicken necks, stuffing can be potato and plantain), peanut soup (soup made with peanuts), stuffed peppers (peppers, chopped meat, onions), rice with cheese (rice, milk and cheese), and others.  "I learned to cook because of the need to help my family, I have steady customers and want to expand my business ..." she says. 

The advantage of her business is that she already has established routes and regular customers, the downside is that she does not have enough capital to purchase tables, chairs and kitchen utensils.

Her dream is to open a restaurant that can pay family expenses.  She wants to purchase tables, chairs and cooking utensils to be able to sell food to more customers. This is the first sequence of loans with this institution in the 15 years that she has practiced this activity.

This is the reason for which Francisca is requesting a loan,for the purchase of chairs, tables and kitchen utensils to sell food and open a restaurant.

loans.use: in the purchase of tables, chairs and kitchen utensils for selling food and to open a restaurant.

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Sagrado Corazón se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Flor, tiene 65 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es electricista. Hace varios años ella aprendió corte y confección en una academia en la ciudad.
Doña Flor es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante, ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, allí se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa ya sea para damas, caballeros o niños, actualmente ella está elaborando muchos uniformes para escuelas y colegios para el Estado y para instituciones privados, por lo cual ha tenido que contratar más personal para poder cumplir con los trabajos  a tiempo, ella siempre se ayuda de los créditos para poder salir adelante, por eso agradece a la institución por la ayuda que recibe de los créditos . 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros materiales para la costura. Lleva más de 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella sale adelante. Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande.
texts.en:
The loan group Sagrado Corazon (Sacred Heart) meet every 15 days in the city of Manta, which is renowned for its beautiful beaches that are visited by lots of people all year round and for being a beautiful city with lots of activities for tourists. 

Flor lives in this place. She is 65 years old, married and has six adult children, two of whom still live at home. Her husband is an electrician. Several years ago she learnt about dressmaking at an academy in the city. 

Flor is a very hardworking woman who likes to support herself in order to move forward. She has her own small sewing workshop in her house where she makes all types of clothing for men, women or children. She is currently making lots of school uniforms for state schools and private schools, and in order to do all the work in time, she has had to hire more personnel. She always uses the loans she receives to help her move forward with her life and for that she is thankful for the institution's support. She will use this loan to buy fabrics, thread, buttons and other materials for sewing. She has been a member of the loan group for 10 years and she likes it because the loans she receives help her move forward with her life. Her dream is to have a larger workshop.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, thread, buttons and other materials for sewing.

loans.name: Lassine's Group

texts.fr: Lassine qui porte une chemise blanche à gauche est membre d’un groupe de 3 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Safe Koro au sud de Bamako au Mali. Lassine, âgé de 35 ans, est le père de 3 enfants âgés de 2 à 8 ans, et dont l'1 d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Lassine à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 20 ans. Lassine cultive l'arachide, le mais, le sorgho, le coton sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'herbicides. Lassine entame sa troisième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrit en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro et de la conviction des agents myAgro sur les bénéfices apportés par la méthode myAgro. Cette année Lassine effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.5 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 20 ans que Lassine cultive le maïs pour sa valeur commerciale qu'il peut vendre sur le marché. Lassine planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'étendre la surface cultivée et de pouvoir faire plus de commerce. Enfin Lassine espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Lassine, who is pictured at left wearing a white shirt, is among this group of three farmers who are registered with myAgro.

He lives and works in the village of Safe Koro south of Bamako in Mali. Lassine is 35 years old and the father of three children between the ages of 2 and 8. One of his children goes to school. 

The traditional anchor of this family is farming, and the fact that it has been the family’s primary source of revenue and dietary self-sufficiency has encouraged Lassine to work in this domain for 20 years.

Lassine grows peanuts, corn, sorghum, and cotton on his land, but needs to confront farming difficulties like lack of rain, farming equipment, and herbicide. 

Lassine is starting his third year with myAgro and just re-registered with them in order to increase his yield through their services. The myAgro agents spoke with conviction regarding the benefits of their method. 

This year, Lassine is making payments to buy a pack of myAgro OPV (open pollinated variety) seeds and corn fertilizer that should increase the yield on his 0.5 hectares of land. 

Lassine has been growing maize for its commercial value and he will sell it in the market. With the growth of his yield and revenue, Lassine plans to extend the area he plants and to do more business. 

Finally, Lassine hopes to cover his children’s schooling fees and secure the family’s dietary self-sufficiency.

loans.use: buy a pack of OPV (open pollinated variety) seeds and corn fertilizer that should increase his yield.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Esther. She is fifty one years old, married and a mother of eight children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2011.
She does dairy farming, maize and potatoes as her main business. She has benefited much from HiH EA training on enterprise and financial management this has enabled her in budgeting and record keeping. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy farm inputs i.e. fertilizer and seeds. This will assist her to cater for the family and manage her business well.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds that will boost farming thus more profits  to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en: Leny is a 28-year old college undergraduate and lives in Bago City. She is married to Bernardo who works as a laborer. They have one child who is eight years old and in elementary school. Before, Leny was working with her aunt in Bacolod as a cashier in a small restaurant, but she stopped working because she wanted to undergo training with Bagosphere. Their total monthly family income is only PHP 12,000 ($270). Leny has to help her husband but didn’t have the means until she learned about the two-month training program from Bagosphere that could lead to a call center job. Now that she has passed Bagosphere’s selection process, she needs your help to finance her tuition. Once Leny starts earning, she can help provide her family’s basic needs and then save money for their child's education.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her farming activity by purchasing fertilizers, maize as well as beans seedlings for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fresh potatoes as well as wholesale cooking oil for making chips to sell to her clients and meet their needs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her farming activity by purchasing certified maize seedlings as well as fortified fertilizers

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Juana y su esposo, viven en Cochabamba provincia chapare; están casados más de 10 años, económicamente son independientes, la Sra. se dedica al comercio de verduras y su esposo se dedica al servicio de albañil, sus actividades lo realizan en el mismo lugar donde viven. La señora requiere el crédito para Capital de operación compra de mercadería (verduras) ya que sus ahorros lo invirtieron en la construcción de su vivienda y otros gastos que tuvieron en su actividad. Con la compra de abono orgánico y semilla de papa, tendrán mejores ingresos e incrementarán su patrimonio familiar para mejorar su nivel de vida en beneficio de su familia hacia futuro.
texts.en:
Juana and her husband live in the Chapare province of Cochabamba. They have been married for more than 10 years and are economically independent. She works selling vegetables and her husband is a mason, and both work out of their home. 

She is requesting a loan to provide capital for her vegetable-selling business, because she has used her savings for building her home and other essential business expenses. By purchasing organic fertilizers and potato seeds, she can improve her earnings and increase the family assets in order to improve their standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies (vegetables) to increase her sales and the family income.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 40-year-old college undergraduate and lives in Bacolod City. She is married to Joey who works as a construction worker. They have two children; the eldest is 19 years old and is in College, and the youngest is 7 years old and is in elementary school. 

Grace currently has a food vending home business. Their total monthly family income of only PHP 12,600 ($283) is not enough to provide for their family’s basic needs. Thus, when she qualified for the two-month call center training program from Bagosphere, she saw a glimmer of hope that there’s actually a chance for her to uplift her family’s life in a few months. Grace wants to provide the education and the basic needs of her family, to become a businesswoman, and to have a better quality of life. Your tuition loan assistance might just make Grace reach those dreams.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Saliba's Group

texts.fr: Saliba qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à gauche, portant un voile vert clair, est membre d’un groupe de 7 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Safe Koro au sud de Bamako au Mali. Saliba, âgée de 56 ans, est la mère de 7 enfants âgés de 13 à 30 ans, dont aucun d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Saliba à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 46 ans. Saliba cultive l'arachide, le sorgho, le maraîchage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Saliba entame sa troisième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrite en raison des semences et des engrais de qualité, ainsi que de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Saliba effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.25 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 46 ans que Saliba cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation. L’arachide présente aussi une valeur commerciale car elle peut le vendre sur le marché. Saliba planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de pouvoir faire plus de commerce. Enfin Saliba espère aussi pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Saliba, the lady located on the far left in the photo with a light green scarf, is a member of a group of seven farmers registered at myAgro, all living and working in the village of Safe Koro in southern Bamako in Mali. Saliba is 56 years old and the mother of seven children - aged from 13 to 30 years old, none of whom currently attend school.
A family tradition for agriculture - the main source of income and food for the family - has led Saliba to work in the sector for the last 46 years. She grows peanuts, sorghum and kitchen vegetables on her plot, but as a farmer she has to cope with problems such as a lack of rain, of farming equipment and of quality fertilisers.
Saliba is into her third season with my Agro, having re-registered due to the quality seeds and fertiliser, as well as the possibility of being able to increase her yields with the services offered by myAgro. This year she is making payments to buy a myAgro fertiliser package for growing peanuts, in order to increase the yield on her 2,500m2 piece of land. Saliba has been growing peanuts for the whole 46 years for its food value, explaining that it is both eaten by the family as is, and also used as a basic sauce in food. It also has commercial value, as she can sell it in the market.
Saliba is planning to be able to trade product with her increased yield and higher income, and she hopes to ensure her family is self sufficient in food.

loans.use: to buy a fertiliser package for growing peanuts.

loans.name: Kadiatou's Group

texts.fr: Kadiatou qui se trouve sur la photo au deuxième rang au centre, portant une foulard noire et le drapeau de myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 12 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Boyla 2 au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Kadiatou, âgée de 60 ans, est la mère de 12 enfants âgés de 15 à 40 ans, dont 10 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi son mariage avec un agriculteur, ont incité Kadiatou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 50 ans. Kadiatou cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et d'engrais de qualité. Kadiatou entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des engrais de qualité, ainsi que de la conviction des agents myAgro sur les bénéfices apportés par la méthode myAgro. Cette année Kadiatou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Kadiatou cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Kadiatou planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage et de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Kadiatou espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en: Kadiatou, who is in the center of the second row wearing a black scarf and the myAgro flag, is a member of a group of 12 farmers signed up with myAgro, who live and work in the village of Boyla 2 in the south of Bamako in Mali. Kadiatou, 60, is a mother of twelve, ages 15 – 40, ten of whom currently attend school. The roots of her family tradition in farming, a principal source of income and the family’s self-sufficiency in food, and her marriage to a farmer, incited Kadiatou to work in this business for 50 years. Kadiatou grows peanuts on her land but must also face the challenges of farmers, such as lack of rain and quality fertilizer. Kadiatou is kicking off her first year with myAgro, and signed up because of the payment system and the quality fertilizer, as well as the conviction of the myAgro agents about the profits brought in with the myAgro method. This year, Kadiatou is making payments to buy a myAgro packet of OPV seed and fertilizer to farm peanuts in order to augment her yield on her .125 hectare of land. Kadiatou has been cultivating peanuts for its food-producing value, explaining that peanuts are directly consumable by the family and is used as a base sauce in food; it also has commercial value, as peanuts are a food she sells at the market. Kadiatou plans to use her increase in yield and profits toward her farming and business. Finally, Kadiatou hopes to be able to cover her children’s schooling fees as well as ensuring the family’s self-sufficiency in food.

loans.use: to get a packet of OPV seed and fertilizer to grow peanuts and benefit from myAgro's training and farming techniques

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings which she will use to plant in her greenhouse as a modern method of farming

loans.name: Setou's Group

texts.fr: Setou qui se trouve sur la photo assise juste  devant tenant sa pochette, est membre d’un groupe de 16 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Koflani au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Setou, âgée de 65 ans, est la mère de 5 enfants, dont l'1 d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé. L'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille , ce qui a incité Setou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 60 ans. Setou cultive l'arachide, le mais,le sorgho sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles, d'engrais de qualité et d'herbicides. Setou entame sa troisième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrite en raison des engrais de qualité et des formations et techniques agricoles, ainsi que de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Setou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.5 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 60 ans que Setou cultive le maïs pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Setou planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage . Enfin Setou espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Setou is sitting at the front carrying her myAgro packet. She is member of a group of 16 crop farmers enrolled in myAgro, who live and work in the village of Koflani, to the southeast of Bamako, in Mali.

65-year-old Setou is the mother of five children, one of whom currently attends school. Agriculture enables her to ensure her family's self-sufficiency, which motivated her to practice this activity for the past 60 years.

Setou grows groundnuts, maize and sorghum on her parcel of land, but faces difficulties as a farmer such as the lack of agricultural equipment, quality fertilizers and herbicides. Setou is entering her third year with myAgro and renewed her application because of the quality fertilizers and the training in agricultural techniques.

This year Setou is making payments to buy from myAgro a package of OPV (Open Pollinated Variety) seeds and fertilizer to cultivate maize and increase crop yields on her 0.5 hectare plot (1.24 acres).

For the past 60 years Setou has cultivated maize for its production and commercial values. With increased yields and income Setou would like to raise livestock. Finally Setou also hopes to cover her children's school fees as well as build a family home.

loans.use: buy a package of OPV (Open Pollinated Variety) seeds and fertilizer, to cultivate maize and increase her parcel's agricultural productivity

loans.name: Setou's Group

texts.fr: Setou qui se trouve sur la photo au centre, elle porte un foulard blanc, est membre d’un groupe de 3 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro qui vivent et travaillent dans le village de Zelabougou au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Setou, âgée de 32 ans, est la mère de 6 enfants, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l’autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Setou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 18 ans. Setou cultive l'arachide, le mais sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Setou entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrite en raison des semences de qualité. Cette année Setou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 15 ans que Setou cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Setou planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Setou espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Setou is in the center of the photo wearing a white scarf. She is a member of a group of three crop farmers enrolled in myAgro who live and work in the village of Zelabougou, to the southeast of Bamako, in Mali.

32-year-old Setou is the mother of six children, two of whom currently attend school. The family tradition is anchored in the practice of agriculture, the main source of income and food self-sufficiency for the home. It is this ability to ensure her family's self-sufficiency that motivated Setou to practice agriculture since 18 years ago.

Setou grows groundnuts, but on her parcel of land faces difficulties as a farmer such as the lack of agricultural equipment and quality fertilizer. Setou is entering her second year with myAgro and renewed her application because of the quality of the seeds.

This year Setou is making payments to buy a bag of myAgro fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts, to increase crop yields on her 0.125 hectare plot (0.31 acres).

For the past 15 years Setou has cultivated groundnuts for its food value, explaining that groundnuts are directly edible by the family and used as a base for sauce in food preparations, and also for its productivity and commercial value.

With increased yields and income Setou would like to become a merchant. Finally Setou also hopes to cover her children's school fees as well as ensure her family's food self-sufficiency.

loans.use: buy a bag of fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.en: Arnaldo is a 48-year-old high school graduate and lives in Bago City. He is married to Minda, who works as a vendor of pork barbecue. Arnaldo used to work as a waiter, but he stopped because he wanted to cultivate their small portion of farm land in Bago. They have two children aged 17 and 14, in college and high school, respectively. Their total monthly family income of PHP 12,000 ($270) is not enough to provide even for their family’s basic needs. Thus, when Arnaldo qualified for the two-month call center training program offered by Bagosphere, he found hope that he can improve his family’s life in a few months. Arnaldo dreams of becoming a successful call center agent in a prestigious BPO company. Your tuition loan assistance might just make him reach that goal.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Hawa's Group

texts.fr: Hawa qui se trouve sur la photo arrêtant a gauche avec un enfant, est membre d’un groupe de 8 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de N'Gouraba au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Hawa, âgée de 30 ans, est la mère d'un enfant âgé de 15 ans qui est actuellement scolarisé.  L'amour de l'agriculture a incité Hawa à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 12 ans. Hawa cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, d'engrais de qualité et de terres cultivables. Hawa entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrite en raison du système de paiement. Cette année Hawa effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 7 ans que Hawa cultive l'arachide pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Hawa planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage de moutons. Enfin Hawa espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants .
texts.en:
Hawa, who is found on the left in the photo with a small child, is a member of a group of 8 farmers who have joined myAgro. The farmers live and work in N'Gouraba, south-west of Bamako in Mali. 

Hawa is 30 years old, married, and the mother of a 15 year-old-child, who is in school. 

A love for farming has led Hawa to do this work for 12 years now. She grows groundnuts on a piece of land, but she faces many challenges, including a lack of rain, quality fertilizer, and fertile land. 

Hawa started her second year with myAgro and re-joined because of their system of payment. This year, Hawa is making payments to buy myAgro fertilizer so that she can farm groundnuts and increase her yields on her .125 hectare of land. 

It has been seven years now that Hawa has been growing groundnuts for profit and sale. With increased yields, she is planning to start raising sheep.

Finally, Hawa hopes to also be able to cover her children's school costs.

loans.use: to receive a packet of fertilizer for growing groundnuts

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is a hard working mother who help her husband in gaining income. They plant vegetables and root crops that they sell in the local community. They were blessed with nine children and four of them are still studying. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, they aimed to expand their vegetable plantation business in order to earn high a higher income. 

Having inadequate capital, Mely is asking for an additional of PHP10,000.00 to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed in vegetable production. They are hoping that this financial assistance will enable them to improve their farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed in vegetable production

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Irene is 28 years old and has three children who are in school.

Irene has a personal care products business in the Philippines. Irene requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of personal care products.

Irene has been in this business for two years. In the future, Irene would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of personal care products so as to expand her business and income

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is single with four children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Florenda is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Florenda requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare part for the maintenance of her sewing machine and linen.

Florenda has been in this business for 5 years.  In the future, Florenda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare part for the maintenance of her sewing machine and linen

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 52 years old, married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lina requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Lina has been in this business for four years. In the future, Lina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry so as to improve his income and support his family of 9

loans.name: Benba's Group

texts.fr: Benba qui se trouve sur la photo au deuxième rang à gauche, portant un boubou vert, est membre d’un groupe de 16 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Djonon Kobile au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Benba, âgé de 35 ans, est le père de 4 enfants âgés de 1 à 13 ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Benba à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Benba cultive le mais, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, d'engrais de qualité et de semences de qualité . Benba entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison du système de paiement et des engrais de qualité. Cette année Benba effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 1 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 20 ans que Benba cultive le maïs pour sa valeur vivrière et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Benba planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage de bœufs et de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Benba espère aussi pouvoir construire une maison pour la famille ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Benba, appearing in the photo at the left in the second row and wearing a green boubou, is a member of a group of sixteen farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Djonon Kobile, southeast of Bamako, in Mali. He is 35 years old and the father of four children, aged 1 to 13, of whom two are currently in school. 

Benba is rooted in the family tradition of farming, the main source of income and food self-sufficiency at home. And it enables him to ensure self-sufficiency for his family. Thus, he has been encouraged to do this work for thirty years now. He grows corn and rice on his parcel of land. But, as a farmer, he must cope with difficulties, such as the lack of rain, quality fertilizers, and quality seeds. 

Benba is beginning his first year with myAgro and signed up because of the payment system and the quality fertilizer. This year, he is making payments to purchase a myAgro packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing corn, so as to increase his yields on his 1-hectare parcel of land. 

Benba has been growing corn for 20 years for its value as a staple food. They also have productive and market advantages. 

With greater yields and higher income, Benba is planning on raising beef and working in commerce. Ultimately, he also hopes to build a house for his family, as well as to ensure the family’s self-sufficiency in food.

loans.use: to acquire a packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing corn and to increase farm productivity

loans.name: Minata's Group

texts.fr: Minata qui se trouve sur la photo étant à gauche deuxième femme assise, est membre d’un groupe de 17 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Bekossokoro au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Minata, âgée de 48 ans, est la mère de 4 enfants âgés de 2 à 22 ans, et dont l'un d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, ont incité Minata à exercer cette activité. Minata cultive l'arachide, le riz, le maïs, et le maraîchage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Minata entame sa première année avec myAgro. Cette année Minata effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.5 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 10 ans que Minata cultive le maïs pour sa valeur vivrièr et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car le maïs est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Minata planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu de faire de l'élevage de moutons et d'étendre la surface cultivée. Enfin Minata espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Minata, who is the second woman seated from the left in the photo, is a member of a group of 17 farmers registered with myAgro, living and working in the village of Bekossokoro in the southeast of Bamako, Mali. Aged 48, Minata is the mother of four children aged from 2 to 22 years. One among them is presently enrolled in school. 

The family tradition is anchored in agricultural practice, the main source of income and food self-sufficiency of the home, which prompted Minata to practice this activity. Minata grows peanuts, rice, maize, and market vegetables on her plot, but like all farmers she has to face difficulties such as the lack of rain, of agricultural supplies, and of high-quality fertilizer. Minata is beginning her first year with myAgro. This year she is making payments to purchase a myAgro package of OPV (openly pollinated variety) seeds and fertilizer for growing maize so as to expand her yield on her plot of 0.5 hectares. 

Minata has been growing maize for 10 years for its value as food and also for its commercial value, since maize is a foodstuff Minata sells at the market. 

With the increased yield and income, Minata plans to raise sheep and expand her cultivated land. Finally, Minata also hopes to be able to cover school fees for her child and to ensure food self-sufficiency for her family.

loans.use: to acquire a package of OPV seeds and fertilizer to grow maize so as to increase the agricultural productivity of her plot.

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.fr: Mariam qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang, deuxième personne de la droite, portant une foulard noir et tenant une pochette myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 26 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Kersana au sud de Bamako au Mali. Mariam, âgée de 50 ans, est la mère de 6 enfants âgés de 15 à 33 ans, et dont l'un d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi le fait que l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, ont incité Mariam à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 20 ans. Mariam cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Mariam entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Mariam effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 15 ans que Mariam cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Mariam planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d’aider à couvrir les frais de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mariam, who is found in the first row, the second person from the right wearing a black scarf and holding a myAgro badge, is a member of a group of 26 farmers who have joined myAgro. These farmers life and work in the village of Kersana, south of Bamako in Mali. 

Mariam is 50 years old and is the mother of six children, aged from 15-33 years old. One of the children goes to school. 

Mariam has been farming for 20 years now, because it is a family tradition, it is a principal source of income and food source for the family, and also because it allows her to ensure her family's independence. She grows groundnuts on her piece of land, but she faces many difficulties, such as the lack of farming materials and quality fertilizer.

Mariam has started her second year with myAgro, and she re-joined because of the possibility of increasing her yields with the help of myAgro services. This year, Mariam will make payments to buy myAgro fertilizer to grow groundnuts in order to increase her yields on her 0.125 hectares of land.

It has been 15 years now that Mariam has grown groundnuts, because they can be eaten directly or used as a base for a sauce. They also have commercial value, because groundnuts are sold at the market.

Mariam plans, with an increase in yields and earnings, to help cover her children's school costs.

loans.use: to acquire fertilizer to grow groundnuts

loans.name: Nianaba's Group

texts.fr: Nianaba qui se trouve sur la photo arrêtant deuxième personne a gauche avec le drapeau de n'gasene en main, est membre d’un groupe de 11 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Beneko au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Nianaba, âgée de 68 ans, est la mère d'un enfant.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi son mariage avec un agriculteur, ont incité Nianaba à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 50 ans. Elle a mentionné que, "je suis la fille d'un brave cultivateur." Nianaba cultive l'arachide, le mil, le riz, le fonio sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériel agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Nianaba entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des formations et techniques agricoles, ainsi que de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Nianaba effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 30 ans que Nianaba cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Nianaba planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage de moutons et chèvres. Enfin Nianaba espère aussi pouvoir financer le mariage de son enfant.
texts.en:
Nianaba who is standing in the photo, second from the left, holding the banner of N'Gasene, is a member of a group of 11 farmers registered with myAgro, living and working in the village of Beneko, in the southeast of Bamako, Mali. Nianaba, aged 68, is the mother of one child. Agriculture is the anchor of family tradition, the principal source of income and of food self-sufficiency for the household. Those facts, along with being married to a agriculturalist, have moved Nianaba to practice agriculture for 50 years now.  She mentioned, "I am the daughter of a fine farmer."

Nianaba grows peanuts, millet, rice, and fonio (a local grain) on her plot but as a farmer, she has to face difficulties such as lack of rain, of farm supplies, and of high-quality fertilizer. She is beginning her first year with myAgro and she registered because of the system of payment and the training in agricultural techniques, as well as hoping to expand her yield through the services proposed by myAgro. 

This year, Nianaba is making payments to purchase a myAgro package of fertilizer for growing peanuts so as to expand her yield on her plot of 0.125 hectare. Nianaba has been growing peanuts for their value as a foodstuff for 30 years now. She explains the peanuts are directly edible for the family, are used as a base for sauces in cooking, and also have their commercial value, since peanuts are a foodstuff she sells in the market. 

Nianaba is counting on the increase in her yield and her revenue to raise sheep and goats. Finally, she also hopes to be able to pay for the wedding of her child.

loans.use: to acquire a fertilizer package for growing peanuts to expand the agricultural productivity of her plot

loans.name: Konimba's Group

texts.fr: Konimba qui se trouve au deuxième rang sur la photo, il tiens le drapeau de myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 16 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro qui vivent et travaillant dans le village de Marako au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Konimba, âgé de 46 ans, est le père de 3 enfants âgés de 8 à 35 ans. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l’autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Konimba à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 35 ans. Konimba cultive le mais, le sorgho sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Konimba entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrit en raison du système de paiement et de l'image positive de myAgro dans les villages avoisinants. Cette année Konimba effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.5 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 4 ans que Konimba cultive le maïs pour sa valeur vivrière. Konimba planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage de la volaille et de caprin. Enfin Konimba espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Konimba, who is found on the second row in the photo holding the myAgro flag, is a member of a group of 16 farmers who have joined myAgro. They live and work in the village of Marako, south-east of Bamako, in Mali. Konimba is 46 years old and is the father of three children, aged from eight to 35 years old.

Konimba has been a farmer for 35 years now, because it is a family tradition, it is a principal source of income, it provides food for the household, and it helps the family be independent. Konimba grows corn and sorghum on his piece of land, but he faces many challenges, especially a lack of rain, farming materials, and quality fertilizer.

Konimba has started his second year with myAgro, and re-joined because of their payment system and their positive reputation in the neighboring villages. This year, Konimba will make payments to buy myAgro OPV seeds and fertilizer to grow corn. With an increase in yields and earnings, he plans to start raising poultry and goats. 

Finally, Konimba wishes to cover his children's school fees and ensure his family's food independence.

loans.use: to acquire OPV (openly pollinated variety) seeds and fertilizer to grow corn and to benefit from myAgro's teaching and farming techniques

loans.name: Mon's Group

texts.fr: Mon qui se trouve sur la photo portant le maillot de barcelone avec un foulard rouge, est membre d’un groupe de 11 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Faraba (OUE) au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Mon, âgée de 35 ans, est la mère de 4 enfants, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Mon à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 15 ans. Mon cultive l'arachide, le mais sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Mon entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Mon effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 15 ans que Mon cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Mon planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Mon espère aussi pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Mon is pictured in the photo wearing a red and blue-striped jersey and a red scarf in her hair. She is part of a group of 11 farmers that is signed up for myAgro. She lives and works in the village of Faraba (OUE), which is located southwest of Bamako in Mali. 

Mon, who is 35 years old, is the mother of four children. Two of them go to school. The family tradition is anchored in the practice of agriculture, which is the main source of income and ensures dietary self-sufficiency for the household. This has motivated Mon to be a farmer for 15 years. 

Mon grows peanuts and corn on her parcel of land. As a farmer, she has to deal with  challenges like a lack of rain, farming equipment, and quality fertilizer. 

Mon is starting her first year with myAgro and signed up in order to increase her yield through their services.  This year, Mon is making payments to buy a pack of myAgro fertilizer for peanuts so that she can increase her yield on her 0.125-hectare parcel of land. 

Mon has been growing peanuts for 15 years for their production value—explaining that peanuts are directly consumable and can be used as a basic sauce in cooking. They are also profitable and command a good price at the market. 

With the increase in her yield and revenue, Mon plans to do more business. In closing, she hopes to secure her family’s dietary self-sufficiency.

loans.use: buy a packet of fertilizer to grow peanuts.

loans.name: Abdoulaye's Group

texts.fr: Abdoulaye qui se trouve sur la photo est le seul homme dans le groupe avec un chapeau, est membre d’un groupe de 15 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Bagnakoro au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Abdoulaye, âgé de 38 ans, est le père de 8 enfants, dont 4 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Abdoulaye à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 20 ans. Abdoulaye cultive le mais, le mil, le riz, le coton sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériel agricoles. Abdoulaye entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison des semences de qualité et des engrais de qualité, ainsi que de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Abdoulaye effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 13 ans qu’Abdoulaye cultive le maïs pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Abdoulaye planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage. Enfin Abdoulaye espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que construire une maison pour la famille
texts.en: Abdoulaye can be seen in the photo, he is the only man in the group and he is wearing a hat. He is a member of a group of 15 farmers who are registered with myAgro and who live and work in the village of Bagnakoro in the southeast of Bamako in Mali. Abdoulaye is 38 and has eight children, of whom four attend school at the present time. Farming is firmly entrenched in the family traditions, it is the principal source of income and enables the household to be self-sufficient for their food. This is why Abdoulaye has been in this profession for 20 years now. Abdoulaye grows corn, millet, rice and cotton on his plot, but as a farmer he must cope with difficulties such as droughts and the absence of farming materials. This is Abdoulaye's first year with myAgro. He registered with them because of the good quality of their seeds and the hope of being able to increase the crops of his products through the services that myAgro proposes. This year Abdoulaye will buy a packet of myAgro OPV seeds and fertiliser to grow corn in order to improve the production on his plot of 0.125 hectares. Abdoulaye has been growing corn for 13 years, for the profitable and commercially viable yield. With the increase in his production and his income, Abdoulaye plans to start livestock farming and to buy some farming materials. Finally, Abdoulaye also hopes to be able to cover cost of school fees for his children, and to build a house for the family.

loans.use: to obtain a packet of OPV seeds and fertiliser to grow corn.

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
O senhor Armando de 46 anos de idade é casado, trabalhador pai de 8 filhos dos quais 7 frequentam o ensino primário e 1 frequenta o ensino secundário vive na casa própria.
Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar, varroes, cimento, aros, blocos, chapas de zinco, areia , pedra para dar continuidade da sua obra construindo mais um quarto para os seus filhos.
O cliente tem como sonho concluir e ampliar a sua obra para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família, e abrir uma mercearia em casa para a sua esposa explorar.
Os principais desafios são financeiros, pretende tomar mais vezes o credito para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos.
texts.en:
Armando is 46 years old, married, works and is the father of eight children, seven of whom go to primary school and one goes to secondary school. He lives in his own home.

With this loan Armando plans to buy rods, cement, hoops, building blocks, zinc plates, sand and stones to continue building another room for his children.

This client's dream is to expand and complete his construction work so he can provide his family with a better home and open a grocery store in his house where his wife can work.

Armando's main challenges are financial. He plans to take out various loans to overcome his difficulties and reach his goals.

loans.use: With this loan Armando plans to buy rods, cement, hoops, building blocks, zinc plates, sand and stones to continue building another room for his children.

loans.name: Saadani Group

texts.en:
Godeser, who is in her mid 50s, is a widow with two grown-up kids.  She has been running a gengeduka for three years now.  She works from 7:30 am to 09 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Godester's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy a motorcycle, bought the out-of-stock items in her genge, started the duka business and has been able to pay back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to take care of herself, banked some in her bank account, loan repayment and covered household expenses.  

She will use this loan to increase the gengeduka stock and meet her customer's demand.  She dreams of selling her products at wholesale prices.  

Godester will share this loan with her loan group, Saadini, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the gengeduka stock and meet her customer's demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
