loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, maize seeds and manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and maize as well as beans seedlings for planting

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys 42 years old, supports a family of 5 members. 

She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 12 years earning an income of KES 10,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to stabilize her farming and increase her productivity by applying modern farming technology, especially the use of a greenhouse.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her hope is to lead a stable life.

loans.use: to stabilize her farming and increase her productivity by applying modern farming technology especially the use of a greenhouse

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 34 years old, is married to Andrew and supports a family of 5 members. 

She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 9 years earning an income of KES 14,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to improve her farming through adoption of modern farming technology especially greenhouse planting.This will help her raise more income to meet her family needs. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her hope is to better her life.

loans.use: to improve her farming through adoption of modern farming technology especially greenhouse planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize and beans seedlings as well as fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy quality and safe milk containers for transporting milk to market before it goes bad.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and maize seedlings for planting

loans.name: Edita

texts.es:
Edita tiene 52 años de edad, vive con su familia en el distrito de La Florida en una zona rural dedicada a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales ubicada en la provincia de San Miguel, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza, con más de 2 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio esta ubicado en su misma casa, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con clientela fija en la zona. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más cajas de cervezas para incrementar el stock de su negocio, esto le ayudará en la implementacion de su negocio para asi poder dar un buen servicio a los clientes lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Edita is 52 years old and lives with her family in La Florida, a rural area where inhabitants work in agriculture, business, and livestock. La Florida is located in San Miguel province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

Edita has been selling beer for more than 2 years. Her business is located in her house. She has experience in this business and regular customers from the area. She seeks a loan to buy more cases of beer to increase her supply for her business. This will help her run her business in order to provide good service to her customers, thus increasing her income which will allow her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more cases of beer to increase her supply for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain and service vehicle for transporting parcels

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, maize and beans seedlings for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers,maize as well as beans seedlings for farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy embroidery raw materials for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en:
Kelvin is 36 years old. He is married and has two children, whose ages are 7 and 5. Kelvin also provides support for his siblings. He has completed secondary school and works in the Zambian army. 

Kelvin has since started his own Zoona enterprise in order to provide his community with financial services. Before his business started, his community did not have access to financial services, as there are no banks or financial institutions. Kelvin states that his business has added value to the community because people no longer have to travel long distances to send and receive money. 

Kelvin is requesting a loan in order to provide mobile money transfer services to his community by purchasing a trading booth and having the electronic funds required for him to run his mobile money. He also hopes to expand his Zoona business into other unbanked communities. This will allow Kelvin to not only grow his business effectively but also further provide for his family.

loans.use: To provide mobile money transfer services to his community by purchasing a trading booth and having the electronic funds required for him to run his mobile money tranfer business

loans.name: Gonzaga

texts.en:
Gonzaga is a married man aged 30 years with one child who is six years old. He lives in rural setting with his family. He deals in bark cloth trading and supplements his family income with agriculture. He works seven days a week and each day he works for 12 hours.
He started his business in 2000 with the aim of getting money to increase family income. There was high demand of the bark cloth from the crafts makers and sellers in town.
 He has acquired this loan facility in order to buy more stock of the bark cloths from the farmers to boost his sales.
His clients are traders from capital city and his dream is to enlarge his business but his biggest challenge is lack of enough capital.
He describes himself as a hard working man.
He appreciates UGAFODE services.

loans.use: To boost the bark cloth business by buying more stock for processing and sell

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte is applying for a loan to support her studies for a year at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU). This is her story:

1. What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?

"I am currently doing my final year, completing my BA (Bachelor of Arts) specializing in business management and sustainability. I have enjoyed a mass of all the business courses as well as sustainability courses such as ecology, zoology, marketing, economics, and business law and ethics."

2. What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?

"After graduation I would like to work for a company that has a sustainability department, as this is what I am most passionate about."

3. Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?

"I was born on August 31st at Daveyton. I have two siblings who stay with my mother and my father. My father is unemployed and my mother works to support the entire family. My mother works as a temp in a number of retail shops. I am neither married nor a parent."

4. What do you like to do in your spare time?

"I am into outdoor sports that require a lot of physical stamina and endurance. I also enjoy literature such as novels and poetry."

5. How will a Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes?

"It will help me to pay my tuition fees and help pay for transport to travel to school."

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU).

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 33 years old. She is involved in fishing, fish selling, and also farming. She began this business to sustain her family and educate her children. 

Betty will use the loan to both buy more bags of silver fish as well as support her farming. Her clients are fish suppliers. Her challenge is weather, especially during the rainy season when the fishing and its transportation become impossible. 

Betty is hardworking, and she honestly appreciates UGAFODE and Kiva's support.

loans.use: to purchase silver fish and boost her fish business.

loans.name: Nieneba's Group

texts.fr: Nieneba qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang asseyant en deuxième position de la gauche avec la foulard noir, est membre d’un groupe de 15 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Banko au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Nieneba, âgée de 62 ans, est la mère de 9 enfants âgés de 25 à 40 ans, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l’autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Nieneba à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 7 ans. Nieneba cultive l'arachide, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, d'engrais de qualité et d'herbicides. Nieneba entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Nieneba effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 2 ans que Nieneba cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Nieneba planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu de faire de l'élevage. Enfin Nieneba espère aussi pouvoir financer le mariage de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Nieneba is sitting in the front row second from the left, wearing a black scarf. She is part of a group of 15 farmers who have partnered with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Banko, southeast of Bamako in Mali. 

Nieneba, age 62, is the mother of nine children aged 25 to 40, three of them currently in school. Her family's long-standing tradition in farming as the main source of revenue and food self-sufficiency for the household is why she started farming 7 years ago.    

Nieneba grows groundnuts and rice on her plot, but she faces challenges such as insufficient rain and a lack of good quality fertilizers and herbicides. This is her first year with myAgro; she signed up because of the potential to bolster her productivity through the services available. This year, Nieneba is buying one myAgro packet of OPV seeds and fertilizers to grow groundnuts and increase the yield of her 0.0625-hectare holding. 

Nieneba started growing groundnuts 2 years ago for its value as a commodity, as groundnuts are a profitable crop that she sells at the market.   

With an increase in productivity and revenue, Nieneba plans to start breeding animals. She also hopes to be able to finance her children’s weddings.

loans.use: to buy one packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizers to grow groundnuts and bolster her productivity.

loans.name: Korotimi's Group

texts.fr: Korotimi qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à droite, tenant la pochette, est membre d’un groupe de 20 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Korosso au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Korotimi, âgé de 32 ans, est la mère de 4 enfants âgés de 1 à 15 ans, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l’autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Korotimi à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 20 ans. Korotimi cultive l'arachide, le riz, le sésame, l'haricot, le petit poids de terre sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériel agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Korotimi entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison du système de paiement et de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Korotimi effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 15 ans que Korotimi cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Enfin Korotimi espère aussi pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Korotimi, who is on the right of the first row and showing the [myAgro] packet in the photo, is a member of a group of 20 farmers enrolled in myAgro. They live and work in the village of Korosso, to the south-east of Bamako, in Mali.

32-year-old Korotimi is the mother of four children from one to 15 years of age, three of whom currently attend school. The family tradition is anchored in the practice of agriculture, the main source of income and food self-sufficiency for the household, which  prompted Korotimi to practice this activity for over 20 years.

Korotimi cultivates groundnuts, rice, sesame, beans, and Bambara peas on his parcel of land, but as a farmer must face difficulties such as the lack of rain, agricultural equipment and high-quality fertilizers.

Korotimi is entering his first year with myAgro, and applied because of the payment system and the prospect of increasing his crop yields through services offered by myAgro.

This year Korotimi is making payments to buy a package of myAgro OPV (Open Pollinated Variety) seeds and fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts and increase the crop yield on his 0.0625 hectare plot (0.15 acres).

For the past 15 years Korotimi has been cultivating groundnuts for its food value, explaining that groundnuts are directly edible by the family and used as a sauce base in their diet, but also for its commercial value, since he sells groundnuts at the market.

Finally, Korotimi hopes to ensure his family's food self-sufficiency.

loans.use: IPO to acquire a packet of seeds and fertilizers for peanut crop for increasing agricultural productivity of his land

loans.name: Uzoma

texts.en:
Uzoma, 34, is married and a mother of two. She had a new baby two months ago, but that has not kept her from her daily palm oil milling, considering that this is the peak season.

Uzoma lives far from the mill where she works, so her goal is to buy a motorbike to use to travel from her home to the mill. She is receiving a 50,000 NGN loan from Kiva's field partner Nke Anyi Cooperative,to enable her purchase palm fruits and process for storage anticipating that her savings after her sales this year and next will give her enough money to own one.

Uzoma wishes to thank all those lenders who show interest in her dreams and supports her loan.

loans.use: The sum of 50,000 Naira loan will help Uzoma to store palm oil products.

loans.name: Imani Mutiume Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Jane, 45 years old, married and a mother of five. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

She does maize and bean farming as her main business and also runs an early childhood development training (ECD). She has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management that has enabled her to improve her budgeting and record-keeping skills. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy quality fertilizer so that she can increase her output. This will assist her to cater to the family needs and pay school for the children. 

Jane is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy quality fertilizer that will boost output and thus have more profits to cater to the family's needs.

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.fr: Mariam qui se trouve sur la photo étant a droite deuxième femme  debout, est membre d’un groupe de 12 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Bekossokoro au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Mariam, âgée de 50 ans, est la mère de 10 enfants âgés de 1 à 14 ans, dont 5 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, ont incité Mariam à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 18 ans. Mariam cultive l'arachide, le maraichage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'herbicides. Mariam entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des engrais de qualité. Cette année Mariam effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 10 ans que Mariam cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Mariam planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage et d'étendre la surface cultivée. Enfin Mariam espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Mariam is pictured standing second from the right. She is part of a group of 12 farmers who are signed up for myAgro. They all live and work in the village of Bekossokoro to the southwest of Bamako in Mali. Mariam is 50 years old and the mother of 10 children between the ages of one and 14. Five of her children go to school. 

The family tradition is rooted in farming, and this is their primary source of revenue and dietary self-sufficiency. This motivated Mariam to be a farmer for 18 years.  Mariam plants peanuts and does market gardening on her land. As a farmer, she must confront challenges like lack of rain, farming equipment, and herbicide.

This is Mariam's first year with myAgro. She signed up with them on account of their payment system and their quality seeds and fertilizer. This year, Mariam is buying a packet of myAgro open-pollinated variety (OPV) seeds and fertilizer for peanuts in order to increase the yield on her 1/16 hectare plot of land. 

For 10 years now, Mariam has been planting peanuts for their food-producing value. She explains that peanuts are directly consumable and that they can be used as the base for sauces. They have high commercial value and do well at the market. 

With the increase in her yield and revenue, Mariam plans to begin livestock farming and expand the area of land that she plants on. In closing, Mariam hopes to cover her children’s schooling fees and ensure the dietary self-sufficiency of her family.

loans.use: buy a packet of open-pollinated variety (OPV) seeds and fertilizer to grow peanuts.

loans.name: Arimalala Juliette

texts.fr:
Arimalala est une femme impliquée et passionnée de son activité. Elle est couturière de formation. Elle commençait à se lancer  sur ce métier en 2009 , juste après l’achèvement de sa formation de 3 ans. Elle voulait mettre en pratique tout ce qu'elle a eu durant la formation et créer aussi son propre modèle.
Elle voudrait améliorer son activité. Elle voudrait ouvrir une boutique, acquérir une machine à coudre plus moderne avec moteur ayant plusieurs options.
Arimalala est mariée et elle a 36 ans et a deux enfants de 14 et 8 ans qui sont tous scolarisés.
texts.en:
Harimalala is a woman who is involved in and passionate about her work. A trained clothier, she began to launch herself into this trade in 2009, just after completing her three years of training. She would like to put into practice everything she had from her training and to create her own product. She would like to improve her business, open a shop, and acquire a more modern sewing machine with a multi-option motor. 

Harimalala is married and 36 years old with two children, aged 14 and 8, who are both in school.

loans.use: to purchase 50 meters of satin, 20 meters of plaid satin, and some accessories

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 19 years old. She lives with her mother and father in Lilongwe, Malawi. Getrude has always wanted to run her own business. She just finished training with Zoona so that she can start running her own Zoona mobile money transfer business in Lilongwe, Malawi. Getrude completed her high school education in 2013. She says her life will change once she starts running her own business because she will be able to provide for her basic needs and help out her family by buying groceries and paying for utility bills. 

Getrude needs a Kiva loan in order to start running her Zoona mobile money transfer business. The loan will be used to provide essential funds needed for her to serve her customers who need to access financial services. She will also use the loan to purchase a trading kiosk, a mobile phone, a chair, and a cash box. All these items are necessary for her to start her business. 

Getrude has big dreams for the future. Her dream is to run a successful business and take herself to school so that she can be able to re-take her high school examination. She would also like to own a car someday.

loans.use: to start running her own business so that she can serve people who need to access financial services.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 25 years old. He is very hardworking and determined. He runs his own Zoona mobile money-transfer agency in Machinjiri, Blantyre, Malawi. Emmanuel’s business provides financial services to people in his community. He has been running the business for a month.

Emmanuel is hopeful that his business will grow. He is happy that customers have already started sending and receiving money through him. He is requesting a loan so that he can pay for the kiosk he is currently using to serve his customers. The loan will also help him pay for the mobile phone, chair, cashbox, branding materials, and money that he uses to serve his customers. Zoona advanced him the working capital needed to start running his business.

Emmanuel is grateful for the opportunity to run his own business and become financially independent. He plans to use the anticipated profits to help improve the living standards at his parents’ house.

His biggest dream is to see his business succeed so that he can provide employment opportunities to other people in Malawi.

loans.use: pay for the trading kiosk, mobile phone, Chair, branding materials and cashbox and also provides him with the funds he needs to serve people who need access to financial services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and dairy feeds

loans.name: Zelia

texts.pt: A Senhora Zelia vive na casa dos pais com seus irmãos e dois filhos.  É comerciante, com o presente empréstimo vai adiquirir mercadorias nomeadamente palone, frangos, carnes de porco e vaca. Tem sonho de se tornar uma empresária de sucesso. O seu maior desafio é financieiro pelo que tem se empenhado bastante para poder suprir esta necessidade e no entanto almeja pagar o crédito sem entrar em moras de modo a poder levantar o outro.
texts.en: Zelia lives in her parents' house with her siblings and two children. She's a vendor and with the current loan she'll purchase merchandise such as bologna, chicken, pork and beef. Her dream is to become a successful entrepreneur. Her biggest challenge is financial, which is why she has been working very hard in order to overcome this struggle. Nevertheless, she hopes to repay the loan without delinquency so tha she can apply for another one.

loans.use: to purchase bologna, chicken, pork and beef.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk for more income gain

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more drugs to sell for additional income and to meet clients' demands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cereals seedling for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and maize seedlings for planting

loans.name: Venic

texts.en:
Venic is 30 years old and supports a family of three. 

She has been practicing farming for the last nine years, earning an income of KES 11,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

Venic plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. Her hope is to raise her income regularly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Vilma Isabel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Sagrado Corazón se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Vilma, tiene 65 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Vilma con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudar en los gastos del hogar  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatos por catálogos y bisuterías, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale en los ratos que esta mas desocupada, deja a crédito y cobra por semanas lo cual le ayuda ya que cuando cobra ella logra realizar nuevas ventas, lleva más de 6  años en su negocio el cual le permite ganar algo por ella misma y así sentirse independiente. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y bisuterías. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque la institución les brinda muy buenos  servicios. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
The community bank Sagrado Corazón meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are visited throughout the year and for being a city with unparalleled beauty with lots of tourist attractions. 

64-year-old Vilma lives in this place. She is married and has three adult children from the relationship. One of them lives in her house. Her husband is a driver. 

Vilma sells all types of clothing, shoes by catalog, and accessories in order to have her own income and help with household expenses. She sells door to door in her free time, leaving goods on credit and collecting weekly payments.  This helps her as when she collects payments she can make new sales.  She has worked in this business for 6 years which allows her to earn for herself and thus feel independent.  

She will use this loan to buy all types of clothes, shoes and accessories.  She has been with the group Sagrado Corazon since it began and she enjoys it as the institution provides them very good services.  Her dreams are to continue to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and accessories

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 64 years old,a father of three children who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He deals in cocoa farming and gets additional income from cocoa buying and selling and brick laying. He also grows and sell foodstuffs like maize, cassava, and beans to get more income for the family.

He works hard and has plans of educating his children, buying land, and expanding his cocoa growing. His main challenges are price changes, expensive labor, theft, and inadequate capital for expanding the business.

Julius intends to use the loan to hire cocoa gardeners for harvesting the cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to hire cocoa gardeners for harvesting the cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two additional professional sewing machines for her daughters.

loans.name: Hamse H.husein

texts.en:
Hamse is 28 years old and he lives in Hargiesa. He finished his University in 2011 and he studied IT. Hamse is married and he has two children.His shop sells dry foods such as rice,sugar and drinking. 

He works in his own business and he wants to get more goods to increase his income generating activity. He needs to expand his shop and to get more commodities and he requested a loan of $1,000 from Kaaba and now he is on the wait list. Kaaba will provide the goods as a loan, and Hamse will then make monthly repayments. In the future Hamse wants to expand his shop to a store.

loans.use: To buy more  goods to expand his shop.

loans.name: Zamadura

texts.pt:
O Senhor Zamadura vive numa casa propria com a esposa e três filhos.É segurança e alfaiate, com o presente  empréstimo vai adiquirir uma maquina elétrica de costura para melhorar os seus serviços. Tem como sonho ser um alfaiate reconhecido.
Sua maior dificuldade é financeira pelo que tem trabalhado tanto para poder supri-la
texts.en: Albino lives with his wife and three children in a house that he owns. He's a security guard and a tailor. With the current loan he'll purchase an electric sewing machine so that he can improve his services. His dream is to become a renowned tailor. His biggest challenge is financial, which is why he's been working so hard in order to overcome that.

loans.use: to purchase an electric sewing machine so he can improve his services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, maize and beans seedlings for planting

loans.name: Habi's Group

texts.fr: Habi qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à gauche, tenant une pochette myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 4 agricultrices inscrites à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Safe Koro au sud de Bamako au Mali. Habi, âgée de 65 ans, est la mère de 11 enfants âgés de 14 à 40 ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer,  ont incité Habi à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 55 ans. Habi cultive l'arachide, le sorgho, le maraîchage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Habi entame sa troisième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrite pour bénéficier des semences et des engrais de qualité.L'image positive de myAgro dans les villages avoisinants a aussi influé son choix de se réinscrire. Cette année Habi effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 55 ans que Habi cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation. Habi explique aussi que l'arachide au aussi une valeur commerciale non-négligeable, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle peut vendre sur le marché. Habi espère qu'avec l'augmentation de ses rendements,  elle pourra assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille ainsi que financer le mariage de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Habi, on the left in the photo holding a myAgro packet, is a member of a group of four farmers registered at myAgro, all living and working in the village of Safe Koro in southern Bamako in Mali. Habi is 65 years old and the mother of eleven children - aged from 14 to 40 years old, two of whom currently attend school.
A family tradition for agriculture - the main source of income and food for the family - has led Habi to work in the sector for the last 55 years. She grows peanuts, sorghum and kitchen vegetables on her plot, but as a farmer she has to cope with problems such as a lack of rain, of farming equipment and of quality fertilisers.
Habi is into her third season with my Agro, having re-registered due to the quality seeds and fertiliser, as well as the positive reputation of myAgro in the neighbouring villages. This year she is making payments to buy a myAgro fertiliser package for growing peanuts, in order to increase the yield on her 1,250m2 piece of land. Habi has been growing peanuts for 55 years for its food value, explaining that it is both eaten by the family as is, and also used as a basic sauce in food. It also has commercial value, being a food she sells at market.
Habi hopes that with her increased yield and higher income she will be able to ensure her family is self sufficient in food and to pay for her childrens' weddings.

loans.use: to get a fertiliser package for growing peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to boost the retail shop business by buying more items for sell

loans.name: Obaatan Pa Group

texts.en: Nana is a 50-year-old woman who lives in Akonfudi in the Assin North District in the Central Region of Ghana. She is a married woman with seven kids. The ages of her last two kids are 13 and 23 years old. Only two of her seven children are attending school. Farming is the main occupation for Nana. Nana has a cocoa plantation and has 16 years of farming experience. Her husband is also a cocoa farmer. She does not have any business that serves as her other source of income. The dry cocoa beans are sold to purchasing clerks who are also in the village. She became interested in the ELSA clean cookstove after the community education on deforestation and demonstration on how the clean cookstove works. The stove uses virgin pellets, which are waste material within her community. Nana has now decided to take a loan that will help her buy the stove and also save the family from trekking for a long distance in search of firewood for cooking. Nana thanks all her Kiva lenders for their kind support in helping to save their forest.

loans.use: to buy an ELSA stove.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 25 year old, married woman. She deals in animal sales and purchase with the support of her husband. 

Samina is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, health and clothing. 

Now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. 

She seeks to improve her standard of living thorough her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Thembeka

texts.en:
Thembeka is a 22 year old single mom of a 3-year-old son. Faced with unemployment after college, Thembeka has decided to start a small business selling shoes and other fashion accessories. 

It is this relentless attitude that sets Thembeka apart from most young women in her community. She hopes to inspire other young single mothers to become entrepreneurs. She is requesting for a Kiva loan to buy a container unit of shoes. She will then resell the shoes within her neighborhood. 

Thembeka sees a lot of potential in her business and plans to open three retail shops in the next five years.

loans.use: to buy a shoe container.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina runs a daycare center. The 58-year old mother of two says that she nurtures and prepares young minds to one day do great things.

She is full of energy and spends the time juggling between administration, teaching and is even at times involved in the cooking. Christina is requesting a Kiva loan to buy materials and pay for the construction of a kitchen. The current kitchen is an iron shack that has dilapidated over the years and is an eyesore sitting amongst the decent classrooms and well trimmed play yard.

Her ambition is to expand her business into an orphanage where she can teach and nurture children who don't have parents.

loans.use: to construct a kitchen

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Província de Maputo tem 32 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 3 filhos menores de idade, apenas 2 frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelas suas 2 sobrinhas e sua mãe que vivem em sua casa.
É docente a mais de 7 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência solicita o seu 2º empréstimo para adquirir material de construção como areia, cimento, varões e areia. Sendo que o primeiro foi para a mesma actividade. 
Futuramente pretende casar oficialmente e adquirir uma viatura.
texts.en:
This borrower was born in the province of Maputo. He is 32 and lives as the father of three young children, of whom two are in school. He is responsible for his two nieces and their mother, who live in his house.

He has been a teacher for more than seven years. He uses his income for the household expenses. In order to continue with the construction work on his home, he is applying for his second loan to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, and posts. The first loan was for the same activity. In the future, he plans to get officially married and acquire a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and posts.

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.en: Mukadas is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1983. She is living in a small town near the reservoir. She is married and has two children. From her young age, she has dreamed of being a tailor. She achieved her dream and now is tailoring in her area and serving Tajik women. She is sewing beautiful traditional women's dresses and has permanent customers every day. She does this business because she wants to be helpful and bring in money for the budget of her family. In order to work progressively, she needs a computerized sewing machine. This sewing machine will help her to sew more quickly with beads for design. She appealed to IMON and asked for help to buy a new computerized sewing machine. She awaits the Kiva lenders' kindness. In the photo, she is in profile because she is sick now and half of her face is swollen. That is why she is shy and requested that her photo be taken like that.

loans.use: to buy a new computerized sewing machine

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is 29 years old married woman. 

The man shown in the photo is Nazia’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it needs maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Nazia has availed a Murabaha loan of 30000 PKR, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires with some spare auto parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers.

loans.use: to buy new tires and spare parts for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita has always the enthusiasm of selling. She has a store outlet selling fruits. Recently, she applied a loan to buy more kilos of fruits to sell.  Carmelita knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for adding inventories to sell. In the future, Carmelita hopes to buy hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of different  fruits to sell and so she can save to buy a truck

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her husband's lathe machine and to  purchase cutting tools.

loans.name: Imtiaz

texts.en:
Imtiaz, age 35, is a hardworking, married woman. She is keen to provide her family with a better standard of living, which is why she started a business selling animals some years ago. 

She purchases small animals such as baby goats and calves, and after raising them for a year or two she sells them to the people of her locality. 

To expand her business, Imtiaz has availed herself of a 15000 PKR loan to purchase more baby goats and calves to increase her sales and earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves.

loans.name: Tehzeem

texts.en:
Tehzeem is a 35 year-old, married woman. She sells animals with the support of her husband. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. 

She makes enough money through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. 

Tehzeem needs to improve her business and has requested a Murabaha loan of PKR 25000 to purchase more cattle to increase her earnings to better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 32 year-old married woman with four children. Her family lives in a populated area.

Her husband is a market vendor and sells seasonal fruits from his place in a central bazaar and also from their home. He has five years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable providers. 

He chose this business because it is profitable and brings a stable income. People use fresh fruits every day and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of fruits. He wants to increase the stock on a daily basis so he can maximum fruits sold.

Samina applied for a loan to purchase more fruits to help her husband and to increase their monthly income.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal fruits for her husband's fruit selling business.

loans.name: Haitbi

texts.en:
Haitbi is a generous woman who is married with four children. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1960.

She has eight years of experience doing business in agriculture. Haitbi plants agricultural products in her yard. 

Haitbi is working hard to grow a great harvest come next season. 

She appealed to IMON and KIVA asking financial support from KIVA lenders to buy fertilizer to process her land. She hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to process her land.

loans.name: Bano

texts.en:
Bano is a 37 year old married woman. Sometimes ago, she decided to support her family by stitching clothes at her home as her husband has an income that is barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. 

She is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, Bano faces difficulty in covering daily expenses related to her business. 

Therefore, Bano has availed a Murabaha loan of 25000 PKR to purchase a new stitching machine along with threads, buttons and laces to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine along with threads, buttons and laces.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a married lady; she hand embroiders cloth. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her continue her operations, Khalida has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR  to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment; this will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. 

Khalida is hopeful to increase her income by gaining more customers. She dreams of a bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors and along with packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Tripona

texts.en:
Tripona is a hard-working and diligent mother. She has never tired of supporting her family, especially her grandchildren. Tripona is engaged in a snack vending business selling rice cakes. Her business is doing well and she doubles her time perfecting her own rice cake recipe. Tripona has maximized her profits and kept pursuing her goals for the good of her family. 

Tripona has taken out another loan from PMPC to buy additional raw ingredients for her rice cakes to serve more customers and be able to accept orders. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and that she will make another snack recipe to increase sales to continuously benefit her family, especially her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for her rice cakes to serve more customers and be able to accept orders

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for the maintenance of her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel operates a restaurant in Ronda, Cebu.  This has been her source of income for two years now.  She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for her dishes such as soy sauce, salt, cooking oil, pepper, seasoning, fish, meat, vegetables, packed fruit juice and soft drinks. 

Liezel usually profits PHP 6,000 per month, but she is aiming for more with the help of the loan. Her income will be for the education of her two children, ages 5 and 10. In the future, Leizel plans to introduce different menus to keep her customers coming.

loans.use: to buy soy sauce, salt, cooking oil, pepper, seasoning, fish, meat, vegetables, packed fruit juice and soft drinks

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca operates a transportation services. She is married with five dependents. Her youngest child is eight year old. Her husband has an income that helps to defray the family's daily needs. Francisca faces financial problem in order to finance her motorized transportation service.

Francisca is asking for a loan to buy a tire, fuel and to pay for maintenance. The loan would really boost the safety of her passengers and also promote a delay-free ride. It would improve her income. Slowly, Francisca could be able to handle her finances and start to expand her business. 

Francisca would do her best to successfully managed her business to become productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy a tire, fuel and pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia lives in Cebu with her family. She is 64 years old and like most people her age, Rogelia raises hogs. 

This business is easier to manage due to the proximity of the barns to her home. This has been her business for 15 years. Every four months, she usually earned PHP7000. 

Rogelia is asking for a loan to buy piglets, feed and supplements for her hogs. 

This will assure Rogelia healthy and fattened hogs that will give her a better return of investment. In the future, she hope to make expansions on the number of hogs to raise. Her income will be for food and savings.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and supplements for her hogs.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 33 years old. He is married with five children ages three to nine. For two years, he has been selling vegetables, like squash, lady finger, bitter gourd and string beans.  

He earn about PHP6000 per month from this business. Alexander is asking a loan of PHP5000 to buy more vegetables to sell. 

Alexander hope to expand and improve his business so he can make a good profit to afford to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy squash, eggplants and string beans.

loans.name: Faith Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photograph is Mary, 69 years old, married, and a mother of seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2013 to benefit from training, especially on enterprise development.

She practices subsistence farming growing maize and beans. She also makes and sells ropes and mats to supplement her income.  Mary is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more sisal to enable her to make more ropes for increased sales and income, and hence meet her customers’ demands. She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more sisal to enable her to make more ropes for increased sales and income, and hence meet customers' demands.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva is 45 years old and married. She lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. 

For the past five years, Genoveva has been a farmer. 

Genoveva is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. 

In the future, Genoveva hopes to expand her banana plantation.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. 

She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired in order to support for her family. 

Recently, Juliet availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, Juliet thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. 

Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a home appliance.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has run her sari-sari (variety) store for the past six years. 

She is 34 year old married woman with two children ages eight and 13. 

Hazel is asking for a loan to buy canned goods, soft drinks and rice. These items would filled her store and enable her to generate more earnings. Thus, her income will improve and Hazel would start to settle her obligations. 

With increased income, Hazel can provide for her family, with healthy diets and a better home to live in.

Hazel would like improve her livelihood by expanding her existing business and to be sustainable.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks and rice.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is from Badian, Cebu. She is 47 years old. She has two children ages sixteen and eighteen. 

For two decades now, Helen has operated a Sari-sari (general) store business attached to her home. She sell items like noodles, canned goods, coffee, shampoo, bath soap, detergent powder and chips. 

Helen is asking for a loan to buy items such as noodles, seasoning, shampoo, soy sauce, canned goods and snacks. 

In the future, Helen aspires to improve her livelihood and expand her business to gain more revenue.

loans.use: to buy noodles, seasoning, shampoo, soy sauce, canned goods and snacks.

loans.name: Seng Hean's Group

texts.en:
Seng Hean is ages 33 years old mother of a small child, living in Pursat province. To overcome her family’s hardship, she has been involved in rice farming for more than five years and she could earn about 79,000KHR per day. 

Due to having not enough funds to do farming, she is now leading a small group to take a new loan via VisionFund to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm. She hopes her current business will be expanded through this loan.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer in order to expand her farming business

loans.name: Jackielyn

texts.en:
Jackielyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jackielyn is 25 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jackielyn has a personal care products business in the Philippines. Jackielyn requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like perfume, body-lotion and other personal care products.

Jackielyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jackielyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like perfume, body-lotion and other personal care products.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 47 years old and has one child. Imelda is married and has one child who is in school.

Imelda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Imelda requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Imelda has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Imelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nageena

texts.en:
Nageena is a 31-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a simple housewife and her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly and thus her husband is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Therefore, Nageena has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Nageena is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to repair his rickshaw.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en: Naheed, age 32, is a married woman. Three years ago, she started her business selling animals with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. Currently, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase more baby goats to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats to increase her sales and profits

loans.name: Manizha

texts.en:
Manizha is a cheerful woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in a family of workers. 

She is married, living in small town with her family. Manizha is a college student studying finance. 

Manizha also works at hospital as an accountant. She tries her best to study hard and earn money to help feed her family. 

She needs a loan to pay her tuition and fees.

Manizha awaits KIVA lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to pay her college tuition costs.

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than, 47, lives in community of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a mother of two children. To make a living and support her family, she raises pigs and grows vegetable for sale. On average, she is able to make an income of USD10.00 a day.  She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. 

Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine for the health and well-being of her family

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena engages in gardening. She grows and sells beans. She is 46 years of age, married with six children, and from Talibon, Bohol. Her youngest child is 8 years old. Her husband is also a farmer.  

She is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizers, and materials like nylon and wire.  With these, Lorena's farming livelihood will improve. She will be able to grow more beans and be able to deliver them to her respective customers; thus enabling her income to grow and to be able to provide for the needs of her growing children. Lorena would like to expand her farming livelihood to improve their status of living.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizers and materials like nylon and wire.

loans.name: Paquita

texts.en:
Paquita is from Sindangan, Philippines. She is married and has five children. Paquita joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the co-op. The co-op supported her by providing the capital to start her retailing business, helping the family survive. Fortunately, she makes promising sales every day and is able to save from it. Paquita keeps on running the business well, to continuously provide for her family. She believes that with their support, they will keep going and sustain the business. 

Paquita wishes to have safe and comfortable living quarters, with a house constructed with a durable ceiling and walls. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy additional construction materials for the completion of her house, like bags of cement and floor tiles. Paquita wants nothing more than to live a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to buy additional construction materials for the completion of her house, like bags of cement and floor tiles

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Isaac is a single man, age 32, with two children who attend school. He lives in a rural area with the family and deals in cattle keeping and farming.

He has been in business since 1990 and works seven days of the week and 14 hours per day, He started the business to improve his family's income and to pay school fees for the children.

Isaac acquired the loan to purchase drugs for his cows and herbicides for his crops.

His hope for the future is to be the leading supplier of cows and food crops in his home village. His challenge is poor weather condition leading to poor pastures. 

Isaac describes himself as an honest and hardworking man.

loans.use: to purchase cattle drugs and herbicides.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice 29 years old, supports 4 family members. 

She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 9 years earning an income of KES 9,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizer and seedlings especially maize, beans and green-grams (moong beans).

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her hope is to lead a financially stable life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings especially maize, beans and green-grams (moong beans)

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, a 44-year-old married woman, has been involved in the business of cloth sales and purchases for many years. The man shown in the photo is her brother. Nasreen purchases cloth from the market at low prices and then sells it to the people of her locality. She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well being. 

For the improvement of her business, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth in various colors and designs, to fulfill the demands of her customers on time.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in various colors and designs to fulfill the demands of her customers on time.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 38 year old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her children study and her husband runs a medical clinic.

Nasreen's husband wants to purchase different types of medicines for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient funds her husband is not in position to buy these medicines for his business purpose. 

Therefore Nasreen has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will help her husband purchase these medicines and enable him to fulfill his business needs. 

The profits from the sales will help her family in the future.

Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her husband wanted to increase his medical clinic business.

loans.name: Dubis Ester

texts.es: Desde la comodidad de su hogar Dubis de 61 años dispuso de un espacio para exhibir en una vitrina detalles para toda ocasión y productos para el cuidado personal, esta emprendedora mujer hace siete años se incorporó a la venta de productos por catálogo animada por una amiga quien la ayudo a ingresar a este sistema de distribución comercial.  Hoy en día oferta cuatro catálogos en los que vende ropa exterior e interior, artículos para el hogar y productos cosméticos,  ella siempre está disponible para que sus vecinos, familiares y amigos lleguen a su casa para comprar un obsequio,  ropa o algún producto que necesiten para su uso diario.  La demanda por parte de sus clientes cada vez es mayor por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en unos encargos de productos como cremas, perfumes, cosméticos, ropa exterior y nuevo surtido para su vitrina.  Ella considera que surtirá su negocio con nuevos productos para que sus clientes se animen y compren nuevas referencias.  Su gran desafío ha sido ser madre cabeza de familia,  pero pese a las adversidades ha sido responsable del sustento de su hijo a quien desea continuar apoyando.
texts.en:
From the comfort of her home, Dubis, who is 61 years old, created a space to exhibit a display case of items for all occasions as well as personal care products.

Seven years ago, this entrepreneurial woman started incorporating catalog product sales. She was inspired by a friend who helped her to get involved in a retail distribution system. Now she offers products from four different catalogs from which she sells clothing and underwear, home products, and cosmetic products. She is always available to her neighbors, relatives, and friends who come to her house to buy a gift, clothing or some other daily use product that they need.

The demand from her customers is growing more and more, which is why she is applying for a Kiva loan. This is the first loan she has had with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to invest to fill orders for products like creams, perfumes, cosmetics, clothing, and new stock for her display case. She believes that supplying her business with new products so that her customers will be enticed and new customers will make purchases.

Her greatest challenge has been that of being the head of household, but despite the adversity, she has taken care of her son who she wants to continue to support him.

loans.use: to fill orders for products like creams, perfumes, cosmetics and clothing as well as new stock for her display case.

loans.name: Dúo Valles Del Sargento Group

texts.es:
Dúo Valles del Sargento
Dúo formado por María Gloria Florinda, ella es originaria del área de san Martin Jilotepeque. es una persona responsable y puntuale en sus pagos, María Gloria se dedica desde hace más de seis años a la elaboración de tejidos típicos ella no tienen crédito en otras instituciones y cuenta que está cumpliendo sus metas de tener más material para trabajar y así surtir mas sus negocios y por lo consiguiente tener más ganancias. Está agradecida por la ayuda que está recibiendo y desean siempre recibir el apoyo de Kiva y Fape.
texts.en: This duo includes Maria Gloria Florinda, from San Martin Jilotepeque.  She is very responsible and on time with her payments.  Maria Gloria had been doing typical weavings for more than six years.  She has not had previous loans from other institutions and says that she is meeting her goals of having more supplies to work with, so she can better stock her businesses, and have a better income as a result.  She is grateful for the help she is getting and hopes to always have support from Kiva and Fape.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Benita Agripina

texts.es:
La socia Benita Agripina pertenece al banco comunal  MILENIUM III.
La socia continua dedicándose  al negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez continua dedicándose  al negocio de manualidades, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes entre otros.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Benita Agripina is a member of the MILENIUM III communal bank.

She continues to raise small animals such as Guinea pigs and chickens and has been doing this for some time.  Things are going well for her thanks to the daily effort she puts into her business. She also continues to make crafts and wants to continue working this way so that she can support her family.
She is asking for a loan to buy Guinea pigs among other things.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy Guinea pigs.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene 02 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de arroz, yuca, maíz y al comercio de animales menores.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicios de jornalería contando con herramientas propias de trabajo, cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para realizar arreglos y mantenimiento a sus herramientas ya que se encuentran en mal estado, de esta forma podrá seguir desempeñando sus labores diarias en el campo y seguir brindando sus servicios, atendiendo la demanda de mano de obra que existe en esta zona, esto incrementará su nivel de ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 30 years old, married and has two children.  She lives with her family in the Oyotún, province of Chiclayo, within the Lambayeque region, along the northern coast of Peru.  The local residents farm; mainly rice, yucca, corn, and sell small animals.

She works as a laborer with her own tools, has more than five years’ experience in the business, and comes with good personal and professional references.  She is asking for a loan so she can repair and maintain her tools because they are in bad shape and this way she will be able to continue with her daily labor in the fields and continue providing services, meeting the labor demand, and increase her income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to repair her work tools.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés, de 63 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tiene 7 hijos pero solo tres dependen de él todavía, ya que nadie estudio.

Andrés, no tiene ningún tipo de negocio, pero se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura por más de 40 años, todo lo aprendió con sus padres, ya que cuando cosecha también vende maíz, la distancia que recorre para llegar hasta su lugar de trabajo es de dos kilómetros desde su casa.

Andrés, necesita el crédito para pagar el arrendamiento del terreno donde sembrará y para comprar sacos de abono sulfato y 1 saco de abono fórmula.

Andrés, sueña con mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Andres is 63 years old and has a second grade education.  His wife is a homemaker and they have seven children but only three still depend on him for support, since none went to school

Andres doesn’t have any type of business but has been working in farming for more than 40 years, having learned everything from his parents.  He raises and sells corn and he works 2 km from his home.

Andres needs a loan to pay rent on the land where he plants and also to buy sacks of fertilizer.

Andres dreams of improving his family’s life.

loans.use: to pay rent on land and buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Mashhura

texts.ru: Машхура 25 летняя жена и мать. У нее один 5 летный сыночек. Ее муж находится на заработках загранице, потому что он не нашел себе подходящую работу в стране. Машхура научила шить и кроить, когда она была школьницей. Она поставила в себе, стать хорошим и знаменитым портнихой. Сейчас она продвигает свою любимую работу до сегодняшнего дня. В швейном деле ей нравится ежедневный  доход, и сшить с удовольствием. Машхура потратила свои запасы на расходы. По причине нехватки финансов ей не удалось во время оплатить арендную плату за ателье. Ей срочно надо выплатить арендную плату, чтобы не потерять место деятельности.
texts.en:
Mashhura is a 25-year-old wife and mother. She has one five-year-old son. Her husband is working abroad because he wasn't able to find good work in their country. Mashhura learned to sew and tailor when she was in school and set herself the goal of becoming a good and well-known seamstress, and she has kept going in her preferred occupation until the present day. She likes the daily income from her sewing work and sews with pleasure.

Mashhura has spent her savings on expenses, and because of a lack of funds was unable to pay her studio rent on time. She urgently needs to pay her rent so she doesn't lose her place of work.

loans.use: to pay rent for her working space

loans.name: Aychurok

texts.ru: Айчурок успешно погасила свой кредит. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог в финансировании. В хозяйстве на сегодня есть 0,60 Га земельного участка, где она выращивает помидоры, перец, и есть 2 коровы. Айчурок вновь обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS), на который она купит овец для откорма. Доходы от кредита позволят Айчурок увеличить ее хозяйство и улучшить материальное состояние семьи.
texts.en:
Aychurok successfully paid off her previous loan. She is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who helped her financially. She currently has 0.6 hectares of land on her farm where she grows tomatoes and peppers. She also has two cows. 

Aychurok has approached Bai Tushum Bank again for a loan of 25,000 KGS to purchase sheep for fattening. Profits from the loan will allow her to expand her farm and improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy some sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 46 years old and has seven children.  Julie is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming water melon in the Philippines. Julie requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Julie has been farming water melon for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Julie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her water melon production

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase of fertilizers and other farm supplies.
 
She supplements this income with earnings from her pig fattening. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Cecilia dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice cultivation

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 36-year-old hardworking married man with four children aged one, two, five, and nine years. He sells produce alongside farming where he is able to look after his family using the proceeds. He intends to finish up his residential house but his limitation is the price fluctuation of agricultural output.

He is requesting a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil, living in Kamwenge, Uganda, used his previous loan to buy more cattle to sell. He still deals in the selling of cattle as his main source of income, though he also sells produce to earn extra income. He started these businesses in 2000 with an aim of earning a living and educating his children to higher learning levels. Jamil hopes to become a model farmer and reinvest in produce, though he faces the challenges of prolonged drought.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim, 37 years old, is a married woman. Her husband, shown in the photo, has been successfully running a shopkeeping business for many years. He offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, he need to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. Therefore Shamim has requested a Murabaha loan of PKR 25,000 for her husband to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, and juices to consistently meet customers’ demands in order to make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, and juices to consistently meet customers’ demands in order to make better earnings.

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en: Sokly, 43, is a mother of one child living in Kratie province. She has been a grocery seller for seven years and she could earn about 107,000 KHR per day. Due to her business not growing well, she is now lacking funds to buy more grocery items for resale, so she decided to apply for a loan via VisionFund to fulfill her need. She hopes to earn more money and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items

loans.name: George Willy

texts.en: George Willy is a 58-year-old married man living in Fort Portal Uganda. His business is working as a teacher and at the same time dairy farming where he rears cows. He faces challenges of high transport costs that hinder the expansion of his business. However, he has a vision of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. He has requested a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his farming activity through greenhouse planting so as to improve his family's living standards

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 42-year-old widowed mother of four children. Three years ago, and after her husband passed away, she started managing her husband's grocery shop to cover the needs and expenses of her children. She is a hard worker and a sacrificing mother who is trying desperately to develop her business. Thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new items and products to satisfy her customers' requests in the upcoming holy month Ramadan.

In the future, Lina hopes to expand her business more, to increase her income and stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new items and products to satisfy her customers' requests.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plot for rental construction in the area.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a 49-year-old married man with five children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He operates a business of livestock farming and motorcycle transport. He faces challenges of low market for his products and heavy rains that make roads impassible that hinder expansion of his transport business. Besides that, he has hopes of increasing his sources of income and having a happy family. William needs a loan to buy a new motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for his transport business

loans.name: Unique Valley Schools

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Daneth. He is the deputy head teacher of Unique Valley Primary & Secondary Schools, a mixed school in the rural area of Kasese with 1,400 students. Unique Valley Schools has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment systems with two 450 liter tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Unique Valley Schools will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Daneth ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from waterborne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bulls for fattening at the farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings, and maize and beans for planting.

loans.name: Fazliddin

texts.en: Fazliddin is a clever boy. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1995. He is single and lives with parents. He is a student and studies finance at University. He is well known among students and active at classes. During his education he tries to be educated. He wants to be a specialist and work in a bank. He appealed to IMON and Kiva lenders to get a loan to pay his tuition fee. He hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition fees in Finance, so that eventually he can enter the banking business

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is married and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda with his six children, two of whom attend school. 

Tom used the previous loan for his cocoa business, mainly buying and selling in the markets. He also gets additional income from rentals and lodge businesses. Tom started his business to raise income for his family and pay school fees for his children. His main challenge is inadequate capital. He hopes to expand his business and construct a residential house. 

Tom has asked for a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 41 years old and is married to Peris. He supports a family of 7 family members. 

Joel has been a farmer for the last 15 years and the business earns him an income of KES 11,000 per month. He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers and farm inputs so as to improve farming activity for better produce to sell in the market and meet client and family needs.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. Joel's hope is to be financially stable life and expand his agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and farm inputs so as to improve farming activity for better produce to sell in the market and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 42 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. 

Sajida's husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, because of which her husband is unable to generate any amount of income. Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money, her husband finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. 

Therefore, Sajida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Sajida is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw.

loans.name: Galacticas Group

texts.es:
Ignacia es una mujer de 41 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 17 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, paciente, buena oyente, responsable y muy trabajadora.
