Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ 3000’caracterizada por acoger a los sobrevivientes del desborde del río en el año 1983, los migrantes que llegaron desde las provincias y el resto del país se fueron asentando en esa zona que hoy tiene más del 20% del total de la población, cuenta con servicios básicos como; salud y educación. Es un distrito pobre, ubicado a 12 kilómetros de la ciudad. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Ignacia es de tez trigueña, ojos marrones, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, estatura mediana, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla (la cuarta de la derecha, viste blusa floreada lila y pantalón capri negro). Su vida la disfruta con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad por ampliar su negocio la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida, confección de sabanas, venta de perfumes, panadería, venta de poleras de algodón, venta de fruta y venta de carne, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, como; pantalones, poleras, camisetas, camisas, blusas, chompas, chamarras, etc., ella necesita abastecer su negocio con mayor variedad y cantidad de ropa para competir en el mercado, “tengo muchos proyectos en mente, el primero es consolidar mi negocio de ropa…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ropa se vende constantemente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para poder invertir y hacer crecer su negocio. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa para dejar de ambular, ella desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ignacia solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para abrir una tienda y ayudar a su hijo a terminar la escuela.
texts.en:
Ignacia, 41, lives with her husband and has a 17 year old son. She is a good mother - dedicated, patient, a good listener, responsible and very hard working. Her business is selling second-hand clothing. She started her business in the zone known as "Plan 3000", an area settled by the survivors of major river flooding in 1983. The migrants came in from the provinces around the country and settled in this zone that now has more than 20% of the total population. It is a poor district located 12 miles outside the city. It has basic services like healthcare and education. The climate is warm and subtropical, with daytime temperatures between 21 and 35 Celsius.

Iganicia is darker skinned with brown eyes and long brown hair tied back in a ponytail, of medium stature. Her native language is Guarani, which is spoken at home, and she speaks Spanish in the general public and in her business. In the picture, she is fifth from the right wearing a purple flowered blouse and black capris.

She enjoys her life with her partner, who works in construction, and her son who is in school.
They live in a room made of brick and cement. They have running water, electricity and sewage.

The need to grow her business is what made her join a community bank with members in businesses such as: food sales, sewing sheets, perfume sales, bakery, cotton t-shirt sales, fruit sales and meat sales. She wants to ask for a loan to improve her business activities. She sells second-hand clothing like pants, t-shirts, blouses, sweaters, jackets, etc. She needs to stock her business with a greater variety and quantity of clothing so that she can be more competitive in the market.

"I have a lot of projects in mind," she says, " the first being to strengthen my clothing business." The advantage of her business is that clothing sales are constant; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to invest back into her business and grow it. Her dream is to open up a clothing store so that she doesn't have to go door to door anymore. She wants to use the loan to buy second-hand clothing in bulk. This is her 3rd loan cycle with the institution in the three years she's been in business. This loan to buy clothing will help her to open her store and to help her son finish school.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing in bulk to open up a store, and to help her son finish school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goods and products to sell in her retail shop so as to earn a living from it.

loans.name: Hashim

texts.en:
Hashim is a married man with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. In addition to his retail shop which he has operated for three years to provide basic necessities for the family, he also ventured  into cocoa farming and fish selling. Price fluctuation and inadequate capital are the main hardships he is facing however his personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent house. His business goals are to buy land to grow crops and move his business to a more permanent location.

Hashim will use the loan to pay school fees for his sister.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his sister.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David used his previous loan to buy two improved breeds of cattle for milk production. He sells milk, and at the same time has a motorcycle transport business that provides him more income. He faces challenges of cattle diseases like the foot and mouth disease which kills his cows and also reduces milk production. However, he has a vision of having improved breeds of cattle in the farm. 

David needs a loan to buy two fresian cows.

loans.use: buy two fresian cows.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is 49 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of three daughters and her husband has been doing his own business of cattle farming for past five years; her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and managing the household.

Noor's husband wants to purchase animals for his business,  but due to financial constraints her husband is unable to purchase these cattle. Therefore, Noor has requested for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy these cattle to fulfill the needs of his business, this will also be good for him to earn maximum profitable income derived from his business.

For this financial assistance, Noor is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: help her husband to buy more cattle for his business.

loans.name: Sheela

texts.en:
Sheela is a 57 years old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her tree sons and two daughters. Her elder son has been running her own business of clothes selling for 10 years, He is required to earn enough to run the household.  He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her son is unable to purchase these clothes. 

Therefore Sheela is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her son can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 
Sheela is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her son's clothing business for the welfare of the family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods and products to sell in his retail shop so as to meet client needs.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
She is very hard working mother from the town of Talibon, Bohol. Her name is Marietta, she is 58 years old  married woman with two grown dependents. She runs a sari-sari(variety) store, selling various items ranging from biscuits, fruits, noodles, seasonings, soap and condiments. 

Marietta  is asking for a loan to buy a side car for her motor cycle and additional stocks for the store, like beverages, soft drinks, and condiments. It would enhance the stocks for her store and able to attract more buyers to come. Thus, she could now augment her income and be able to do some expansion.

 In the future, she hopes that, she would be successful in handling her business to improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy a side car for her motor cycle and additional stocks for the store

loans.name: Ronavil

texts.en:
Ronavil is 20 years old and is married with one child.

Ronavil works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, personal care products, home care products and other groceries.

Ronavil has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from fruit vending. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, personal care products, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 36-year old lady, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She lives in her home with her husband, two sons and two daughters. Her husband works in a firm for low wages.

Shumaila is a medical nurse by profession; she was doing this job in a hospital for the past fifteen years. Nowadays; she is running a maternity center at her home. She experienced and professional in her work, she has been dealing with many cases of pregnancy and has had many successful deliveries. She is a very famous nurse in her area and the ladies have full confidence in her abilities. 

She wants to keep her reputation stable and wants to establish a maternity center. Therefore, she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan so that she can buy an ultra sound machine, new medical instruments and equipment. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner’s BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an ultra sound machine and new medical instruments for her maternity center.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing for reselling by herself.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en: Roland is 49 years old. He lives in Kobuleti with his brother and his family. Roland is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has nut and mandarin trees and sells the harvest locally. As the income is only seasonal for Roland he decided to start a new business and requested a loan. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3,000 GEL. With the received credit Roland will purchase a stock of fruits and vegetables. He will start trading with his own minibus. Roland will be able to generate a stable income and he awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to begin trade in fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 35-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father of two sons and one daughter. 

Mohammad works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. He wants to improve his family living conditions but his income is barely covering all the family needs. Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for his house, which will help him to provide clean water especially for his kids.

Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his house.

loans.name: Elady Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Sagrado Corazón se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Elady, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos, dos mayores de edad y dos de 14 y 10 años que son los que aun viven con ellos y estudia en colegio y escuela. Su marido es jubilado.
Doña Elady es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar ya que su marido está jubilado y no gana mucho, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y zapatos por catalogo en sus ratos desocupadas, ella también tiene una pequeña granja en la cual cría  pollos que le dejan buenos ingresos, actualmente necesita del crédito para comprar uniformes e interiores ya que es la época de entrada a clases y es cuando más ventas hay de este tipo de prendas, ella lleva más de 20 años en esta actividad.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa interior y uniformes. Lleva 5 ciclos  en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The credit group Sagrado Corazón [Sacred Heart] gets together every 15 days in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are visited frequently at all times of the year, and for being a city of incomparable beauty with many tourist attractions.

Elady lives in this place. She is 47 years old, married, and from this relationship has 4 children, two who are now adults and two who are 14 and 10 years old and still live with them and study in school. Her husband is retired.

Elady is a woman who likes to work in order to help her husband with the household expenses, since now her husband is retired and does not make much money. She works in business, selling clothing and shoes by catalogue in her free time. She also has a small farm where she raises chickens, which provides her with a good income.

She currently needs the loan to buy uniforms and undergarments since this is the beginning of the school year and the time when there are the most sales of these types of garments. She has over 20 years in this business. The loan is to buy undergarments and uniforms.

She has completed 5 cycles in the credit group and she likes it because the loans are very helpful. Her dream is to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy undergarments and uniforms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lease more land so as to expand her farming activity.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 56 years old and is married with four children. With one child in school, Angelina works very hard to provide for her family.

Angelina runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 28 years and sells a variety of items such as garlic, onion, coffee, soap, salt, and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, home care products, personal care products and other groceries.

In the future, Angelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like condiments, home care products, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 49 years old, and is married with four children.

Marcelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store. She has borrowed and repaid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 29 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Marcelina aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Silver Stephen

texts.en: Silver Stephen used the previous loan to buy construction materials like timber and iron sheets to finish constructing his house. He is a salary earner and is looking forward to having a fully furnished house. He underestimated the construction of his house and didn't buy enough materials to complete it. He has asked for another loan to buy sand and cement for his house construction.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement for his house construction.

loans.name: Trust Rakai Group

texts.en:
Jane is a member of Trust Rakai Group and deals in retail business. She is a married woman and a mother of four schoolgoing children. She operates her retail business in a local trading center and is always trying to ensure good customer care for her customers. 

She needs a loan of 500,000 UGX to buy more stock for the retail business, i.e, soap, rice, corn flour, and sugar, among others. She believes that with the right capital her business will grow because she has a big clientele due to her good customer care skills. She hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot and build rental income to boost her income. She and her group members appreciate the work being done by the Kiva lenders through UGAFODE Microfinance.

She urges fellow group members to be resilient.

loans.use: To buy rice, corn flour, bread, sugar, and soap, among other items to boost her retail business

loans.name: Nyamiryango Wns Group

texts.en:
Yusta is a 51-year-old hard-working lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

She has a farming business, and at the same time does tailoring, in addition to selling second hand clothes. She started these businesses with a hope of employing herself and raising funds to educate her children. She has always complained of changes in fashion and designs of her customers that makes it hard for her to immediately buy what they demand for. Yusta has asked for a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesus tiene 39 años de edad, vive en casa propia en una comunidad rural dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de construcción civil, los trabajos los realiza en su distrito y zonas cercanas, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 15 años, además presenta muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo será para la compra de nuevas herramientas de trabajo así como para brindar mantenimiento a sus herramientas que se encuentran en mal estado, con esto el espera brindar mejores servicios a sus clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jesus is 39 years old and lives in his own home in a rural community dedicated to agriculture and livestock that is located in the Pucará district, Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

He works providing civil construction service. He carries out his jobs in his district and nearby zones. He has 15 years of experience in the field. In addition, he has many good personal and work references in his district.

The loan will be used to buy new work tools, as well as maintain his tools that are in poor condition. With this, he hopes to provide better services to his customers, which will allow him to increase his income and thereby improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy new work tools, as well as maintain his tools that are in poor condition.

loans.name: Mayra Alejandra

texts.es:
Mayra es una  joven ecuatoriana de 27 años de edad, nació en la ciudad de Latacunga perteneciente a la provincia de Cotopaxi en una zona urbana, este sector es muy reconocido ya que es conocido como un barrio de alta categoría por la ubicación que tiene pues se encuentra en el centro de la ciudad, vive en casa de los jefes ya que ella trabaja como niñera desde hace mas de cinco años, su familia vive en un sector rural de la ciudad terminó sus estudios primarios con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio de ellos, y al no poder seguir dándole para que siga estudiando Mayra tuvo que buscar primeramente trabajo para mantener a su pequeño hijo ya que es madre soltera.
Actualmente Mayra solicita un crédito para emprender con su negocio, el  mismo que se trata de la crianza de vacas.
Mayra ha sido padre y madre para su hijo, es muy trabajadora y responsable, esta actividad la aprendió de uno de sus hermanos que también se dedican a esta actividad, para ella ha sido muy difícil el tener que salir adelante sola sin el apoyo del padre de su hijo.
Mayra hace llegar un cordial y efusivo  agradecimiento a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal ya que con el dinero que le financiemos podrá cumplir con uno de sus mayores sueños trminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mayra is a young, 27-year-old Ecuadorian. She was born in the city of Latacunga, belonging to the province of Cotopaxi, in an urban zone. This area is very famous because it is known as a high category neighborhood for its location, which is in the center of the city. She lives in her employer’s home, since she has worked as a nanny for over 5 years. Her family lives in a rural area of the city. She finished her primary studies with a lot of effort and sacrifice from her family. And, no longer being able to afford her studies, Mayra had to first look for work in order to take care of her small child since she is a single mother.

Currently Mayra requests a loan to start her business raising cows. Mayra has been both father and mother for her child. She is very hardworking and responsible. She learned this business from one of her brothers who also works in this field.

It has been very difficult for her to have to get ahead alone without the support of the father of her child. Mayra conveys a friendly and warm thank you to Kiva for making the growth in her work and personal life possible, since with the money she will be able to achieve one of her greatest dreams to finish her studies.

loans.use: to start her business raising cows.

loans.name: Ramona Edilma

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Sagrado Corazón se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
Aquí vive la señora Ramona, tiene 47 años de edad, es divorciada y de esta relación tienen 8 hijos, seis mayores de edad y dos de 17 y 16 años que estudian en colegio y son los que aun  viven con ella.
Doña Ramona es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como granos, detergentes, carnes, legumbres, entre productos de primera necesidad, allí trabaja todos los días y los fines de semana le ayudan sus hijos ya que en estos días  ella también prepara meriendas, allí mismo en su tienda tiene espacio suficiente y en estos días instala un pequeño restaurante en la que sus clientes pueden degustar los deliciosos platos que ella prepara, tiene más de 5 años con el negocio el cual le permite ganar lo suficiente para darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar víveres para surtir su tienda y su restaurante.  Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The credit group Sagrado Corazón (or Sacred Heart) meets every 2 weeks in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that people love to visit all year round, and as a city of unsurpassed beauty with many tourist attractions. 

This is where Ramona lives. She is 47 years old and divorced, but her marriage produced 8 children. Six of them are already grown, and two are 17 and 16 years old, and attend school. These two still live with Ramona. 

Ramona is a woman who likes to work to get ahead. She has a grocery store in her home, where she sells all kinds of products such as grains, detergents, meat, and legumes, along with basic household items. She works there every day, and on weekends her children help her because on these days she also prepares food. Right there in her store she has enough space to install a small restaurant where customers can taste the delicious food she prepares. She has been running this business for over 5 years, and it allows her to earn enough to provide her children with a good education. 

She will use this loan to buy supplies to stock her store and restaurant. She has participated in 3 cycles with the loan group and likes it because the loans are fast and very helpful. 

Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies to stock her store and restaurant.

loans.name: Oneyda Maria

texts.es: El día a día de Oneyda empieza desde muy temprano en su negocio de comidas en compañía de su cónyuge e hijos, desde muy joven trabajo en diferentes restaurantes donde  adquirió la experiencia  necesaria para independizarse y ofrecer deliciosos platillos y especialidades a sus clientes que en su gran mayoría son transeúntes del barrio en el que reside ubicado al sur de Barranquilla.  Tiene trece años de experiencia elaborando comidas típicas de la Costa Caribe Colombiana; arroces, sancochos (sopas), carnes y ensaladas que sus comensales pueden disfrutar todos los días a partir de las 11 a.m., también ofrece comidas rápidas como perros calientes, sándwich, salchipapas y demás.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en la compra de víveres como de arroz, azúcar, aceite, carnes, legumbres y verduras.  Para Oneyda esta inversión es muy importante puesto que cada ingredientes  necesario en la preparación de sus comidas y para mantener la calidad y la cantidad necesaria para responder a la demanda.  Ella tiene 51 años y es madre de cuatro hijos, su meta familiar es tener su casa propia y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.  Su meta a futuro en su negocio es aperturar otras sucursales para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The day-to-day for Oneyda begins very early in her food business in the company of her husband and children. From the time she was very young, she worked in different restaurants where she acquired the necessary experience to become independent and offer delicious food and specialties to her customers, of whom the great majority are pedestrians in the neighborhood where she lives, located south of Barranquilla.

She has 13 years making typical foods of the Colombian Caribbean Coast, such as rice dishes, sancochos (soups), meats, and salads that her diners can enjoy everyday starting at 11:00am. She also offers fast food such as hotdogs, sandwiches, kebab, and more.

She is currently applying for a credikiva, the first loan that she has made with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in buying supplies such as rice, sugar, oil, meat, legumes, and vegetables. For Oneyda, this investment is very important since each ingredient is necessary in making her food and for maintaining the quality and quantity necessary to respond to the demand.

She is 51 years old and is the mother of four children. Her family goal is to have her own home and to be able to improve her quality of life. Her future business goal is to open other branches to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, sugar, oil, meat, legumes, and vegetables.

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly es una joven emprendedora de 19 años, creativa, detallista y con grandes cualidades para los negocios; en el 2013 decidió invertir su pequeño capital en artesanías en madera y comenzó a proponer a sus amigos y vecinos logrando un nivel de ventas importante que le permitió aumentar su capital y posteriormente viajar a San Jacinto, municipio conocido por sus artesanías donde realiza sus compras actualmente. Tomando en cuenta que hay un amplio mercado para temporadas como navidad, día de madres, amor y amistad, así como cumpleaños y aniversarios logró reunir una buena clientela con la que trabaja por pedidos de acuerdo al catálogo que diseñó para realizar sus ventas. Ella esta aplicando para su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el  invertirá en jarrones, frutas y esculturas de animales todo elaborado en madera. Ella espera que su negocio continué creciendo y a mediano plazo lograr su sueño de organizar su almacén que le permita un mejor nivel de vida para su familia y especialmente sacar adelante a su pequeña hija  y obtener su realización personal.
texts.en:
Kelly is a young entrepreneur: 19-years-old, creative, thoughtful, and with an excellent business sense. In 2013 she decided to invest her small capital in wooden handicrafts and began selling them to her friends and neighbors. The high level of sales she achieved allowed her to increase her capital and travel to San Jacinto, a city known for its handicrafts, where she now does her buying. 

Taking into account that there is a large market for holiday seasons such as Christmas, Mothers Day, Valentine’s Day, in addition to birthdays and anniversaries, she succeeded in establishing a solid group of clients, who place orders with her according to the sales catalogue she designed.  

She is applying for her first credikiva with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that she will invest in vases as well as fruit and animal sculptures, all made of wood. 

She hopes her business will continue to grow and in the medium term she can reach her goal of organizing her own store, which will provide a better standard of living for her family, and in particular provide for her young daughter and her own personal fulfilment.

loans.use: to buy wooden handicrafts: vases and sculptures of fruit and animals.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN ANTONIO DE PADUA-SAN SALVADOR.
La socia Juana alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de productos secos, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar quinua, trigo entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She is a member of the SAN ANTONIO DE PADUA-SAN SALVADOR communal bank.

Juana sells dry goods and has had this business for a long time and it’s going well, thanks to her daily efforts.  She sells her merchandise to customers who request it and she wants to continue working so that she can support her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy quinoa, wheat, and other things.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida belongs to a very poor family and has been living with her children hand to mouth. There is only one person who contributes to the household expenses. Her husband has grown old and most of the time stays at home idle.

For the time being, Zahida's son has been choosing temporary and seasonal jobs. Zahida has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son to have a permanent and constant source of income. She wants to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son but does not have enough cash to do so. Therefore, in addition to contributing her savings, Zahida requested a loan for her son so that he can buy a new rickshaw. She hopes that he will drive the  auto rickshaw with his full devotion and earn sufficient income.

Zahida is a 56-year-old married woman, living with her eight children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is very happy after receiving this loan and thanks Kiva and its Field Partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN ANTONIO DE PADUA-SAN SALVADOR.
La socia Maria Lourdes  alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She is a member of the SAN ANTONIO DE PADUA-SAN SALVADOR communal bank.

Maria Lourdes sells groceries and has had this business for a long time and it’s going well, thanks to her daily efforts.  She sells her merchandise to customers who request it and she wants to continue working so that she can support her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy rice, sugar, and other things.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Lurdes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA.
La socia continua  dedicándose  al negocio de venta de chicha, cerveza y también vende pollipapas,la socia lleva años dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta  forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollos, aceite entre otros.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
She is a member of the SEÑOR DE HUANCA communal bank.

She continues to sell chicha, beer, and chicken with potatoes and has done so for several years.  Things are going well for her, thanks to her daily efforts.  She sells her merchandise to customers who request it and she wants to continue working so that she can support her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy chickens, cooking oil, and other things.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy chickens and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario tiene 68 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyugue en el distrito de Cañaris, provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales principalmente.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café de variedad catimore, con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años y buenas referencias en su distrito. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes y mano de obra para su cultivo de café, esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también a tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosario is 68 years old and lives with his wife in a home of his own made of rustic material, in the Cañaris district, Ferreñafe province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.  The residents here mainly farm and raise livestock and other animals.

He is a farmer and raises catimore coffee and has 10 years’ experience and good references.  He will use the money from this loan for farm activities and applying sanitary products and fertilizers to his coffee crop and pay for labor.  This will help him have a better harvest, increase his production, and have a better product.  He will have no trouble selling it and the increased income will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Segundo Elias

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa familiar en una zona rural ubicada en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en esta comunidad es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales principalmente.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de reparación de autos, realiza esta actividad desde hace 05 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de nuevas herramientas para su taller ya que las que utiliza se encuentran en mal estado, esto le ayudará a brindar mejores servicios a su clientes con la finalidad de incrementar su nivel de ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Segundo is 28 years old, and he is in a common-law relationship. He lives with his family in a rural area located in the district of Oyotún, province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru. Life in this community is quiet and the inhabitants mainly work in agriculture, commerce, and raising animals. 
His occupation is car repair services, which he has had for 5 years. His business is located in his home. He asks for a loan to purchase new tools for his workshop, as the ones he has are in bad shape. This will help him bring better services to his clients with the goal of increasing his income level and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: tTo purchase new tools for his workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to supply more milk.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 32-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a retail shop selling general merchandise and he has been in this business since 2012. He also owns a mobile money shop for additional income. 

Joseph began the business in order to cater to his family's needs and become rich. However, Joseph is faced with the challenge of market competition.  Joseph is seeking credit to buy salt, rice, sugar, soap and other general merchandise to sell. He dreams of expanding his business and educating his children to the university level.

loans.use: to buy salt, rice, sugar, soap and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Lucie

texts.fr:
57 ans, mariée et mère de cinq enfants, Lucie est une femme travailleuse et débrouillarde. Elle ne se contente pas d'une seule activité source de revenu, elle ne cesse pas d'en chercher d'autres à effectuer.
Elle a cinq enfants dont deux étudient à l'université, deux collégiens et l'ainée déjà mariée.Elle s'acharne à exercer plusieurs business pour pouvoir soutenir ses enfants dans leurs études surtout en ce moment ceux qui sont universitaires qui sont actuellement en phase de préparer leurs mémoires.
Elle demande de crédit pour développer son gargote et comme nous pouvons voir sur la photo elle dirige aussi un commerce de friperie juste à côté.
C'est une femme ayant de l'esprit combattif. Son objectif est d'exploiter un vrai restaurant et elle lutte vraiment dur pour en arriver jusque là.
texts.en:
Lucie is 57 years old, married and has five children. She is a hard-working and enterprising person. She does not limit herself to a single business activity, but keeps trying to find new sources of revenue. 

She has five children: two of them study at the university, two are in secondary school, and the oldest one is already married. Lucie tries to keep multiple business activities going in order to support her children's education, especially now that her two children who are at the university are preparing their final theses. 

Lucie is requesting this loan in order to expand food stall business. As we can see in the photo, she also runs a second-hand store nearby.
She is a woman of undaunted spirit. Her goal is to be able to open a real diner, and she works very hard to make it a reality.

loans.use: to buy ingredients needed to cook food for sale (vegetables, meat, fish, one bag of white rice, spices etc).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks of material for making clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for the purchase of sodas, energy drinks, juices, among other products for her business.

loans.name: Bano

texts.en:
Bano is a 30-year-old woman, and she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his family. Bano also provides sewing services and earns income to contribute to managing the household.

Bano needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business purposes. However, due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she applied for a Kiva loan from its Field Partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services. Bano is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy accessories for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Yumira Heydi

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA.
La socia Yumira tiene 19 años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  a trabajar en una agencia de turismo, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta  forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar boletos entre otros.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
She is a member of the SEÑOR DE HUANCA communal bank.

Yumira is 19 years old, single, works for a tourist agency, and has done so for several years.  Things are going well for her, thanks to her daily efforts.  She sells her merchandise to customers who request it and she wants to continue working so that she can support her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy tickets and other things.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tickets.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA.
El socio Franflin tiene 28 años de edad y es soltero, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a ejercer su carrera de guía de turismo, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose   a su trabajo  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta  forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar boletos e ingresos.
El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
He is a member of the SEÑOR DE HUANCA communal bank.

Franklin is 28 years old, single, works as a tour guide and has done so for several years.  Things are going well for him, thanks to his daily efforts.  He wants to continue working so that he can support his family.

He is asking for a loan to buy tickets and admissions.

He is grateful to those who form part of this dream in this manner and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tickets.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila vive con su hija en casa propia en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayaltí y goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio y esta ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Luzmila se dedica a la actividad de servicio de costura de prendas de vestir, tiene más de 20 años de antiguedad en el negocio, el cual esta ubicado en su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de telas y materiales de costura para la confeccion de prendas de vestir, de esta manera ella espera hacer crecer más su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luzmila lives with her daughter in a home of her own, located in a large urban area of Cayalti.  She has good personal and professional references from her neighbors.  Her community is basically a farming, livestock, and merchant community located in the Cayaltí district of the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Luzmila is a tailor and has been for more than 20 years.  She runs her business out of her home and is asking for this loan to buy fabric and supplies in quantity so she can make more clothing, grow her business, increase her income, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es:
Dionicio tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa familiar con su hijo en el distrito de Oyotun, la cual es una zona rural dedicada al comercio y crianza de animales que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de peluches, juguetes, entre otros productos desde hace 02 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Solicita prestamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de juguetes, peluches y adornos para su negocio, esto con la finalidad de poder incrementar su negocio y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que incrementará sus ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dionicio is 48 years old and in a common law marriage.  He lives with relatives and his son in the Oyotun district, which is a rural community where the residents are merchants and raise animals.  It’s located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

He sells stuffed animals, toys, and other things and has for two years.  His business is out of his home and he has experience and good references in the district.  He is asking for a loan to buy toys, stuffed animals, and nic nacs for his business so he can provide better service to his customers and increase his income.  This will allow him a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy toys.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary and her husband are farmers in Peam Chhokouk, Cambodia. They have four children, one of whom works as a police officer in the community. Besides farming, Mary buys fish to smoke and sell in the market to earn extra money for the family.

During the day Mary and her husband work on their farm, while at night she works on smoking fish. She needs electrical power for night work and presently uses a car battery for energy. The battery, however, is not reliable. Sometimes it dies without warning. She has no choice then but to remain in the pitch dark until morning, which upsets not only the family's life but her business as well.

Now, though, Mary is applying for a 645 USD loan through Kiva's field partner Kamwork to buy a solar home system that will supply her business and her family with reliable energy. With this system she won’t have a concern about losing power anymore.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system

location.town: Peam Chhkouk Village, Peam Chhkouk Commune, Chhulk

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Sagrado Corazón se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 60 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero  de esta relación tuvo 5 hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos aun vive con ella. 
Doña María se dedica a  la venta de colas,  aguas, jugos, energizantes, bocaditos de picar y golosinas, entre otros, ella tiene un pequeño local en las afueras de la universidad local por lo cual sus ventas cada día son mejores, los estudiantes siempre visitan su local con lo cual ella logra vender sus productos y obtener las ganancias suficiente para salir adelante. Lleva más de 8 años con esta actividad.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar colas, jugos, aguas entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva más de 15 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella empezó su negocio que hoy le permite ganarse la vida. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The communal banking group "Sacred Heart" meets every two weeks in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular year round, as well as for its unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions. 

María lives in this town. She is 60 years old and her husband died several years ago. They had five children, who are all adults, but three of them still live with María. 

Maria sells sodas, flavored waters, juices, energy drinks, snacks and candies amongst other items.  She has a small stand which is located outside the  local university and for this reason her sales are better every day as the students always visit her stand.  With her stand she is able to sell products and gain sufficient earnings to move forward.  She has been doing this for more than 8 years.

This loan will be used to buy sodas, juice and flavoured waters amongst other products that she sells.  She has been with the Sacred Heart group more than 15 years; she likes it because the loans she has received have allowed her to start her business which today enables her to earn a living.  Her dreams are to continue moving forward.

loans.use: to buy sodas, juices, flavoured waters etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn Vanessa

texts.es: Actualmente Jocelyn tiene 22 años y es una tradicional ama de casa dedicada al cuidado y educación de sus 4 hijos; su historia en el mundo de los negocios se inició hace un año cuando decidió montar un negocio, emprendiendo un proyecto desde el hogar, con la idea de generar ingresos que le ayudaran a contribuir mejor a la economía de su casa, obtener  realización personal y ser un apoyo y soporte para su familia. Se dedica al comercio de ropa y calzado actividad que realiza de lunes a domingo promoviendo sus ventas con sus amigos y  vecinos desde la comodidad de su hogar.  En sus comienzos, contó con el apoyo de su conyuge quien le aportó el capital que necesitaba para la inversión  y en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en calzado, ropa, y artículos para el hogar.  Con esta inversión espera un incremento en las ventas y una mejora en sus ingresos que a largo plazo le permitan  tener los ahorros necesarios para obtener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Jocelyn is currently 22 years of age and is a traditional housewife dedicated to the care and education of her 4 children. Her history in the business world started a year ago when she decided to start a business, beginning a project from home, with the idea of generating income that would help her better contribute to her household economy, obtain personal achievement, and be the support for her family. She makes a living in the clothing and footwear business which she carries out from Monday to Sunday, promoting her sales with her friends and neighbors from the comfort of her home. 

In the beginning, she counted on the support of her spouse who would provide the capital needed for the investment. Now she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to invest in footwear, clothing, and household items. With this investment she expects an increase in the sales and an improvement in her income which, in the long term, will allow her to have the necessary savings to get her own home.

loans.use: to invest in footwear, clothing, and household items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his farming through modern farming technology.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. She has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.

She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her generate more income and be able to cater for the demand in her tailoring services.

loans.use: buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie, 38 year old married woman  with two children ages 14 and 18 year old respectively. She  engages in preparing snack food like Cutchinta- (a sticky rice cakes, reddish-brown in color, made from rice flour and served with shredded coconut)and  puto (rice flour cake) with cheese toppings. She resides in Getafe, Bohol.
She decided to take a loan to support her small livelihood.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for  food vending, like flour, sugar,cheese and leavening. These ingredients will be used in preparing a variety of snack food. Thus, she could now sell it to the local in her place. With these, her income will augment and able to handle her finances.  She could now continue support her children's needs and their respective schooling as well.

Jessie would like to expand her food vending business to be be productive and she is hoping that it would help improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food vending

loans.name: Garry

texts.en: Garry has operated an internet cafe business in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. This has been doing well for 12 years, supporting the needs of the family. Recently, he loaned an amount to purchase construction materials for the repair and improvement of his space for the safety and convenience of his customers. This will help him to continuously sustaining the needs of the family especially his children's education. He wants to expand his business and would be more happy to aspire to a commercial space in the city.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for the repair and improvement of his internet cafe for the safety and convenience of his customers

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is 52 years old and married with four children. 

Cirila is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Cirila requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Cirila has been in pig fattening for 31 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cirila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Neonita

texts.en:
Neonita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She earns a living by farming oyster in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her oyster farm

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store.

Neonita dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her oyster farm

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 42 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

Delia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business.

Delia has been in pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Delia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Joselita

texts.en:
Joselita is 44 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Joselita is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Joselita has been in pig fattening for 2 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 34 years old, married with two children.

Leonida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Leonida has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from clothing sales and frozen foods.

Leonida aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 48 years old and has five children. Dorothy is married and has five children who are in school.

Dorothy is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Dorothy requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Dorothy has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dorothy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 42 years old and married.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Marissa has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eleven years and also earns an income from food vending.

Marissa aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Crusum

texts.en: Crusum is a 36-year-old hardworking lady with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a business of retail and a tea room in addition to selling clothes. She faces challenges of limited capital that hinder the progress of her business. Besides that, she hopes to expand her business to new areas in order to gain more income. She has asked for a loan to buy wheat flour, cassava flour and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cassava flour and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Чамила молодая и миролюбивая девушка из северного культурного городка под названием Худжанд. Худжанд еще называют северной столицей Таджикистана. Чамила живет одна с мамой. Так же от мамы она получила талат шитья. Чамила очень талантливая девушка. Она создает все новые и новые платья и вкладывает в каждую из них кусочку своей души. Чамила хочет стать профессионалом своего дела и быть успешным человеком. Она не продвинется столь далеко, чтобы достичь своей цели, если у нее не будет хорошего оборудования. Ее швейная машинка старая, часто ломается в процессе работы и приносит много не удобств. Чамила с мамой копили деньги на более современную машинку, но все же достаточной суммы денег у них не оказалось. Чамила с разрешением матери обратилась за кредитом, надеясь на поддержку.
texts.en: Jamila is a young and peaceful woman from the northern cultural town by the name of Khujand. Khujand is also called the northern capital of Tajikistan. Jamila lives with her mother. She got her sewing talent from her mother too. Jamila is a very talented young woman. she creates new dresses every time and pours a piece of her soul into each one. Jamila wants to become a professional in her business and a successful person. She cannot advance quite as far to achieve her goal if she does not have good equipment. Her sewing machine is old, breaks down often during her work and causes a lot of inconveniences. Jamila and her mother have been saving money for a new sewing machine, but still do not have the needed amount of money. With her mother's permission, Jamila requested this loan, hoping for support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a 21-year-old single lady who started working two years ago in a company to cover her needs and expenses. Besides her work, she is still continuing her studies in university. She is a clever and ambitious lady who believes that a university certificate will guarantee her future. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her university tuition fees. 

Rima hopes to finish her studies and open her own business in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fees.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 31-year-old married man from Rafah. He is a father of two sons and one daughter. Muhammad works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. He wants to improve his family's living conditions, but his income is barely covering all the family needs.

Muhammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a water purification machine for his house. This will help him provide clean water, especially for his kids.

Muhammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: buy a water purification machine for his house.

loans.name: Sabrien Group

texts.en:
Sahar is the featured borrower of the Sabrien Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Sahar is a 34-year-old divorced mother of two children. She started five years ago selling perfumes and prepaid mobile cards from her house to cover her needs and expenses. Now she has a good reputation among her customers and she is well known among her region. Sahar is trying hard to develop her business. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of perfumes to satisfy her customers' needs. Sahar is the lady standing in the middle.

With respect to the other group members, Feda is the lady standing on the right of the photo, and Layla is the lady standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of perfumes

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel operates a motor cycle transportation services. Aside from that, she also engages in buying and selling of scrap iron, empty plastic bottles, and other scrap materials . She is a married with three children from ages 1,3 and 5 year old.  She needs capital to continue operate her livelihood.

She  is asking for a loan to buy scrap materials like empty plastic bottles and many others. With these , Maricel would be able to purchase variety of  scrap materials and she could deliver it on junk shops.  With the availability of resources , she could now start to expand and able to provide the needs of her younger children.

Maricel hopes that, her business will improve and sustainable as well, in order to be successful in  the coming future.

loans.use: to buy scrap materials like  empty plastic bottles and many other

loans.name: Ria

texts.en:
Ria is 36 years old, married with one child.

Ria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Ria has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from raising livestock and buying and selling ready to wear.

Ria aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a meat vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase more meat to sell in her meat stall for her meat vending business.

Vilma has been in this business for 19 years. Vilma earns more income from food vending.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to sell in her meat stall

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Janice is 37 years old and has four children who are in school.

Janice has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted item like blouse, etc. to sell for her business.

Janice has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Janice would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted item like blouse, etc. to sell for her business

loans.name: Ma. Emily

texts.en:
Ma. Emily is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Emily is 41 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ma. Emily has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Ma. Emily requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Ma. Emily has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Ma. Emily would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell for her buisiness

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

Amelita dreams that one day, She will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various laces for reselling from her husband's lace shop

loans.name: Qurbonbi

texts.en: Qurbonbi is a strong woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1967. She is living in a big city with her family. She is married and has two children. She has a dream to educate her children because, without an education, it is hard to find a job or do business. Her son is studying at a university. She and her husband do not earn enough money to pay his education fees. She appealed to IMON, asking for financial support to pay her son’s education. She hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay higher education costs.

loans.name: Edmars

texts.en: Edmars is a driver from Ozamiz. His business involves motor for hire or public transport. He does this work to support his children. He asked for a loan for motorcycle maintenance. Owning another motorcycle will increase his income and allow him to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 34-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her three sons. Her children are studying. Her husband has been running his business of selling clothes for two years. Her husband is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Kaneez is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband in purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn a maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.

Kaneez is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: purchase clothes in bulk for her husband's clothing business.

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en:
Zohra is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 10 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to maintain his taxi. Therefore, Zohra has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Zohra's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Zohra also plans to save the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Zohra is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Guillerma is 57 years old and has two children who are in school.

Guillerma has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Guillerma has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money in order to uplift her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cliff

texts.en: Cliff is a 35-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda, with one child. He has a mobile money business, and at the same time he owns rentals that add income. He faces challenges of limited capital, which hinders his business growth. However, he is looking forward to expanding his business to new areas. Cliff has asked for a loan to help him get more working capital to boost his mobile money business.

loans.use: get more working capital to boost his mobile money business.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 28-year-old married man from Dier El Balah. He is a father of one daughter. Muhammad works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low and unstable income. He wants to improve his family's living conditions, but his income is barely covering all the family needs. Muhammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a solar system for heating water for his house. This will help him provide hot water without using electricity.

Muhammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: buy a solar system for heating water for his house.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en: Rey is 29 years old from Ronda, Cebu. He is a single father to his two-year-old boy. He has spent his time in barns raising hogs for three years now. Rey earns 6,000 PHP every time he sells his fattened hogs. He is asking for a loan to buy more feed to support the feed requirement. This way, he can expect  healthy and fattened hogs to negotiate with and sell to the buyer. His income will provide food for his son, savings, and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy feed for his hogs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and other supplies

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso tiene 38 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge y dos hijos en el distrito de Colasay, una comunidad donde los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de café, realiza esta actividad desde hace 10 años por lo que cuenta con mucha experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos en su distrito. El crédito lo va a utilizar para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto el espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir incrementar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Alfonso is 38 years old. He lives in his own house with his spouse and two children in the district of Colosay, the inhabitants of which mainly make a living from agriculture. It is located in the province of Jaén in the region of Cajamarca, on the northern coast of Peru.

Alfonso makes a living by growing coffee. He has been doing this work for ten years, so he has a lot of experience in this business and has regular clients in his district. He is going to use the loan to buy compost and fertilisers for maintaining his coffee crops. By doing this, he hopes to offer better quality coffee to his clients, which will enable him to increase his earnings and improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilisers for maintaining his coffee crops

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Yomentoni Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA ESPERANZA YOMETONI, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Rupertina  tiene 27 años de edad  es separada y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias  dedicándose al negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma  salir adelante.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de animales y comida para los mismos.
Los  socios en general  se sienten agradecidos por el crédito y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Rupertina belongs to the “Nueva Esperanza Yometoni” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Echarate, which is in the province of La Convención and the department of Cusco.

Rupertina is 27 years old. She is separated from her husband and she has one child. She raises young animals for a living. She has had her business for a while and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business very day. She raises her young animals and then sells them to her clients. She wants to be able to continue working so she can get ahead in life.

She is requesting the loan to buy animals and animal feed.

All of the members of the communal bank are grateful for the loan and are committed to making their repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia Bernardina pertenece al banco comunal SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE.
La socia sigue dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen  tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia e la misma forma continua sigue dedicándose a la crianza de animales, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar abono, fertilizantes entre otros.
texts.en:
Bernardina belongs to the “San Martin de Zurite” communal bank. 

She continues to work in agriculture. She has had this business for a while and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day. She is a responsible and diligent person. She wants to continue raising animals so she can support her family.

Bernardina is requesting the loan so she can buy compost, fertilisers, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilisers, and other supplies

loans.name: Alberto

texts.pt:
O senhor Alberto é militar  tem 49 anos de idade, é pai separado de 5 filhos  dos quais 1 maior de idade e na sua casa própria , 4 frenquentando o ensino primário e secundário, vive na casa do serviço.
Com o valor do crédito pretende comprar cimento, areia, pedra varroes , para dar a continuidade a sua obra , fazendo chao , varanda e reboco .
Tem como sonho , concluir  a sua casa , passar a viver lá , fazer um negócio de estaleiro .
O seu maior desafio e a insuficiencia de fundos mas diz que ira solicitar mais empréstimos para tal vai pagar pontualmente .
texts.en:
Alberto, a soldier, is 49 years old and divorced. He has five children, one of whom is adult and lives on his own, and four of whom are in elementary and secondary school. He lives in military housing.
He will use this loan to buy cement, sand, stone, and rebar to continue the construction on his house, installing a floor, a porch, and plaster walls.
His dream is to finish his house and start to live there, and to start a shipyard business.
His biggest challenge is his lack of funds, but he says he will request more loans and pay them off on time.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, stone, and rebar to continue the construction on his house, installing a floor, a porch, and plaster walls.

loans.name: Albino

texts.pt:
O senhor Albino tem 39 anos de idade, casado, pai de 2 filhos, 1  a estudar outro ainda menor vive na casa própria, não sustenta mais ninguém além de seus filhos, actualmente trabalha como empacotador numa empresa do ramo agrícola da sua zona.
Com o valor do crédito pretende comprar cimento, areia, pedra varrões, para ampliar a sua casa  .  
O seu maior sonho, é ampliar a sua casa com mais uma cozinha fazer uma casa de banho melhorada.
O seu maior desafio e a insuficiência de fundos mas diz que irá solicitar mais empréstimos para tal, vai pagar pontualmente diz ainda que com os emprestimos anteriores conseguiu levantar a casa onde reside do tipo 1.
texts.en:
Albino is 39 years old and married. He has two children, one of whom is in school and the other whom is not yet old enough. He lives in his own home and is not financially responsible for anyone besides his children. He is currently working as a packer in a local agricultural company.
He plans to use this loan to buy cement, sand, stone, and rebar to expand his house.
His biggest dream is to expand his home with a kitchen and build a better bathroom.
His biggest challenge is his lack of funds, but he says he will apply for additional loans and pay on time. He says that his previous loans allowed him to build the house where he lives.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, stone, and rebar to expand his house.

loans.name: Amisse

texts.pt:
O senhor Amisse de 30 anos de idade, e comerciante, trabalhador, casado pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 frequentam o ensino primário e um ainda sem idade escolar, vive em casa própria.
Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar roupa usada (calcas e camisas para adultos) para reforçar o seu negocio.
O cliente tem como sonho, ampliar o seu negocio para responder as necessidades dos seus clientes, concluir sua casa  para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família.
O cliente tem como desafio os financeiros para tal tem trabalhado e pretende tomar mais vezes o crédito para suprir as suas dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos
texts.en:
Amisse is 30 years old and married. He is a worker and businessman and has three children, two of whom are in elementary school and one of whom is not yet of school age. He lives in his own home.
He plans to use this loan to buy secondhand clothing (shoes and shirts for adults) to bolster his business.
His dream is to expand his business to meet his customers' needs and to finish his house so he can offer his family a better place to live.
